the driver is assessed at 75 kg.\n\n\nThe liquid containing systems (except those for used water that must remain empty) are filled to 100 % of the capacity specified by the manufacturer.\n\n\nThe information referred to in points\u00a03.6(b) and 3.6.1(b) do not need to be provided for vehicle categories N2, N3, M2, M3, O3, and O4.\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For trailers or semi-trailers, and for vehicles coupled with a trailer or a semi-trailer, which exert a significant vertical load on the coupling device or the fifth wheel, this load, divided by standard acceleration of gravity, is included in the maximum technically permissible mass.\n\n\n(j)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u2018Coupling overhang\u2019 is the horizontal distance between the coupling for centre-axle trailers and the centreline of the rear axle(s).\n\n\n\n\n(k)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0In the case of a vehicle that can run either on petrol, diesel, etc., or also in combination with another fuel, items shall be repeated.\n\n\nIn the case of non-conventional engines and systems, particulars equivalent to those referred to here shall be supplied by the manufacturer.\n\n\n(l)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0This figure shall be rounded off to the nearest tenth of a millimetre.\n\n\n(m)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0This value shall be calculated (\u03c0 = 3,1416) and rounded off to the nearest cm3.\n\n\n(n)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Determined in accordance with the requirements of Regulation (EC)\u00a0No\u00a0715/2007 or Regulation (EC)\u00a0No\u00a0595/2009 as applicable.\n\n\n(o)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Determined in accordance with the requirements of Regulation (EC)\u00a0No\u00a0715/2007 of the European Parliament and of the Council\n12\n .\n\n\n(p)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The specified particulars are to be given for any proposed variants.\n\n\n(q)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0With respect to trailers, maximum speed permitted by the manufacturer.\n\n\n(r)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For tyres of category Z intended to be fitted on vehicles whose maximum speed exceeds 300 km/h equivalent information shall be provided.\n\n\n(s)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The number of seating positions to be mentioned shall be the one when the vehicle is in motion. A range can be specified in case of modular arrangement.\n\n\n(t)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u2018R-point\u2019 or \u2018seating reference point\u2019 means a design point defined by the vehicle manufacturer for each seating position and established with respect to the three-dimensional reference system as specified in Annex\u00a0III to UNECE Regulation No\u00a0125.\n\n\n(u)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For symbols and marks to be used, see paragraph\u00a05.3. of UNECE Regulation No\u00a016. In the case of \u2018S\u2019 type belts, specify the nature of the type(s).\n\n\n(v)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0These terms are defined in the standard ISO\u00a022628: 2002 \u2014 Road vehicles \u2014 recyclability and recoverability \u2014 calculation method.\n\n\n(x)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Dual-fuel engines.\n\n\n(x1)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0In case of a dual-fuel engine or vehicle.\n\n\n(x2)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0In the case of Type 1B, Type 2B, and Type 3B of dual-fuel engines.\n\n\n(x3)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Except for dual-fuel engines or vehicles.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nPART\u00a0II\n\n\n\n\nMatrix showing the combinations of the entries listed in Part\u00a0I within the versions and variants of the type of vehicle\n\n\n\n\n\nItem No\n\n\n\n\nAll\n\n\n\n\nVersion 1\n\n\n\n\nVersion 2\n\n\n\n\nVersion 3\n\n\n\n\nVersion n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nExplanatory notes\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A separate matrix shall be compiled for each variant within the type.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Entries for which there are no restrictions on their combination within a variant shall be listed in the column headed \u2018all\u2019.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The information specified in the matrix may be presented in an alternative layout or merged with the information provided in accordance with Part\u00a0I.\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Each variant and each version shall be identified by an alphanumerical code consisting of a combination of letters and numbers, which shall also be indicated in the certificate of conformity (Annex\u00a0IX) of the vehicle concerned.\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Variant(s) which fall(s) under Part\u00a0III of Annex\u00a0IV shall be identified by a specific alphanumerical code.\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX\u00a0II\n\n\nGENERAL DEFINITIONS, CRITERIA FOR VEHICLE CATEGORISATION, TYPE OF VEHICLE AND TYPES OF BODYWORK\n\n\nINTRODUCTORY PART\n\n\nDefinitions and general provisions\u00a0\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Definitions \n\n\n\n\n\n1.1.\n\n\n\n\n\u2018Seating position\u2019 means any location capable of accommodating one person seated who is at least as large as:\n\n\n(a) the manikin of the 50th percentile adult male in the case of the driver;\n\n\n(b) the manikin of the 5th percentile adult female in all other cases. \n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.2.\n\n\n\n\n\u2018Seat\u2019 means a complete structure with trim, integral or not with the vehicle body structure, which is intended to seat one person.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIt includes both an individual seat and a bench seat, as well as folding seats and removable seats.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.3.\n\n\n\n\n\u2018Goods\u2019 means primarily any movable things.\n\n\nIt includes products in bulk, manufactured goods, liquids, living animals, crops, indivisible loads.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.4.\n\n\n\n\n\u2018Maximum mass\u2019 means the \u2018technically permissible maximum laden mass\u2019 as specified in point\u00a02.8 of Annex\u00a0I.\n\n\n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0General provisions \n\n\n2.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Number of seating positions \n\n\n\n\n\n2.1.1.\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements regarding the number of seating positions apply to seats that are designed for use when the vehicle is travelling on the road.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.1.2.\n\n\n\n\nThey do not apply to seats that are designed for use when the vehicle is stationary and which are clearly identified to users either by means of a pictogram or a sign with an appropriate text.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.1.3.\n\n\n\n\nThe following requirements apply for the counting of the seating positions:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0each individual seat shall be counted as one seating position;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0in the case of a bench seat, any space having a width of at least 400 mm measured at the seat cushion level shall be counted as one seating position.\n\n\nThis condition shall not prevent the manufacturer from using the general provisions referred to in point\u00a01.1;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0however, a space as referred to in point\u00a0(b) shall not be counted as one seating position where:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the bench seat includes features that prevent the bottom of the manikin from sitting in a natural way - for example: the presence of a fixed console box, an unpadded area or an interior trim interrupting the nominal seating surface;\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the design of the floor pan located immediately in front of a presumed seating position (for example the presence of a tunnel) prevents the feet of the manikin from being positioned in a natural way.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.1.4.\n\n\n\n\nWith respect to vehicles covered by UNECE Regulations No\u00a066 and No\u00a0107, the dimension referred to in point\u00a02.1.3(b) shall be aligned with the minimum space required for one person in relation to the various classes of vehicles.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.1.5.\n\n\n\n\nWhen seat anchors for a removable seat are present in a vehicle, the removable seat shall be counted in the determination of the number of the seating positions.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.1.6.\n\n\n\n\nAn area intended for an occupied wheelchair shall be regarded as one seating position.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.1.6.1.\n\n\n\n\nThis provision shall be without prejudice to the requirements of paragraphs\u00a03.6.1 and 3.7 of Annex\u00a08 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a0107.\n\n\n\n\n\n2.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Maximum mass \n\n\n\n\n\n2.2.1.\n\n\n\n\nIn the case of a tractor unit for semi-trailer, the maximum mass to be considered for classifying the vehicle shall include the maximum mass of the semi-trailer borne by the fifth wheel coupling.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.2.2.\n\n\n\n\nIn the case of a motor vehicle that can tow a centre-axle trailer or a rigid drawbar trailer, the maximum mass to be considered for classifying the motor vehicle shall include the maximum mass transferred to the towing vehicle by the coupling.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.2.3.\n\n\n\n\nIn the case of a semi-trailer, a centre-axle trailer and a rigid drawbar trailer, the maximum mass to be considered for classifying the vehicle shall correspond to the maximum mass transmitted to the ground by the wheels of an axle or group of axles when coupled to the towing vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.2.4.\n\n\n\n\nIn the case of a converter dolly, the maximum mass to be considered for classifying the vehicle shall include the maximum mass of the semi-trailer borne by the fifth wheel coupling.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Special equipment \n\n\n\n\n\n2.3.1.\n\n\n\n\nVehicles fitted primarily with fixed equipment such as machinery or apparatus shall be regarded as N or O category.\n\n\n\n\n\n2.4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Units \n\n\n\n\n\n2.4.1.\n\n\n\n\nUnless otherwise stated any unit of measurement and associated symbol shall conform to the provisions of Council Directive 80/181/EEC\n13\n.\n\n\n\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Categorisation into vehicle categories \n\n\n\n\n\n3.1.\n\n\n\n\nThe manufacturer is responsible for the categorisation of a type of vehicle into a specific category.\n\n\nFor such purposes, all the relevant criteria described in this Annex shall be met.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.2.\n\n\n\n\nThe approval authority may request from the manufacturer appropriate additional information with the aim of demonstrating that a type of vehicle needs to be categorised as special purpose vehicle in the special group (\u2018SG Code\u2019).\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nPART\u00a0A\n\n\nCriteria for vehicle categorisation\u00a0\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Vehicle categories\n\n\nFor the purposes of EU and national type-approval, as well as for EU and national individual vehicle approval, vehicles shall be categorised according to the classification referred to in Article\u00a04.\n\n\nApproval can only be granted for the categories referred to in Article\u00a04(1).\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Vehicle subcategories\n\n\n2.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Off-road vehicles \n\n\n\u2018Off-road vehicle (ORV)\u2019 means a vehicle that belongs to category M or N, having specific technical features which permit its use off the normal roads.\n\n\nFor those categories of vehicles, the letter \u2018G\u2019 shall be added as suffix to the letter and numeral identifying the vehicle category.\n\n\nThe criteria for the subcategorisation of vehicles as \u2018ORV\u2019 shall be specified in section\u00a04 of Part\u00a0A.\n\n\n2.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Special purpose vehicles (SPV)\n\n\n\n\n\n2.2.1.\n\n\n\n\nFor incomplete vehicles that are intended to fall into the SPV subcategory, the letter \u2018S\u2019 shall be added as suffix to the letter and numeral identifying the vehicle category.\n\n\nThe various types of special purpose vehicles are defined and listed in section\u00a05.\n\n\n\n\n\n2.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Off road special purpose vehicle \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.3.1.\n\n\n\n\n\u2018Off road special purpose vehicle (ORV-SPV)\u2019 means a vehicle that belongs either to category M or N having the specific technical features referred to in points\u00a02.1 and 2.2.\n\n\nFor those categories of vehicles, the letter \u2018G\u2019 shall be added as suffix to the letter and numeral identifying the vehicle category.\n\n\nMoreover, for incomplete vehicles that are intended to fall into the SPV subcategory, the letter \u2018S\u2019 shall be added as second suffix.\n\n\n\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Criteria for the categorisation of vehicles in category N \n\n\n\n\n\n3.1.\n\n\n\n\nThe categorisation of a type of vehicle in category N shall be based on the technical features of the vehicle as referred to in points\u00a03.2 to 3.6.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.2.\n\n\n\n\nAs a matter of principle, the compartment(s) where all the seating positions are located, shall be completely separated from the loading area.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.3.\n\n\n\n\nBy way of derogation from the requirements of point\u00a03.2, persons and goods may be transported in the same compartment under the condition that the loading area is provided with securing devices designed to protect persons transported against the displacement of the load during driving, including severe braking and cornering.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.4.\n\n\n\n\nSecuring devices - lashing devices - intended for securing the load as required in point\u00a03.3 as well as partitioning systems, intended for vehicles up to 7,5 tonnes shall be designed in accordance with the provisions of sections\u00a03 and 4 of Standard ISO\u00a027956:2009 \u2018Road vehicles \u2013 Securing of cargo in delivery vans \u2013 Requirements and test methods\u2019.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.4.1.\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements referred to in point\u00a03.4 may be verified by a statement of compliance provided by the manufacturer.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.4.2.\n\n\n\n\nAs an alternative to the requirements of point\u00a03.4, the manufacturer may demonstrate to the satisfaction of the approval authority that the securing devices fitted show an equivalent level of protection as provided in the referred standard.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.5.\n\n\n\n\nThe number of seating positions excluding the driver\u2019s seating position shall not exceed:\n\n\n(a) 6 in the case of N1 vehicles;\n\n\n(b) 8 in the case of N2 or N3 vehicles.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.6.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.6.1.\n\n\n\n\nFor such purposes, the following equations shall be satisfied in all configurations, in particular when all seating positions are occupied:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0when N\u00a0=\u00a00:\n\n\nP\u00a0\u2013\u00a0M\u00a0\u2265\u00a0100\u00a0kg\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0when 0 \u00a0< N\u00a0\u2264\u00a02:\n\n\nP\u00a0\u2013\u00a0(M\u00a0+\u00a0N\u00a0\u00d7\u00a068)\u00a0\u2265\u00a0150\u00a0kg;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0when N\u00a0>\u00a02:\n\n\nP\u00a0\u2013\u00a0(M\u00a0+\u00a0N\u00a0\u00d7\u00a068)\u00a0\u2265\u00a0N\u00a0\u00d7\u00a068;\n\n\nwhere the letters have the following meaning:\n\n\n\u2018P\u2019 is the technically permissible maximum laden mass;\n\n\n\u2018M\u2019 is the mass in running order;\n\n\n\u2018N\u2019 is the number of seating positions excluding the driver\u2019s seating position.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.6.2.\n\n\n\n\nThe mass of equipment that is fitted to the vehicle in order to accommodate goods (e.g. tank, bodywork, etc.), to handle goods (e.g. crane, lift, etc.) and to secure goods (e.g. cargo securing devices) shall be included in M.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.6.3.\n\n\n\n\nThe mass of equipment that is not used for the purposes referred to in point\u00a03.6.2 (such as a compressor, a winch, an electric power generator, broadcasting equipment, etc.) shall not be included in M for the purposes of the application of the formulae referred to  in point\u00a03.6.1.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.7.\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements referred to in points\u00a03.2 to 3.6 shall be met for all variants and versions within the type of vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.8.\n\n\n\n\nCriteria for the categorisation of vehicles as N1.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.8.1.\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle shall be categorised as N1 when all the applicable criteria are met.\n\n\nWhen one or more of the criteria are not met, the vehicle shall be categorised as M1.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.8.2.\n\n\n\n\nIn addition to the general criteria referred to in points\u00a03.2 to 3.6, the criteria specified in points\u00a03.8.2.1 to 3.8.2.3.5 shall be met for the categorisation of vehicles for which the compartment where the driver is located and the load are within a single unit (i.e. bodywork \u2018BB\u2019).\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.8.2.1.\n\n\n\n\nThe fact that a wall or a partition, complete or partial, is fitted between a seat row and the cargo area shall not rule out the obligation to meet the required criteria.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.8.2.2.\n\n\n\n\nThe criteria shall be as follows:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the loading of the goods shall be possible by a rear door, a tailgate or a side-door designed and constructed for that purposes;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0in the case of a rear door or a tailgate, the loading aperture shall meet the following requirements:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0in the case the vehicle is fitted with only one row of seats or with only the driver seat, the minimum height of the loading aperture shall be at least 600\u00a0mm;\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0in the case the vehicle is fitted with two or more rows of seats, the minimum height of the loading aperture shall be at least 800\u00a0mm and the aperture shall show a surface of at least 12\u00a0800 cm2;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The cargo area shall meet the following requirements:\n\n\n\u2018cargo area\u2019 means the part of the vehicle located behind the row(s) of seats or behind the driver seat when the vehicle is fitted with only one driver seat;\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the loading surface of the cargo area shall be generally flat;\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0where the vehicle is fitted with only one row of seats or with one seat, the minimum length of the cargo area shall be at least 40\u00a0% of the wheelbase;\n\n\n(iii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0where the vehicle is fitted with two or more rows of seats, the minimum length of the cargo area shall be at least 30\u00a0% of the wheelbase.\n\n\nWhere the seats of the last row of seats can be easily removed from the vehicle without the use of special tools, the requirements regarding the length of the cargo area shall be met with all the seats installed in the vehicle;\n\n\n(iv)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the requirements regarding the length of the cargo area shall be met when the seats of the first row or of the last row, as the case may be, are upright in their normal position for use by the vehicle occupants.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.8.2.3.\n\n\n\n\nSpecific conditions for measurement\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.8.2.3.1.\n\n\n\n\nDefinitions\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u2018Height of the loading aperture\u2019, means the vertical distance between two horizontal planes tangent respectively to the highest point of the lower part of the doorway and the lowest point of the upper part of the doorway;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u2018Surface of the loading aperture\u2019 means the greatest surface of the orthogonal projection on a vertical plane, perpendicular to the centreline of the vehicle, of the maximum aperture permitted when the rear door(s) or tailgate is (are) wide open;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u2018Wheelbase\u2019, for the purposes of application of the formulae in points\u00a03.8.2.2 and 3.8.3.1, means the distance between:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the centreline of the front axle and the centreline of the second axle in the case of a two axle vehicle; or\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the centreline of the front axle and the centreline of a virtual axle equally distant from the second and third axle in the case of a three axle vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.8.2.3.2.\n\n\n\n\nSeat adjustments \n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The seats shall be adjusted at their rear outermost positions;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The seat back, if adjustable, shall be adjusted as to accommodate the three-dimensional H-point machine at a torso angle of 25\u00a0degrees;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The seat back, if not adjustable, shall be in the position designed by the vehicle manufacturer;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0When the seat is adjustable in height, it shall be adjusted to its lowest position.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.8.2.3.3.\n\n\n\n\nVehicle conditions\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The vehicle shall be in loaded conditions corresponding to its maximum mass;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The vehicle shall be with its wheels straight ahead.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.8.2.3.4.\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements of point\u00a03.8.2.3.2 shall not apply when the vehicle is fitted with a wall or a partition.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.8.2.3.5.\n\n\n\n\nMeasurement of the length of the cargo area\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0When the vehicle is not fitted with a partition or a wall, the length shall be measured from a vertical plane tangent to the rear outermost point of the top of the seat back to the rear internal pane or door or tailgate, in closed position;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0When the vehicle is fitted with a partition or a wall, the length shall be measured from a vertical plane tangent to the rear outermost point of the partition or the wall to the rear internal pane or door or tailgate, as the case may be, in closed position;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The requirements concerning the length shall be fulfilled at least along a horizontal line situated in the longitudinal vertical plane passing through the centreline of the vehicle, at the level of the load floor.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.8.3.\n\n\n\n\nIn addition to the general criteria referred to in points\u00a03.2 to 3.6, the criteria specified in points\u00a03.8.3.1 to 3.8.3.4 shall be met for the categorisation of vehicles for which the compartment where the driver is located and the load are not within a single unit (i.e. bodywork \u2018BE\u2019).\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.8.3.1.\n\n\n\n\nWhere the vehicle is fitted with an enclosure type body, the following shall apply:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the loading of the goods shall be possible by a rear door, a tailgate or a panel or other means;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the minimum height of the loading aperture shall be at least 800\u00a0mm and the aperture shall show a surface of at least 12\u00a0800\u00a0cm2;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The minimum length of the cargo area shall be at least 40\u00a0% of the wheelbase.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.8.3.2.\n\n\n\n\nWhere the vehicle is fitted with an open type cargo area, only the provisions referred to in points\u00a03.8.3.1(a) and (c) shall apply.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.8.3.3.\n\n\n\n\nFor the application of the provisions referred to in point\u00a03.8.3, the definitions in point\u00a03.8.2.3.1 shall apply. \n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.8.3.4.\n\n\n\n\nHowever, the requirements concerning the length of the cargo area shall be fulfilled along a horizontal line situated in the longitudinal plane passing through the centreline of the vehicle at the level of the load floor.\n\n\n\n\n\n4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Criteria for the sub-categorisation of vehicles as off-road vehicles \n\n\n\n\n\n4.1.\n\n\n\n\nM1 or N1 vehicles shall be subcategorised as off-road vehicles if they satisfy at the same time the following conditions:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0at least one front and at least one rear axle designed to be driven simultaneously irrespective of whether one powered axle can be disengaged;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0at least one differential locking mechanism or a mechanism having similar effect is fitted;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0they are able to climb at least a 25\u00a0% gradient as solo vehicle;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0they satisfy five out of the following six requirements:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the approach angle shall be at least 25\u00a0degrees;\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the departure angle shall be at least 20\u00a0degrees;\n\n\n(iii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the ramp angle shall be at least 20\u00a0degrees;\n\n\n(iv)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the ground clearance under the front axle shall be at least 180\u00a0mm;\n\n\n(v)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the ground clearance under the rear axle shall be at least 180\u00a0mm;\n\n\n(vi)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the ground clearance between the axles shall be at least 200\u00a0mm.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.2.\n\n\n\n\nM2, N2 or M3 vehicles the maximum mass of which does not exceed 12\u00a0tonnes shall be subcategorised as off-road vehicles if they satisfy the condition set out in point\u00a0(a) or both conditions set out in points\u00a0(b) and (c):\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0all their axles are driven simultaneously, irrespective of whether one or more powered axles can be disengaged;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0at least one front and at least one rear axle are designed to be driven simultaneously irrespective of whether one powered axle can be disengaged;\n\n\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0at least one differential locking mechanism or a mechanism having the same effect is fitted;\n\n\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0(iii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0they are able to climb a 25\u00a0% gradient as a solo vehicle;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0they satisfy at least five out of the following six requirements if their maximum mass does not exceed 7,5\u00a0tonnes and at least four if their maximum mass exceeds 7,5\u00a0tonnes:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the approach angle shall be at least 25\u00a0degrees;\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the departure angle shall be at least 25\u00a0degrees;\n\n\n(iii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the ramp angle shall be at least 25\u00a0degrees;\n\n\n(iv)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the ground clearance under the front axle shall be at least 250\u00a0mm;\n\n\n(v)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the ground clearance between axles shall be at least 300\u00a0mm;\n\n\n(vi)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the ground clearance under the rear axle shall be at least 250\u00a0mm.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.3.\n\n\n\n\nM3 or N3 vehicles whose maximum mass exceeds 12\u00a0tonnes shall be subcategorised as off-road vehicles if they satisfy the condition set out in point\u00a0(a) or both conditions set out in points\u00a0(b) and (c):\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0all their axles are driven simultaneously, irrespective of whether one or more powered axles can be disengaged;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0at least half of the axles (or two axles out of the three in the case of a three axle vehicle and three axles\u00a0in the case of a five axle vehicle) is designed to be driven simultaneously, irrespective of whether one powered axle can be disengaged;\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0there is at least one differential locking mechanism or a mechanism having similar effect;\n\n\n(iii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0they are able to climb a 25\u00a0% gradient as solo vehicle;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0they satisfy at least four out of the following six requirements:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the approach angle shall be at least 25\u00a0degrees;\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the departure angle shall be at least 25\u00a0degrees;\n\n\n(iii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the ramp angle shall be at least 25\u00a0degrees;\n\n\n(iv)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the ground clearance under the front axle shall be at least 250\u00a0mm;\n\n\n(v)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the ground clearance between axles shall be at least 300\u00a0mm;\n\n\n(vi)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the ground clearance under the rear axle shall be at least 250\u00a0mm.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.4.\n\n\n\n\nThe procedure for checking compliance with the geometrical provisions referred to in this section shall be set out in Appendix\u00a01.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Special purpose vehicles\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nName\n\n\n\n\nCode\n\n\n\n\nDefinition\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.1.\n\n\n\n\nMotor caravan\n\n\n\n\nSA\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle of category M with living accommodation space which contains the following equipment as a minimum:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0seats and table;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0sleeping accommodation which may be converted from the seats;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0cooking facilities;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0storage facilities.\n\n\nThis equipment shall be rigidly fixed to the living compartment.\n\n\nHowever, the table may be designed to be easily removable.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.2.\n\n\n\n\nArmoured vehicle\n\n\n\n\nSB\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle intended for the protection of conveyed persons or goods with anti-bullet armour plating.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.3.\n\n\n\n\nAmbulance\n\n\n\n\nSC\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle of category M intended for the transport of sick or injured persons and having special equipment for such purpose.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.4.\n\n\n\n\nHearse\n\n\n\n\nSD\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle of category M intended for the transport of deceased persons and having special equipment for such purpose.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.5.\n\n\n\n\nWheelchair accessible vehicle\n\n\n\n\nSH\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle of category M1 constructed or converted specifically so that they accommodate one or more persons seated in their wheelchairs when travelling on the road.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.6.\n\n\n\n\nTrailer caravan\n\n\n\n\nSE\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle of category O as defined in term\u00a03.2.1.3 of Standard ISO\u00a03833:1977.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.7.\n\n\n\n\nMobile crane\n\n\n\n\nSF\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle of category N3, not fitted for the carriage of goods, provided with a crane whose lifting moment is equal to or higher than 400\u00a0kNm.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.8.\n\n\n\n\nSpecial group\n\n\n\n\nSG\n\n\n\n\nA special purpose vehicle that does not enter in any of the definitions mentioned in this section.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.9.\n\n\n\n\nConverter dolly\n\n\n\n\nSJ\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle of category O equipped with a fifth-wheel coupling to support a semi-trailer with a view to converting the latter into a trailer.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.10.\n\n\n\n\nExceptional load transport trailer\n\n\n\n\nSK\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle of category O4 intended for the transport of indivisible loads that is subject to speed and traffic restrictions because of its dimensions.\n\n\nUnder this term are also included hydraulic modular trailers irrespective of the number of modules.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.11.\n\n\n\n\nExceptional load transport motor vehicle\n\n\n\n\nSL\n\n\n\n\nA road tractor or tractor unit for semi-trailer of category N3 meeting all the following conditions:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.12.\n\n\n\n\nMulti-equipment carrier\n\n\n\n\nSM\n\n\n\n\nAn off-road vehicle of category N (as defined in point\u00a02.3) designed and constructed for pulling, pushing, carrying and actuating certain inter-changeable equipment,\n\n\nIf the vehicle is equipped with an auxiliary load platform, its maximum length shall not exceed:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n6.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Remarks \n\n\n\n\n\n6.1.\n\n\n\n\nType-approval shall not be granted:\n\n\n(a) to converter dolly as defined in section\u00a05 of Part\u00a0A;\n\n\n(b) to rigid drawbar trailers as defined in section\u00a04 of Part\u00a0C;\n\n\n(c) to trailers in which persons may be carried when travelling on the road.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n6.2.\n\n\n\n\nPoint\u00a06.1 is without prejudice to the provisions of Article\u00a040 on national small series type-approval.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nPART\u00a0B\n\n\nCriteria for types of vehicle, variants and versions\u00a0\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Category M1\u00a0\n\n\n1.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Type of vehicle \n\n\n\n\n\n1.1.1.\n\n\n\n\nA \u2018type of vehicle\u2019 shall consist of vehicles that have the following features in common:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the manufacturer\u2019s company name.\n\n\nA change in the legal form of ownership of the company does not require that a new approval has to be granted;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the design and assembly of the essential parts of the body structure in the case of a self-supporting body.\n\n\nThe same shall apply to vehicles the bodywork of which is bolted on or welded to a separate frame;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.1.2.\n\n\n\n\nBy way of derogation from the requirements of point\u00a01.1.1(b), when the manufacturer uses the floor portion of the body structure as well as the essential constituent elements forming the front part of the body structure located directly in front of the windscreen bay, in the construction of different kinds of bodywork (for example a saloon and a coupe), those vehicles may be considered as belonging to the same type. Evidence thereof shall be provided by the manufacturer.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.1.3.\n\n\n\n\nA type shall consist of at least one variant and one version.\n\n\n\n\n\n1.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Variant \n\n\n\n\n\n1.2.1.\n\n\n\n\nA \u2018variant\u2019 within a type of vehicle shall group the vehicles that have the following construction features in common:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number of lateral doors or the type of bodywork as defined in section\u00a02 of Part\u00a0C when the manufacturer uses the criterion of point\u00a01.1.2;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the power plant with regard to the following construction features:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the type of energy supply (internal combustion engine, electric motor or other);\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the working principle (positive ignition, compression ignition or other);\n\n\n(iii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number and arrangement of cylinders in the case of internal combustion engine (L4, V6 or other);\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number of axles;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number, and interconnection of powered axles;\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number of steered axles;\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the stage of completion (e.g. complete/incomplete).\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0in the case of multi-stage built vehicles, the manufacturer and the type of the previous stage vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n\n1.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Version \n\n\n\n\n\n1.3.1.\n\n\n\n\nA \u2018version\u2019 within a variant shall group the vehicles that have the following features in common:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the technically permissible maximum laden mass;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the engine capacity in the case of internal combustion engine;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the maximum engine power output or the maximum continuous rated power (electric motor);\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the nature of the fuel (petrol, gas oil, LPG, bi-fuel or other);\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the maximum number of seating positions;\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0drive-by sound level;\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0exhaust emission level (for example Euro 5, Euro 6 or other);\n\n\n(h)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0combined or weighted, combined CO2 emissions;\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0electric energy consumption (weighted, combined);\n\n\n(j)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0combined or weighted, combined fuel consumption;\n\n\n(k)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the existence of a unique set of innovative technologies, as specified in Article\u00a012 of Regulation (EC)\u00a0No\u00a0443/2009.\n\n\n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Categories M2 and M3\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n2.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Type of vehicle \n\n\n\n\n\n2.1.1.\n\n\n\n\nA \u2018type of vehicle\u2019 shall consist of vehicles that have the following features in common:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the manufacturer\u2019s company name.\n\n\nA change in the legal form of ownership of the company does not require that a new approval has to be granted;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the category;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the following aspects of construction and design:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the design and construction of the essential constituent elements forming the chassis;\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the design and construction of the essential constituent elements forming the body structure in the case of a self-supporting body;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number of decks (single or double);\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number of sections (rigid/articulated);\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number of axles;\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the mode of energy supply (on-board or off-board);\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.1.2.\n\n\n\n\nA type shall consist of at least one variant and one version.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Variant \n\n\n\n\n\n2.2.1.\n\n\n\n\nA \u2018variant\u2019 within a type of vehicle shall group the vehicles that have all of the following construction features in common:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the type of bodywork as defined in section\u00a03 of Part\u00a0C;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the class or combination of classes of vehicles as defined in paragraph\u00a02.1.1 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a0107 (only in the case of complete and completed vehicles);\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the stage of completion (e.g. complete/incomplete/completed);\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the power plant with regard to the following construction features:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the type of energy supply (internal combustion engine, electric motor or other);\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the working principle (positive ignition, compression ignition or other);\n\n\n(iii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number and arrangement of cylinders in the case of internal combustion engine (L6, V8 or other).\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0in the case of multi-stage built vehicles, the manufacturer and the type of the previous stage vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n\n2.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Version \n\n\n\n\n\n2.3.1.\n\n\n\n\nA \u2018version\u2019 within a variant shall group the vehicles that have all the following features in common:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the technically permissible maximum laden mass;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the ability of the vehicle to tow a trailer or not;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the engine capacity in the case of internal combustion engine;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the maximum engine power output or the maximum continuous rated power (electric motor);\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the nature of the fuel (petrol, gas oil, LPG, bi-fuel or other);\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0drive-by sound level;\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0exhaust emission level (for example Euro IV, Euro V or other).\n\n\n\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Category N1\u00a0\n\n\n3.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Type of vehicle \n\n\n\n\n\n3.1.1.\n\n\n\n\nA \u2018type of vehicle\u2019 shall consist of vehicles that have the following features in common:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the manufacturer\u2019s company name.\n\n\nA change in the legal form of ownership of the company does not require that a new approval has to be granted;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the design and assembly of the essential parts of the body structure in the case of a self-supporting body;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the design and the construction of the essential constituent elements forming the chassis in the case of a non-self-supporting body;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.1.2.\n\n\n\n\nBy way of derogation from the requirements of point\u00a03.1.1(b), when the manufacturer uses the floor portion of the body structure as well the essential constituent elements forming the front part of the body structure located directly in front of the windscreen bay, in the construction of different kinds of bodywork (for example a van and a chassis-cab, different wheelbases and different roof heights), those vehicles may be considered as belonging to the same type. Evidence thereof shall be provided by the manufacturer.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.1.3.\n\n\n\n\nA type of vehicle shall consist of at least one variant and one version.\n\n\n\n\n\n3.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Variant \n\n\n\n\n\n3.2.1.\n\n\n\n\nA \u2018variant\u2019 within a type of vehicle shall group the vehicles that have the following construction features in common:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number of lateral doors or the type of bodywork as defined in section\u00a04 of Part\u00a0C (for complete and completed vehicles) when the manufacturer uses the criterion of point\u00a03.1.2;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the stage of completion (e.g. complete/incomplete/completed);\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the power plant with regard to the following construction features:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the type of energy supply (internal combustion engine, electric motor or other);\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the working principle (positive ignition, compression ignition or other);\n\n\n(iii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number and arrangement of cylinders in the case of internal combustion engine (L6, V8 or other);\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number of axles;\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number and interconnection of powered axles;\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number of steered axles.\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0in the case of multi-stage built vehicles, the manufacturer and the type of the previous stage vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n\n3.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Version \n\n\n\n\n\n3.3.1.\n\n\n\n\nA \u2018version\u2019 within a variant shall group the vehicles that have the following features in common:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the technically permissible maximum laden mass;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the engine capacity in the case of internal combustion engine;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the maximum engine power output or maximum continuous rated power (electric motor);\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the nature of the fuel (petrol, gas oil, LPG, bi-fuel or other);\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the maximum number of seating positions;\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0drive-by sound level;\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0exhaust emission level (for example Euro 5, Euro 6 or other);\n\n\n(h)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0combined or weighted, combined CO2 emissions;\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0electric energy consumption (weighted, combined);\n\n\n(j)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0combined or weighted, combined fuel consumption.\n\n\n\n\n\n4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Categories N2 and N3\n\n\n4.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Type of vehicle \n\n\n\n\n\n4.1.1.\n\n\n\n\nA \u2018type of vehicle\u2019 shall consist of vehicles that have the following features in common:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the manufacturer\u2019s company name.\n\n\nA change in the legal form of ownership of the company does not require that a new approval has to be granted;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the category;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the design and construction of the chassis that are common to a single line of product;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number of axles;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.1.2.\n\n\n\n\nA type of vehicle shall consist of at least one variant and one version.\n\n\n\n\n\n4.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Variant \n\n\n\n\n\n4.2.1.\n\n\n\n\nA \u2018variant\u2019 within a type of vehicle shall group the vehicles that have the following construction features in common:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the body structural concept or type of bodywork as defined in section\u00a04 of Part\u00a0C and in Appendix\u00a02 (only for complete and completed vehicles);\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the stage of completion (e.g. complete/incomplete/completed);\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the power plant with regard to the following construction features:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the type of energy supply (internal combustion engine, electric motor or other);\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the working principle (positive ignition, compression ignition or other);\n\n\n(iii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number and arrangement of cylinders in the case of internal combustion engine (L6, V8 or other);\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number and interconnection of powered axles;\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number of steered axles;\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0in the case of multi-stage built vehicles, the manufacturer and the type of the previous stage vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n\n4.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Version \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.3.1.\n\n\n\n\nA \u2018version\u2019 within a variant shall group the vehicles that have the following features in common:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the technically permissible maximum laden mass;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the ability or not to tow a trailer as follows:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an unbraked trailer;\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a trailer with an inertia (or overrun) braking system as defined in paragraph\u00a02.12 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a013;\n\n\n(iii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a trailer with a continuous or semi-continuous braking system as defined in paragraphs 2.9 and 2.10 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a013;\n\n\n(iv)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a trailer of category O4 that results in a maximum mass of the combination not exceeding 44\u00a0tonnes;\n\n\n(v)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a trailer of category O4 that results in a maximum mass of the combination exceeding 44\u00a0tonnes;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the engine capacity;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the maximum engine power output;\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the nature of the fuel (petrol, gas oil, LPG, bi-fuel or other);\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0drive-by sound level;\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0exhaust emission level (for example Euro IV, Euro V or other).\n\n\n\n\n\n5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Categories O1 and O2\u00a0\n\n\n5.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Type of vehicle \n\n\n\n\n\n5.1.1.\n\n\n\n\nA \u2018type of vehicle\u2019 shall consist of vehicles that have the following features in common:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the manufacturer\u2019s company name.\n\n\nA change in the legal form of ownership of the company does not require that a new approval has to be granted;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the category;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the concept as defined in section\u00a05 of Part\u00a0C;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the following aspects of construction and design:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the design and construction of the essential constituent elements forming the chassis;\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the design and construction of the essential constituent elements forming the body structure in the case of a self-supporting body;\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number of axles.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.1.2.\n\n\n\n\nA type of vehicle shall consist of at least one variant and one version.\n\n\n\n\n\n5.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Variant \n\n\n\n\n\n5.2.1.\n\n\n\n\nA \u2018variant\u2019 within a type of vehicle shall group the vehicles that have the following construction features in common:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the kind of bodywork as referred to in Appendix\u00a02 (for complete and completed vehicles);\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the stage of completion (e.g. complete/incomplete/completed);\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the type of braking system (e.g. unbraked/inertia/power).\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0in the case of multi-stage built vehicles, the manufacturer and the type of the previous stage vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n\n5.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Version \n\n\n\n\n\n5.3.1.\n\n\n\n\nA \u2018version\u2019 within a variant shall group the vehicles that have the following features in common:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the technically permissible maximum laden mass;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the concept of the suspension (air, steel or rubber suspension, torsion bar or other);\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the concept of the drawbar (triangle, tube or other).\n\n\n\n\n\n6.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Categories O3 and O4\u00a0\n\n\n6.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Type of vehicle \n\n\n\n\n\n6.1.1.\n\n\n\n\nA \u2018type of vehicle\u2019 shall consist of vehicles that have the following features in common:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the manufacturer\u2019s company name.\n\n\nA change in the legal form of ownership of the company does not require that a new approval has to be granted;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the category;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the concept of the trailer with relation to the definitions in section\u00a05 of Part\u00a0C;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the following aspects of construction and design:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the design and construction of the essential constituent elements forming the chassis;\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the design and construction of the essential constituent elements forming the body structure in the case of trailers with a self-supporting body;\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the number of axles.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n6.1.2.\n\n\n\n\nA type of vehicle shall consist of at least one variant and one version.\n\n\n\n\n\n6.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Variants \n\n\n\n\n\n6.2.1.\n\n\n\n\nA \u2018variant\u2019 within a type of vehicle shall group the vehicles that have the following construction and design features in common:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the kind of bodywork as referred to in Appendix\u00a02 (for complete and completed vehicles);\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the stage of completion (e.g. complete/incomplete/completed);\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the concept of the suspensions (steel, air or hydraulic suspension);\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the following technical features:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the capability or not for the chassis to be extendible;\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the deck height (normal, low loader, semi-low loader etc.);\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0in the case of multi-stage built vehicles, the manufacturer and the type of the previous stage vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n\n6.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Versions \n\n\n\n\n\n6.3.1.\n\n\n\n\nA \u2018version\u2019 within a variant shall group the vehicles that have the following features in common:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the technically permissible maximum laden mass;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the subdivisions or combination of subdivisions referred to in points\u00a03.2 and 3.3 of Annex\u00a0I to Council Directive 96/53/EC\n14\n into which the axle spacing between two consecutive axles forming a group belongs;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the definition of the axles in the following respects:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0lift axles (number and position);\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0loadable axles (number and position);\n\n\n(iii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0steered axle (number and position).\n\n\n\n\n\n7.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Common requirements for all vehicle categories \n\n\n\n\n\n7.1.\n\n\n\n\nWhen a vehicle falls into several categories because of its maximum mass or the number of seating positions or both, the manufacturer may select to use the criteria of one or the other vehicle category for the definition of the variants and the versions.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7.1.1.\n\n\n\n\nExamples:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a vehicle \u2018A\u2019 may be type-approved as N1 (3,5\u00a0tonnes) and N2 (4,2\u00a0tonnes) in relation to its maximum mass. In such a case, the parameters mentioned in category N1 may be used also for the vehicle that falls into category N2 (or vice-versa);\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a vehicle \u2018B\u2019 may be type-approved as M1 and M2 in relation to the number of seating positions (7\u00a0+\u00a01 or 10\u00a0+\u00a01), the parameters mentioned in category M1 may be used also for the vehicle that falls into category M2 (or vice-versa).\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7.2.\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle of category N may be type-approved against the provisions required for category M1 or M2, as the case may be, when it is intended to be converted into a vehicle of that category during the next step of a multi-stage type-approval procedure.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7.2.1.\n\n\n\n\nThis option shall only be permitted for incomplete vehicles.\n\n\nSuch vehicles shall be identified by a specific variant code given by the manufacturer of the base vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7.3.\n\n\n\n\nType-, variant- and version designations\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7.3.1.\n\n\n\n\nThe manufacturer shall allocate an alphanumeric code to each type of vehicle, variant and version, made up of Roman letters and/or Arabic numerals.\n\n\nThe use of brackets and hyphens is permitted provided they do not replace a letter or a numeral.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7.3.2.\n\n\n\n\nThe whole code shall be designated: Type-Variant-Version or \u2018TVV\u2019.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7.3.3.\n\n\n\n\nThe TVV shall clearly and unequivocally identify a unique combination of technical features in relation to the criteria defined in Part\u00a0B of this Annex.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7.3.4.\n\n\n\n\nThe same manufacturer may use the same code in order to define a type of vehicle when the latter falls in two or more categories.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7.3.5.\n\n\n\n\nThe same manufacturer shall not use the same code in order to define a type of vehicle for more than one type-approval within the same vehicle category.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7.4.\n\n\n\n\nNumber of characters for the TVV\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7.4.1.\n\n\n\n\nThe number of characters shall not exceed:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a015 for the code of the type of vehicle;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a025 for the code of one variant;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a035 for the code of one version.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7.4.2.\n\n\n\n\nThe complete alphanumeric \u2018TVV\u2019 shall not contain more than 75 characters.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7.4.3.\n\n\n\n\nWhen the TVV is used as a whole, a space shall be left between the type, the variant and the version.\n\n\nExample of such TVV: 159AF[\u2026space]0054[\u2026space]977K(BE).\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nPART\u00a0C\n\n\nDefinitions of types of bodywork\n\n\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0General\n\n\n\n\n\n1.1.\n\n\n\n\nThe type of bodywork referred to in section\u00a09 of Annex\u00a0I and Part\u00a01 of Annex\u00a0III as well as the code for bodywork referred to in item 38 of Annex\u00a0IX shall be indicated by means of codes.\n\n\nThe list of codes shall apply primarily to complete and completed vehicles.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.2.\n\n\n\n\nAs regards vehicles of categories M, the type of bodywork shall consist of two letters as specified in sections 2 and 3.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.3.\n\n\n\n\nAs regards vehicles of categories N and O, the type of bodywork shall consist of two letters as referred to in sections 4 and 5.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.4.\n\n\n\n\nWhere necessary (especially for the types of bodywork referred to respectively in points\u00a04.1 and 4.6 and in points\u00a05.1 to 5.4), they shall be supplemented by two digits.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.4.1.\n\n\n\n\nThe list of digits shall be laid down in Appendix\u00a02 to this Annex.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.5.\n\n\n\n\nFor special purpose vehicles, the type of bodywork to be used shall be linked to the category of the vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Vehicles belonging to category M1\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n\nRef.\n\n\n\n\nCode\n\n\n\n\nName\n\n\n\n\nDefinition\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.1.\n\n\n\n\nAA\n\n\n\n\nSaloon\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle defined in term\u00a03.1.1.1 of Standard ISO\u00a03833:1977, fitted with at least four side windows.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.2.\n\n\n\n\nAB\n\n\n\n\nHatchback\n\n\n\n\nA saloon as defined in 2.1 with a hatch at the rear end of the vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.3.\n\n\n\n\nAC\n\n\n\n\nStation wagon\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle defined in term\u00a03.1.1.4 of Standard ISO\u00a03833:1977.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.4.\n\n\n\n\nAD\n\n\n\n\nCoup\u00e9\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle defined in term\u00a03.1.1.5 of Standard ISO\u00a03833:1977.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.5.\n\n\n\n\nAE\n\n\n\n\nConvertible\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle defined in terms No\u00a03.1.1.6 of Standard ISO\u00a03833:1977. \n\n\nHowever, a convertible may have no door.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.6.\n\n\n\n\nAF\n\n\n\n\nMulti-purpose vehicle\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle other than AG and those mentioned in AA to AE intended for carrying persons and their luggage or occasionally goods, in a single compartment.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.7.\n\n\n\n\nAG\n\n\n\n\nTruck station wagon\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle defined in term No\u00a03.1.1.4.1 of Standard ISO\u00a03833:1977.\n\n\nHowever, the luggage compartment must be completely separated from the passenger compartment.\n\n\nIn addition, the reference point of the driver\u2019s seating position needs not to be at least at \n750\u00a0mm above the surface supporting the vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Vehicles belonging to category M2 or M3\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n\nRef.\n\n\n\n\nCode\n\n\n\n\nName\n\n\n\n\nDefinition\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.1.\n\n\n\n\nCA\n\n\n\n\nSingle-deck vehicle\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle where the spaces provided for persons are arranged in a single level or in a way that they do not constitute two superimposed levels;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.2.\n\n\n\n\nCB\n\n\n\n\nDouble-deck vehicle\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle defined in paragraph\u00a02.1.6 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a0107;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.3.\n\n\n\n\nCC\n\n\n\n\nSingle-deck articulated vehicle\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle defined in paragraph\u00a02.1.3 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a0107 with a single deck;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.4.\n\n\n\n\nCD\n\n\n\n\nDouble-deck articulated vehicle\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle defined in paragraph\u00a02.1.3.1 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a0107;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.5.\n\n\n\n\nCE\n\n\n\n\nLow-floor single-deck vehicle\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle defined in paragraph\u00a02.1.4 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a0107 with a single deck;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.6.\n\n\n\n\nCF\n\n\n\n\nLow-floor double-deck vehicle\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle defined in paragraph\u00a02.1.4 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a0107 with a double deck;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.7.\n\n\n\n\nCG\n\n\n\n\nArticulated low-floor single-deck vehicle\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle that combines the technical features of points\u00a03.3 and 3.5 of this table;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.8.\n\n\n\n\nCH\n\n\n\n\nArticulated low-floor double-deck vehicle\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle that combines the technical features of points\u00a03.4 and 3.6 of this table;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.9.\n\n\n\n\nCI\n\n\n\n\nOpen top single deck vehicle\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle with partial roof or without roof;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.10.\n\n\n\n\nCJ\n\n\n\n\nOpen top double deck vehicle\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle without roof over all or part of its upper deck;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.11.\n\n\n\n\nCX\n\n\n\n\nBus chassis\n\n\n\n\nAn incomplete vehicle with just chassis rails or tube assembly, power train, axles, that is intended to be completed with bodywork, customised to the needs of the transport operator.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Motor vehicles of category N1, N2 or N3\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n\nRef.\n\n\n\n\nCode\n\n\n\n\nName\n\n\n\n\nDefinition\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.1.\n\n\n\n\nBA\n\n\n\n\nLorry\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle that is designed and constructed exclusively or principally for conveying goods.\n\n\nIt may also tow a trailer.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.2.\n\n\n\n\nBB\n\n\n\n\nVan\n\n\n\n\nA lorry with the compartment where the driver is located and cargo area within a single unit;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.3.\n\n\n\n\nBC\n\n\n\n\nTractor unit for semi-trailer\n\n\n\n\nA towing vehicle that is designed and constructed exclusively or principally to tow semi-trailers;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.4.\n\n\n\n\nBD\n\n\n\n\nRoad tractor\n\n\n\n\nA towing vehicle that is designed and constructed exclusively to tow trailers other than semi-trailers;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.5.\n\n\n\n\nBE\n\n\n\n\nPick-up truck\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle of a maximum mass not exceeding 3\u00a0500\u00a0kg in which the seating positions and the cargo area are not located in a single compartment;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.6.\n\n\n\n\nBX\n\n\n\n\nChassis-cab or chassis-cowl\n\n\n\n\nAn incomplete vehicle with just a cabin (complete or partial), chassis rails, power train, axles, which is intended to be completed with bodywork, customised to the needs of the transport operator.\n\n\n\n\n\n5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Vehicles of category O \n\n\n\n\n\nRef.\n\n\n\n\nCode\n\n\n\n\nName\n\n\n\n\nDefinition\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.1.\n\n\n\n\nDA\n\n\n\n\nSemi-trailer\n\n\n\n\nA trailer that is designed and constructed to be coupled to a tractor unit or to a converter dolly and to impose a substantial vertical load on the towing vehicle or on the converter dolly.\n\n\nThe coupling to be used for a vehicle combination shall consist of a king pin and a fifth wheel.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.2.\n\n\n\n\nDB\n\n\n\n\nDrawbar trailer\n\n\n\n\nA trailer having at least two axles, of which at least one is a steered axle:\n\n\n(a) equipped with a towing device which can move vertically (in relation to the trailer) and\n\n\n(b) that transmits less than 100\u00a0daN as a static vertical load to the towing vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.3.\n\n\n\n\nDC\n\n\n\n\nCentre-axle trailer\n\n\n\n\nA trailer where the axle(s) is (are) positioned close to the centre of gravity of the vehicle (when uniformly loaded) so that only a small static vertical load, not exceeding 10\u00a0% of that corresponding to the maximum mass of the trailer or a load of 1\u00a0000\u00a0daN (whichever is the lesser) is transmitted to the towing vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.4.\n\n\n\n\nDE\n\n\n\n\nRigid drawbar trailer\n\n\n\n\nA trailer with one axle or one group of axles fitted with a drawbar which transmits a static load not exceeding 4\u00a0000\u00a0daN to the towing vehicle due to its construction and that does not meet the definition of a centre-axle trailer.\n\n\nThe coupling to be used for a vehicle combination shall not consist of a king pin and a fifth wheel.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAppendix\u00a01\n\n\nProcedure for checking whether a vehicle can be categorised as off-road vehicle\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0General \n\n\n\n\n\n1.1.\n\n\n\n\nFor the purposes of classification of a vehicle as off-road vehicle, the procedure described in this Appendix shall apply.\n\n\n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Test conditions for geometric measurements \n\n\n\n\n\n2.1.\n\n\n\n\nVehicles belonging to category M1 or N1 shall be in unloaded conditions with a manikin of the 50th percentile male installed on the driver\u2019s seat and fitted with coolant fluid, lubricants, fuel, tools, spare-wheel (if fitted as OEM equipment).\n\n\nThe manikin may be replaced by a similar device having the same mass.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.2.\n\n\n\n\nVehicles other than those referred to in point\u00a02.1 shall be loaded to their technically permissible maximum laden mass.\n\n\nThe distribution of the mass on the axles shall be the one that represents the worst case with respect to compliance with the respective criteria.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.3.\n\n\n\n\nA vehicle representative of the type shall be submitted to the technical service in the conditions specified in point\u00a02.1 or 2.2. The vehicle shall be in a stationary position with its wheels set straight ahead.\n\n\nThe ground on which measurements are made shall be as flat and horizontal (maximum of inclination 0,5\u00a0%) as possible.\n\n\n\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Measurement of approach, departure and ramp angles \n\n\n\n\n\n3.1.\n\n\n\n\nThe approach angle shall be measured in accordance with paragraph\u00a06.10 of Standard ISO\u00a0612:1978.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.2.\n\n\n\n\nThe departure angle shall be measured in accordance with paragraph\u00a06.11 of Standard ISO\u00a0612:1978.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.3.\n\n\n\n\nThe ramp angle shall be measured in accordance with paragraph\u00a06.9 of Standard \nISO\u00a0612:1978.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.4.\n\n\n\n\nWhen measuring the departure angle rear underrun protection devices which are adjustable in height may be set in the upper position.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.5.\n\n\n\n\nThe prescription in point\u00a03.4 shall not be construed as an obligation for the base vehicle to be fitted with a rear underrun protection as original equipment. However, the base vehicle manufacturer shall inform the next stage manufacturer that the vehicle has to comply with the requirements on departure angle when fitted with a rear underrun protection.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Measurement of ground clearance \n\n\n4.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Ground clearance between the axles \n\n\n4.1.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u2018Ground clearance between the axles\u2019 means the shortest distance between the ground plane and the lowest fixed point of the vehicle.\n\n\nFor the application of the definition, the distance between the last axle of a front group of axle and the first axle of a rear group of axle shall be considered.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.1.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0No rigid part of the vehicle may project into the shaded area shown on the figure.\n\n\n4.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Ground clearance beneath one axle \n\n\n4.2.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u2018Ground clearance beneath one axle\u2019 means the distance beneath the highest point of the arc of a circle passing through the centre of the tyre footprint of the wheels on one axle (the inner wheels in the case of twin tyres) and touching the lowest fixed point of the vehicle between the wheels.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.2.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where appropriate, the measurement of ground clearance shall be conducted on each of the several axles of a group of axles.\n\n\n5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Gradeability \n\n\n\n\n\n5.1.\n\n\n\n\n\u2018Gradeability\u2019 means the ability of a vehicle to negotiate a gradient.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.2.\n\n\n\n\nTo the effect of checking the gradeability of an incomplete and a complete vehicle of category M2, M3, N2 and N3, a test shall be performed.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.3.\n\n\n\n\nThe test shall be conducted by the technical service on a vehicle representative of the type to be tested.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.4.\n\n\n\n\nAt the request of the manufacturer and under the conditions specified in Annex\u00a0XVI, the gradeability of a type of vehicle may be demonstrated by virtual testing.\n\n\n\n\n\n6.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Test conditions and pass-fail criterion \n\n\n\n\n\n6.1.\n\n\n\n\nThe conditions set out in Annex\u00a0II to Regulation (EU)\u00a0No\u00a01230/2012 shall apply.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n6.2.\n\n\n\n\nThe vehicle shall climb the gradient at a steady speed without any wheel slipping, longitudinally or laterally.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAppendix\u00a02\n\n\nDigits used to supplement the codes to be used for various kinds of bodywork\n\n\n01\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Flat bed;\n\n\n02\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Drop-side;\n\n\n03\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Box body;\n\n\n\n\n04\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Conditioned body with insulated walls and equipment to maintain the interior temperature;\n\n\n05\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Conditioned body with insulated walls but without equipment to maintain the interior temperature;\n\n\n06\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Curtain-sided;\n\n\n07\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Swap body (interchangeable superstructure);\n\n\n08\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Container carrier;\n\n\n09\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Vehicles fitted with hook lift;\n\n\n10\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Tipper;\n\n\n11\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Tank;\n\n\n12\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Tank intended for transport of dangerous goods;\n\n\n13\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Livestock carrier;\n\n\n14\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Vehicle transporter;\n\n\n15\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Concrete mixer;\n\n\n16\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Concrete pump vehicle;\n\n\n17\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Timber;\n\n\n18\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Refuse collection vehicle;\n\n\n19\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Street sweeper, cleansing and drain clearing;\n\n\n20\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Compressor;\n\n\n21\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Boat carrier;\n\n\n22\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Glider carrier;\n\n\n23\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Vehicles for retail or display purposes;\n\n\n\n\n24\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Recovery vehicle;\n\n\n25\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Ladder vehicle;\n\n\n26\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Crane lorry (other than a mobile crane as defined in section\u00a05 of Part\u00a0A of Annex\u00a0II);\n\n\n27\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Aerial work platform vehicle;\n\n\n28\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Digger derrick vehicle;\n\n\n29\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Low floor trailer;\n\n\n30\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Glazing transporter;\n\n\n31\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Fire engine;\n\n\n99\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Bodywork that is not included in the present list.\n\n\n\n\nANNEX\u00a0III\n\n\nINFORMATION DOCUMENT FOR THE PURPOSE OF EU TYPE-APPROVAL OF VEHICLES\n\n\nPART\u00a0I\n\n\nThe following information shall be supplied in triplicate and include a the systems on-board the engine to ensure the correct operation of NOx control measures\n\n\n4.2.2.1. \n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Light-duty vehicles: Diesel/Petrol/LPG/NG or Biomethane/Ethanol (E 85)/Biodiesel/Hydrogen (1) (6)\n\n\n4.2.2.2\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Heavy duty vehicles Diesel/Petrol/LPG/NG-H/NG-L/NG-HL/Ethanol (ED95)/Ethanol (E85)/LNG/LNG20 (EU)\u00a0No\u00a0582/2011 (as applicable)\n\n\n4.2.2.4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Vehicle fuel type: Mono fuel, Bi fuel, Flex fuel (1)\n\n\n4.2.2.5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Maximum amount of biofuel acceptable in fuel (manufacturer's declared value): \u2026\u2026 % by volume\n\n\n4.2.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Fuel tank(s)\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n4.2.3.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Service fuel Part\u00a0I within the versions and variants of the type of vehicle\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nItem No\n\n\n\n\nAll\n\n\n\n\nVersion 1\n\n\n\n\nVersion 2\n\n\n\n\nVersion 3\n\n\n\n\nVersion n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nExplanatory notes\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A separate matrix shall be compiled for each variant within the type.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Entries for which there are no restrictions on their combination within a variant shall be listed in the column headed \u2018all\u2019.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The information to be provided in accordance with Part\u00a0II may be presented in an alternative layout or merged with the information provided in accordance with Part\u00a0I.\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Each variant and each version shall be identified by an alphanumerical code consisting of a combination of letters and numbers, which shall also be indicated in the certificate of conformity (Annex\u00a0IX) of the vehicle concerned.\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Variant(s) which fall(s) under Annex\u00a0IV, Part\u00a0III shall be identified by a specific alphanumerical code.\n\n\n\n\nPART\u00a0III\n\n\nType-approval numbers\n\n\nInformation required by Article\u00a022 to be provided in the following table in respect of the type-approvals of systems, separate technical units and components for this vehicle granted in accordance with the regulatory acts in Annex\u00a0IV. (All relevant approvals for each system, separate technical unit and component shall be included. However, information in respect of components need not be given here so long as such information is included in the approval certificate relating to the installation requirements).\n\n\n\n\n\nSubject\n\n\n\n\nType-approval number or test report number (***)\n\n\n\n\nMember State or Contracting Party (*)  issuing the type-approval (**) or test report (***)\n\n\n\n\nExtension date\n\n\n\n\nVariant(s)/version(s)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(*)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Contracting Parties to the Revised 1958 Agreement.\n\n\n(**)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0To be indicated if not obtainable from the type-approval number.\n\n\n(***)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0To be indicated when the manufacturer applies the provisions of Article\u00a040(1). In such a case, the relevant regulatory act shall be specified in the second column.\n\n\n\n\n\nSigned: \u2026\n\n\nPosition in company: \u2026\n\n\nDate: type-approval of vehicles produced in unlimited series\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nItem\n\n\n\n\nSubject\n\n\n\n\nRegulatory No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a029\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nx\n\n\n\n\nx\n\n\n\n\nx \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nExplanatory notes\n\n\nX\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Relevant regulatory act.\n\n\n (1)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For vehicles with a reference mass not exceeding 2 610 kg. At the manufacturer\u2019s request, Regulation (EC) No 715/2007 may apply to vehicles with a reference mass not exceeding 2 840 kg.\n\n\n(2)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0In case of vehicles equipped with a LPG or CNG installation, a vehicle type-approval in accordance with UNECE Regulation No 67 or UNECE Regulation No 110 is required.\n\n\n(3)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The fitting of an electronic stability control (\u2018ESC\u2019) system is required in accordance with Article\u00a012 and Article\u00a013 of Regulation (EC) No 661/2009. \n\n\n(4)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The fitting of an ESC system is required in accordance with Article\u00a012 and Article\u00a013 of Regulation (EC) No 661/2009. \n\n\n(4A)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0If fitted, the protective device shall fulfil the requirements of UNECE Regulation No 18.\n\n\n(4B)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0This Regulation applies to seats not falling within the scope of UNECE Regulation No 80.\n\n\n(9)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For vehicles with a reference mass exceeding 2 610 kg which are not type-approved (at the manufacturer\u2019s request and provided their reference mass does not exceed 2 840 kg) under Regulation (EC) No 715/2007.\n\n\n(9A)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Applies only where such vehicles are fitted with equipment covered by UNECE Regulation No 64. Tyre pressure monitoring system for M1 vehicles applies on a compulsory basis in accordance with Article\u00a09(2) of Regulation (EC) No 661/2009.\n\n\n(10)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Applies only to vehicles equipped with coupling(s).\n\n\n(11)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Applies to vehicles with a technically permissible maximum laden mass not exceeding 2,5 tonnes.\n\n\n(12)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Only applicable to vehicles where the \u2018Seating Reference Point (\u201cR\u201d point)\u2019 of the lowest seat is not more than 700 mm above the ground level.\n\n\n(13)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Applies only when the manufacturer applies for type-approval of vehicles intended for the transport of dangerous goods.\n\n\n(14)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Applies only for vehicles of category N1, class I as described in Annex\u00a0I to Regulation (EC) No 715/2007.\n\n\n(15)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Compliance with Regulation (EC) No 661/2009 is mandatory, however, type-approval under this item number is not foreseen as it represents the collection of individual items 3A, 3B, 4A, 5A, 6A, 6B, 7A, 8A, 9A, 9B, 10A, 12A, 13A, 13B, 14A, 15A, 15B, 16A, 17A, 17B, 18A, 19A, 20A, 21A, 22A, 22B, 22C, 23A, 24A, 25A, 25B, 25C, 25D, 25E, 25F, 26A, 27A, 28A, 29A, 30A, 31A, 32A, 33A, 34A, 35A, 36A, 37A, 38A, 42A, 43A, 44A, 45A, 46A, 46B, 46C, 46D, 46E, 47A, 48A, 49A, 50A, 50B, 51A, 52A, 52B, 53A, 54A, 56A, 57A and 64 to 71. The series of amendments of the UNECE regulations which apply on a compulsory basis are listed in Annex\u00a0IV to Regulation (EC) No 661/2009. The series of amendments adopted subsequently are accepted as an alternative.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAppendix\u00a01\n\n\nRegulatory acts for EU type-approval of vehicles produced in small series pursuant to Article\u00a039\n\n\nTable 1\u00a0\n\n\nM1 vehicles \n\n\n\n\n\nItem\n\n\n\n\nSubject\n\n\n\n\nRegulatory act\n\n\n\n\nSpecific issues\n\n\n\n\nApplicability and specific requirements\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1\n\n\n\n\nSound level\n\n\n\n\nDirective 70/157/EEC \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1A\n\n\n\n\nSound level\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No\u00a0540/2014\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2\n\n\n\n\nEmissions (Euro 5 and 6) light duty vehicles/access to information\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0715/2007\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0On-board diagnostic (OBD)\n\n\n\n\nThe vehicle shall be fitted with an OBD system that fulfils the requirements of Article\u00a04(1) and (2) of Regulation (EC) No 692/2008 (The OBD system shall be designed to record at least the malfunction of the engine management system).\n\n\nThe OBD-interface shall be able to communicate with commonly available diagnostic tools.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0In service conformity\n\n\n\n\nN/A\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Access to information\n\n\n\n\nIt is sufficient that the manufacturer provide access to repair and maintenance information in a readily accessible and prompt manner. \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(When the vehicle manufacturer uses an engine from another manufacturer)\u00a0\n\n\nBench test data from the engine manufacturer are accepted provided that the engine management system is identical (i.e. having at least the same electronic control unit (ECU)).\n\n\nPower output test may be performed on a chassis dynamometer. It shall be taken into account of the power loss in the transmission.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nItem\n\n\n\n\nSubject\n\n\n\n\nRegulatory act\n\n\n\n\nSpecific issues\n\n\n\n\nApplicability and specific requirements\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3A\n\n\n\n\nPrevention of fire risks (liquid fuel tanks)\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a034\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Liquid fuel tanks\n\n\n\n\nB\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Installation in vehicle\n\n\n\n\nB\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3B\n\n\n\n\nRear underrun protective devices (RUPDs) and their installation; rear underrun protection (RUP)\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a058\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4A\n\n\n\n\nSpace for mounting and fixing rear registration plates\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No\u00a01003/2010\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5A\n\n\n\n\nSteering equipment\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a079\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Mechanical systems\n\n\n\n\nThe provisions of paragraph\u00a05 of UNECE Regulation No 79 shall apply.\n\n\nAll tests prescribed in paragraph\u00a06.2 of UNECE Regulation No 79 shall be performed and the requirements of paragraph\u00a06.1 of UNECE Regulation No 79 shall apply.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Complex electronic vehicle control system\n\n\n\n\nAll the requirements of Annex\u00a06 of UNECE Regulation No 79 shall apply.\n\n\nCompliance with these requirements may only be checked by a technical service.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n6A\n\n\n\n\nDoor latches and door retention components\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a011\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0General requirements (Paragraph\u00a05 of UNECE Regulation No 11)\n\n\n\n\nAll the requirements shall apply.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Performance requirements (Paragraph\u00a06 of UNECE Regulation No 11)\n\n\n\n\nOnly the requirements of paragraph\u00a06.1.5.4 and paragraph\u00a06.3 of UNECE Regulation No 11 shall apply.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7A\n\n\n\n\nAudible warning devices and signals\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nUNECE
