No\u00a0100\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB\n\n\n\n\n\n\n70\n\n\n\n\nSpecific components for CNG and their installation on motor vehicles\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a0110\n\n\n\n\n(a) Components\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(b) Installation\n\n\n\n\nA\n\n\n\n\n\n\n71\n\n\n\n\nCab strength\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a029\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAppendix\u00a02\n\n\nRequirements for EU individual vehicle approval pursuant to Article\u00a042\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0APPLICATION\n\n\nFor the purpose of application of this appendix, a vehicle is deemed to be new where:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0it has never been registered previously; or\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0it has been registered for less than 6 months at the time of the application for individual vehicle approval.\n\n\nA vehicle shall be considered registered where it has obtained a permanent, temporary or short-term administrative authorisation for entry into service in road traffic, involving its identification and the issuing of a registration number (1).\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0ADMINISTRATIVE PROVISIONS \n\n\n1.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Categorisation of the vehicle \n\n\nVehicles shall be categorised according to the criteria set out in Annex\u00a0II as follows:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the actual number of seating positions shall be taken into consideration; and\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the technically maximum permissible laden mass shall be the maximum mass stated by the manufacturer in the country of origin and available in his official documentation.\n\n\nWhere it is not possible to easily determine the vehicle category because of the design of the bodywork, the conditions set out in Annex\u00a0II shall apply.\n\n\n1.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Application for individual vehicle approval \n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The applicant shall submit an application to the approval authority accompanied by all relevant documentation necessary for the operation of the approval procedure.\n\n\nWhere the submitted documentation is incomplete, falsified or forged the application for approval shall be rejected.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Only one application for a particular vehicle may be submitted in only one Member State. The approval authority may require from the applicant a written commitment that only one application will be submitted in the Member State of the approval authority.\n\n\nBy a particular vehicle, it shall be understood a physical vehicle the vehicle identification number of which is clearly identified. \n\n\nHowever, any applicant may apply for EU individual vehicle approval in another Member State in respect of another particular vehicle with technical characteristics identical or similar to the one that has been granted an EU individual vehicle approval.\n\n\n___________________________________\n\n\n(1)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0In the absence of a registration document, the competent authority may refer to available documented evidence of date of manufacture or documented evidence of first purchase.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The model of the application form and the layout of the file shall be laid down by the approval authority.\n\n\nThe particulars of the vehicle requested may only consist in an appropriate selection of the information included in Annex\u00a0I.\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The technical requirements to be complied with are those laid down in section\u00a04.\n\n\nThe technical requirements shall be those applicable to new vehicles belonging to a type of vehicle currently in production, in relation to the date of the submission of the application.\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0With respect to the tests required in the regulatory acts listed in this Annex, the applicant shall supply a statement of compliance with recognised international standards or regulations. The statement in question may only be issued by the vehicle manufacturer.\n\n\n\u2018Statement of compliance\u2019 shall mean a statement issued by the office or department within the manufacturer\u2019s organisation that is duly authorised by the management to fully engage the legal responsibility of the manufacturer with respect to the design and the construction of a vehicle. \n\n\nThe regulatory acts for which such a statement has to be supplied shall be those referred to in section\u00a04.\n\n\nWhere a statement of compliance gives rise to uncertainty, the applicant may be required to obtain from the manufacturer a piece of evidence, including a test report, in order to corroborate the manufacturer\u2019s statement.\n\n\n1.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Technical services entrusted with individual vehicle approvals \n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The technical services entrusted with individual vehicle approvals shall be of category A as referred to in Article\u00a072(1).\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0By way of derogation from the requirement to demonstrate their compliance with the standards listed in Appendix\u00a01 to Annex\u00a0V, technical services shall comply with the following standards:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0EN ISO/IEC 17025:2005 when they perform tests themselves;\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0EN ISO/IEC 17020:2012 when they check compliance of the vehicle with the requirements included in this Appendix.\n\n\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where specific tests requiring specific skills have to be conducted at the request of the applicant, they shall be conducted by one of the technical services notified to the Commission at the choice of the applicant.\n\n\n\n1.4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Test reports \n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Test reports shall be drafted in accordance with paragraph\u00a05.10.2 of Standard EN ISO/IEC 17025:2005.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Test reports shall be drafted in one of the languages of the Union determined by the approval authority.\n\n\nWhere in application of point\u00a01.3(c) a test report has been issued in a Member State other than the one entrusted with the individual vehicle approval, the approval authority may require that the applicant submits a true translation of the test report.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Test reports shall include a description of the vehicle tested, including its identification. The parts that play a significant role with regard to the results of the tests shall be described and their identification number reported.\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0At the request of an applicant, a test report delivered for a system related to a particular vehicle may be presented repeatedly either by the same or another applicant for the purposes of individual approval of another vehicle.\n\n\nIn such a case, the approval authority shall ensure that the technical characteristics of the vehicle are properly inspected against the test report.\n\n\nInspection of the vehicle and the documentation accompanying the test report shall demonstrate\u00a0that the vehicle for which an individual approval is sought has the same characteristics as the vehicle described in the report.\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Only authenticated copies of a test report may be submitted.\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Test reports referred to in point\u00a01.4(d) do not include the reports drawn up in order to grant the individual vehicle approval.\n\n\n\n\n\n1.5.\n\n\n\n\nIn the individual vehicle approval procedure each particular vehicle shall be inspected physically by the technical service.\n\n\nNo exemption to this principle shall be permitted.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.6.\n\n\n\n\nWhere the approval authority is satisfied that the vehicle meets the technical requirements specified in this Appendix and conforms to the description included in the application, it shall grant approval in accordance with Article\u00a042.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.7.\n\n\n\n\nThe certificate of approval shall be drafted according to Model D as laid down in Annex\u00a0VI.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.8.\n\n\n\n\nThe approval authority shall keep record of all approvals granted under Article\u00a042.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0REVIEW OF THE TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS \n\n\nThe list of the technical requirements included in section\u00a03 shall be regularly reviewed in order to take account of the results of the harmonisation work in progress at the World Forum for Harmonization of Vehicle Regulations (WP.29) in Geneva and legislative developments in the third countries.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS \n\n\nPart\u00a0I:\u00a0Vehicles belonging to category M1\n\n\n\n\n\nItem\n\n\n\n\nRegulatory act reference\n\n\n\n\nAlternative requirements\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1\n\n\n\n\nCouncil Directive 70/157/EEC\n28\n\n\n\n(Permissible sound level)\n\n\n\n\nDrive-by test\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A test shall be conducted in accordance with the \u2018Method A\u2019 referred to in Annex\u00a03 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a051.\n\n\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Limits are those specified in point\u00a02.1 of Annex\u00a0I to Directive 70/157/EEC. 1 decibel in addition to the permitted limits shall be allowed.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The test track shall comply with Annex\u00a08 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a051. A test track having different specifications may be used under the condition that correlation tests have been conducted by the technical service. A correction factor shall be applied if necessary.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Exhaust systems containing fibrous materials need not be conditioned as prescribed in Annex\u00a05 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a051.\n\n\nStationary test\n\n\nA test shall be conducted in accordance with paragraph\u00a03.2 of \nAnnex\u00a03 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a051.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2a\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0715/2007\n\n\n(Emissions Euro 5 and 6 light duty vehicles/access to information)\n\n\n\n\nTailpipe emissions\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A type I test shall be conducted in accordance with Annex\u00a0III to Regulation (EC) No\u00a0692/2008 using the deterioration factors set out in point\u00a01.4 of Annex\u00a0VII to Regulation (EC) No\u00a0692/2008. The limits to be applied shall be those specified in Table I and Table II in Annex\u00a0I to Regulation (EC) No\u00a0715/2007.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The vehicle shall not be required to exhibit 3\u00a0000 km as mentioned in paragraph\u00a03.1.1 of Annex\u00a04 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a083.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The fuel to be used for the test shall be the reference fuel as prescribed in Annex\u00a0IX to Regulation (EC) No\u00a0692/2008.\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The dynamometer shall be set up in accordance with the technical requirements set out in paragraph\u00a03.2 of Annex\u00a04 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a083.\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The test referred to in point\u00a0(a) shall not be conducted where it can be shown that the vehicle complies with the California Code Regulations referred to in point\u00a02.1.1 of Annex\u00a0I to Regulation (EC) No\u00a0692/2008.\n\n\nEvaporative emissions\n\n\nFor petrol-fuelled engines, the presence of an evaporate emissions control system shall be required (e.g. a charcoal canister).\n\n\nCrankcase emissions\n\n\nThe presence of a device for recycling crankcase gases shall be required.\n\n\nOBD\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The vehicle shall be fitted with an OBD system.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0OBD-interface must be able to communicate with common diagnostic tools used for periodic technical inspections.\n\n\nSmoke opacity\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Vehicles equipped with a diesel-fuelled engine shall be tested in accordance with the tests methods referred to in Appendix\u00a02 to Annex\u00a0IV to Regulation (EC) No\u00a0692/2008.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The corrected value of the absorption coefficient shall be affixed conspicuously and in a readily accessible place.\n\n\nCO2 emissions and fuel consumption\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A test shall be conducted in accordance with Annex\u00a0XII to Regulation (EC) No\u00a0692/2008.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The vehicle shall not be required to exhibit 3\u00a0000 km as requested in paragraph\u00a03.1.1 of Annex\u00a04 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a083.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where the vehicle complies with the California Code Regulations referred to in point\u00a02.1.1 of Annex\u00a0I to Regulation (EC) No\u00a0692/2008 and therefore no test of tailpipe emissions is required to be performed, Member States shall calculate CO2 emissions and fuel consumption with the formula laid down in the explanatory notes (b) and (c).\n\n\nAccess to information\n\n\nThe provisions regarding access to information shall not apply.\n\n\nPower measurement\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a034\n\n\n(Fuel tanks \u2014 Rear protective devices)\n\n\n\n\nFuel tanks\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Fuel tanks shall comply with paragraph\u00a05 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a034 with the exception of paragraphs 5.1, 5.2 and 5.12. In particular, they shall comply with paragraphs 5.9 and 5.9.1 but no dripping test shall be conducted.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0LPG or CNG tanks shall be type-approved in accordance with UNECE Regulation No\u00a067, series of amendments 01, or Regulation No\u00a0110 (a), respectively.\n\n\nSpecific provisions for fuel tanks made of a plastic material\n\n\nThe applicant shall submit a statement from the manufacturer establishing that the fuel tank on the particular vehicle, the Vehicle Identification Number (VIN)\u00a0of which has to be specified, complies either with at least one of the following: \n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0FMVSS No\u00a0301 (Fuel system integrity), or\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Annex\u00a05 to UNECE Regulation 34.\n\n\nRear protective device\n\n\nThe rear part of the vehicle shall be constructed in accordance with paragraphs 8 and 9 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a034.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3B\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a058\n\n\n(rear underrun protection)\n\n\n\n\nThe rear part of the vehicle shall be constructed in accordance with paragraph\u00a02 UNECE Regulation No\u00a058. It is sufficient that the requirements set out in paragraph\u00a02.3 are fulfilled.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No\u00a01003/2010\n\n\n(Rear registration plate space)\n\n\n\n\nSpace, inclination, angles for visibility and position of the registration plate shall comply with Regulation (EU) No\u00a01003/2010.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a079\n\n\n(Steering effort)\n\n\n\n\nMechanical systems\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The steering mechanism shall be built as to self-centre. In order to check compliance with this provision, a test shall be conducted in accordance with paragraphs 6.1.2 and 6.2.1 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a079.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The failure of the power steering equipment shall not lead to a complete loss of control of the vehicle.\n\n\nComplex electronic vehicle control system (\u2018Drive-by wire\u2019 devices)\n\n\nComplex electronic control system shall be permitted only if they comply with Annex\u00a06 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a079.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n6\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a011\n\n\n(Door latches and hinges)\n\n\n\n\nCompliance with paragraph\u00a06.1.5.4 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a011.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a028\n\n\n(Audible warning)\n\n\n\n\nComponents\n\n\nThe audible warning devices are not required to be type-approved in accordance with UNECE Regulation No\u00a028. However, they shall emit a continuous sound as required in paragraph\u00a06.1.1 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a028.\n\n\nInstallation on vehicle\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A test shall be conducted in accordance with paragraph\u00a06.2 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a028.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The maximum sound pressure level shall be in accordance with paragraph\u00a06.2.7.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n8\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a046\n\n\n(Indirect vision devices)\n\n\n\n\nComponents\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The vehicle shall be fitted with the rear-view mirrors prescribed in paragraph\u00a015.2 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a046.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0They are not required to be type-approved in accordance with UNECE Regulation No\u00a046.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The radii of curvature of the mirrors shall not cause significant image distortions. At the discretion of the technical service, the radii of curvature shall be checked in accordance with the method described in Annex\u00a07 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a046. The radii of curvature shall not be less than those required by paragraph\u00a06.1.2.2.4. of UNECE Regulation No\u00a046.\n\n\nInstallation on vehicle\n\n\nMeasurement shall be conducted in order to ensure that the fields of vision comply either with paragraph\u00a015.2.4. of UNECE Regulation No\u00a046 or with section\u00a05 of Annex\u00a0III to Directive 71/127/EEC.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n9\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a013-H\n\n\n(Braking)\n\n\n\n\nGeneral provisions\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The braking system shall be built in accordance with paragraph\u00a05 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a013-H.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Vehicles shall be fitted with an electronic antilock braking system acting on all wheels.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The performances of the braking system shall comply with Annex\u00a0III to UNECE Regulation No\u00a013-H.\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For those purposes, road tests shall be conducted on a track the surface of which possesses high adhesion. The test on the parking brake shall be conducted on a 18 % gradient (up and down).\n\n\nOnly those tests mentioned under the headings \"Service brake\" and \"Parking brake\" below shall be conducted. In each case, the vehicle shall be in fully laden conditions.\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The road test referred to in point\u00a0(d) shall not be conducted where the applicant can submit a statement from the manufacturer establishing that the vehicle complies either with UNECE Regulation No\u00a013-H, including supplement 5, or with FMVSS No\u00a0135.\n\n\nService brake\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A \u2018Type 0\u2019 test as prescribed in paragraphs 1.4.2 and 1.4.3 of Annex\u00a03 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a013-H shall be conducted.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0In addition, a \u2018Type I\u2019 test as prescribed in paragraph\u00a01.5 of Annex\u00a03 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a013-H shall be conducted.\n\n\nParking brake\n\n\nA test shall be conducted in accordance with paragraph\u00a02.3 of Annex\u00a03 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a013-H.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n10\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a010\n\n\n(Radio interference (electromagnetic compatibility))\n\n\n\n\nComponents\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Electrical/electronic sub-assemblies are not required to be type-approved in accordance with UNECE Regulation No\u00a010.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0However, electric/electronic devices retrofitted shall comply with UNECE Regulation No\u00a010.\n\n\nEmitted electromagnetic radiations\n\n\nThe applicant shall submit a statement from the manufacturer establishing that the vehicle complies with UNECE Regulation No\u00a010 or with the following alternative standards:\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Broadband electromagnetic radiation: CISPR 12 or SAE J551-2, or\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Narrowband electromagnetic radiation: CISPR 12 (off-board) or 25 (in-board) or SAE J551-4 and SAE J1113-41.\n\n\nImmunity tests\n\n\nImmunity test shall be waived.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n12\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a021\n\n\n(Interior fittings)\n\n\n\n\nInterior arrangement\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0With respect to the requirements on energy absorption, the vehicle shall be deemed to comply with UNECE Regulation No\u00a021 if the vehicle is fitted with at least two front airbags, one inserted into the steering wheel and the other into the dashboard.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where the vehicle is fitted with only one front air bag inserted in the steering wheel, the dashboard shall be made up of energy absorbing materials.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The technical service shall check that there are no sharp edges in the zones defined in paragraphs 5.1 to 5.7 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a021.\n\n\nElectrical controls\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Power-operated windows, roof\u2013panel systems and partitioning systems shall be tested in accordance with paragraph\u00a05.8 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a021.\n\n\nThe sensitivity of auto-reverse systems referred to in paragraph\u00a05.8.3 may diverge from the requirements set out in paragraph\u00a05.8.3.1.1 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a021.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Electric windows which cannot be closed when the ignition is off shall be exempt from the requirements concerning auto-reverse systems.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n13\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a018\n\n\n(Anti-theft and immobiliser)\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0In order to prevent unauthorised use, the vehicle shall be fitted with:\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a locking device as defined in paragraph\u00a02.3 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a018, and\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an immobiliser which meets the technical requirements of paragraph\u00a05 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a018;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0If, in accordance with point\u00a0(a), an immobiliser has to be retrofitted, it shall be of an approved type in accordance with UNECE Regulations No\u00a018, No\u00a097, or No\u00a0116.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n14\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a012\n\n\n(Protective steering)\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The applicant shall submit a statement from the manufacturer establishing that the particular vehicle, the VIN\u00a0of which has to be specified, complies with at least one of the following:\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0UNECE Regulation No\u00a012,\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0FMVSS No\u00a0203 (Impact protection for the driver from the steering control system) including FMVSS No\u00a0204 (Steering control rearward displacement),\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Article\u00a011 of JSRRV.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A test in accordance with Annex\u00a03 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a012 may be conducted on a production vehicle at the request of the applicant.\n\n\nThe test shall be conducted by a technical service that has been designated for carrying out this test. A detailed report shall be issued by that technical service to the applicant.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n15\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a017\n\n\n(Seat strength \u2014 head restraints)\n\n\n\n\nSeats, seat anchorages and adjustment systems\n\n\nThe applicant shall submit a statement from the manufacturer establishing that the particular vehicle, the VIN\u00a0of which has to be specified, complies with at least one of the following:\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0UNECE Regulation No\u00a017; or\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0FMVSS No\u00a0207 (Seating systems).\n\n\nHead restraints\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where the statement is based on FMVSS No\u00a0207, the head restraints shall fulfil, in addition, the requirements of paragraph\u00a05 and Annex\u00a04 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a017.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Only the tests described in paragraphs 5.12, 6.5, 6.6 and 6.7 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a017 shall be conducted.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0In the other event, the applicant shall submit a statement from the manufacturer establishing that the particular vehicle, the VIN\u00a0of which has to be specified, complies with FMVSS No\u00a0202a (Head restraints).\n\n\n\n\n\n\n16\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a017\n\n\n(Exterior projections)\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The external surface of the bodywork shall comply with the general requirements included in paragraph\u00a05 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a017.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0At the discretion of the technical service the provisions referred to in paragraphs 6.1, 6.5, 6.6, 6.7, 6.8 and 6.11 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a017 shall be checked.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n17\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a039\n\n\n(Speedometer \u2014 reverse gear)\n\n\n\n\nSpeedometer equipment\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The dial shall comply with paragraphs 5.1 to 5.1.4 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a039.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where the technical service wants to verify that the speedometer is calibrated with sufficient accuracy, it may require the tests prescribed in paragraph\u00a05.2 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a039 to be conducted.\n\n\nReverse gear\n\n\nThe gear mechanism shall include a reverse gear.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n18\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No\u00a019/2011\n\n\n(Statutory plates)\n\n\n\n\nVehicle identification number\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The vehicle shall be fitted with a vehicle identification number comprising a minimum of 8 and a maximum of 17 characters. Vehicle identification number comprising 17 characters shall fulfil the requirements set out in Standards ISO\u00a03779:1983 and 3780:1983.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The vehicle identification number shall be located in a clearly visible and accessible position in such a way as it cannot be obliterated or deteriorate.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where no vehicle identification number is stamped in the chassis or in the body, a Member State may require the applicant that the VIN is retrofitted in application of its national law. In such a case, the competent authority of that Member State shall supervise the operation.\n\n\nStatutory plate\n\n\nThe vehicle shall be fitted with an identification plate affixed by the vehicle manufacturer.\n\n\nNo additional plate shall be requested after the approval by the approval authority has been granted.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n19\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a014 (Seat belt anchorages)\n\n\n\n\nThe applicant shall submit a statement from the manufacturer establishing that the particular vehicle, the VIN\u00a0of which has to be specified, complies with at least one of the following:\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0UNECE Regulation No\u00a014;\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0FMVSS No\u00a0210 (Seat belt assembly anchorages), or\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Article\u00a022-3 of JSRRV.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n20\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a048 (Installation of lighting and light signalling devices)\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The lighting installation shall meet the requirements of UNECE Regulation No\u00a048, series of amendments 03, with the exception of the requirements of Annexes 5 and 6 to that Regulation.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0No exemption shall be permitted in respect of the number, the essential design characteristics, the electrical connections, and the colour of light emitted or retro-reflected of the lights and signalling devices referred to in items\u00a021 to 26 and in items\u00a028 to 30.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Lights and signalling devices that, for the purpose of fulfilling the requirements of point\u00a0(a) must be retrofitted shall bear an \u2018EU\u2019 type-approval mark.\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Lamps fitted with gas-discharged light source are only permitted in conjunction with the installation of headlamp cleaning device and an automatic headlamp-levelling device where appropriate.\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Headlamp dipped-beams shall be adapted to the direction of traffic legally in force in the country where the vehicle is granted approval.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n21\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a03 (Retro reflectors)\n\n\n\n\nWhere necessary, two additional retro reflectors bearing an \u2018EC\u2019 approval mark shall be added at the rear, the position of which shall comply with UNECE Regulation No\u00a048.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n22\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulations No\u00a07, No\u00a087 and No\u00a091\n\n\n(End-outline, front position (side), rear-position (side), stop, side marker, daytime running lamps)\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements set out in the UNECE Regulations No\u00a07, No\u00a087 and No\u00a091 shall not apply. However, the correct functioning of the lights shall be checked by the technical service.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n23\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a06 (Direction indicators)\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements set out in UNECE Regulation No\u00a06 shall not apply. However, the correct functioning of the lights shall be checked by the technical service.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n24\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a04 (Rear registration plate lamps)\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements set out in UNECE Regulation No\u00a04 shall not apply. However, the correct functioning of the lights shall be checked by the technical service.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n25\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulations No\u00a098, No\u00a0112 and No\u00a0123 (Headlamps (including bulbs))\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The illumination produced by the passing beam of the headlamps fitted to the vehicle shall be checked under paragraph\u00a06 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a0112 concerning headlamps emitting an asymmetrical passing beam. The tolerances included in Annex\u00a05 to that Regulation may be referred to for that purpose.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The same requirement shall be fulfilled for the passing beam of headlamps covered by UNECE Regulation No\u00a098 or No\u00a0123.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n26\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a019 (Front fog lamps)\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements set out in UNECE Regulation No\u00a019 shall not apply. However, the correct functioning of the lights if fitted shall be checked by the technical service.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n27\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No\u00a01005/2010\n\n\n(Towing hooks)\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements set out in Regulation (EU) No\u00a01005/2010 shall not apply.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n28\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a038 (Rear fog lamps)\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements set out in UNECE Regulation No\u00a038 shall not apply. However, the correct functioning of the lights shall be checked by the technical service.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n29\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a023 (Reversing lamps)\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements set out in UNECE Regulation No\u00a023 shall not apply. However, the correct functioning of the lights if fitted shall be checked by the technical service.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n30\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a077 (Parking lamps)\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements set out in UNECE Regulation No\u00a077 shall not apply. However, the correct functioning of the lights if fitted shall be checked by the technical service.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n31\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a016 (Seat belts and restraint systems)\n\n\n\n\nComponents\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Seat belts shall not be required to be type-approved in accordance with UNECE Regulation No\u00a016.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0However, each seat belt shall bear an identification label.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The indications on the label shall be consistent with the decision concerning seat belt anchorages (Re: entry 19).\n\n\nInstallation requirements\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The vehicle shall be fitted with seat belts in accordance with the requirements set out in Annex\u00a0XVI to UNECE Regulation No\u00a016.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where a number of seat belts have to be retrofitted in accordance with point\u00a0(a), they shall be of an approved type in accordance with UNECE Regulation No\u00a016.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n32\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a0125 (Forward vision)\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0No obstruction in the 180\u00b0 forward field of vision of the driver as defined in paragraph\u00a05.1.3 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a0125 shall be permitted.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0By derogation from point\u00a0(a), the \u2018A pillars\u2019 and the equipment listed in paragraph\u00a05.1.3 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a0125 shall not be considered as obstruction.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The number of \u2018A pillars\u2019 shall not exceed 2.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n33\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a0121 (Identification of controls, tell-tales and indicators)\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The symbols including the colour of their corresponding tell-tales the presence of which is mandatory by virtue of UNECE Regulation No\u00a0121 shall comply with that UNECE Regulation.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where this is not the case, the technical service shall verify that the symbols, tell-tales and indicators fitted to the vehicle provide the driver with comprehensible information about the operation of the controls in question.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n34\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No\u00a0672/2010 (Defrost/Demist)\n\n\n\n\nThe vehicle shall be equipped with adequate windscreen defrosting and windscreen demisting devices.\n\n\nA windscreen defrosting device which complies as a minimum with point\u00a01.1.1 of Annex\u00a0II to Regulation (EU) No\u00a0672/2010 shall be deemed \u2018adequate\u2019.\n\n\nA windscreen demisting device which complies as a minimum with point\u00a01.2.1 of Annex\u00a0II to Regulation (EU) No\u00a0672/2010 shall be deemed \u2018adequate\u2019.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n35\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No\u00a01008/2010 (Wash/Wipe)\n\n\n\n\nThe vehicle shall be equipped with adequate windscreen washing and windscreen wiping devices.\n\n\nA windscreen washing and wiping device that complies as a minimum with the conditions set out in point\u00a01.1.5 of Annex\u00a0III to Regulation (EU) No\u00a01008/2010 shall be deemed \u2018adequate\u2019.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n36\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a0122 (Heating systems)\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The passenger compartment shall be fitted with a heating system.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Combustion heaters and their installation shall comply with Annex\u00a07 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a0122. In addition, LPG combustion heaters and LPG heating systems shall fulfil the requirements set out in Annex\u00a08 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a0122.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Additional heating systems which are retrofitted shall comply with the requirements set out in that UNECE Regulation No\u00a0122.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n37\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No\u00a01009/2010 (Wheel guards)\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The vehicle shall be designed as to protect other road users against thrown-up stones, mud, ice, snow and water and to reduce the dangers due to contact with the moving wheels.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The technical service may check that the technical requirements set out in Annex\u00a0II to Regulation (EU) No\u00a01009/2010 are complied with.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The provisions of section\u00a03 of Annex\u00a0I to that Regulation shall not apply.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n38\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a025 (Head restraints)\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements of UNECE Regulation No\u00a025 shall not apply.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n44\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No\u00a01230/2012 (Masses and dimensions)\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The requirements of section\u00a01 of Part\u00a0A of Annex\u00a0I to Regulation (EU) No\u00a01230/2012 shall be fulfilled.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For the purposes of point\u00a0(a), the masses to be considered are the following:\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the mass in running order defined in point\u00a02.6 of Annex\u00a0I to Regulation (EU) No\u00a01230/2012 as measured by the technical service, and\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the laden masses either stated by the vehicle manufacturer or shown on the manufacturer\u2019s plate including stickers or information available in the owner\u2019s manual. Those masses shall be deemed the technically permissible maximum laden masses.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0No exemption shall be permitted in respect of the maximum permissible dimensions.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n45\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No\u00a01230/2012 (Safety glazing)\n\n\n\n\nComponents\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The glazing shall be made either of tempered or laminated safety glass.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Fitting of plastic glazing shall be permitted only on locations situated behind the \u2018B\u2019 pillar.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Glazing shall not be required to be approved under Regulation (EU) No\u00a01230/2012.\n\n\nInstallation\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The installation requirements set out in Annex\u00a021 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a043 shall apply.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0No tinted films that would reduce the regular light transmission under the required minimum shall be permitted on the windscreen and on the glazing located in front of the \u2018B\u2019 pillar.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n46\n\n\n\n\nDirective\u00a092/23/EEC\n\n\n(Tyres)\n\n\n\n\nComponents\n\n\nTyres shall bear an \u2018EC\u2019 type-approval mark including the symbol\u00a0\u2018s\u2019 (for sound).\n\n\nInstallation\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The dimensions, load-capacity index and speed category of the tyres shall fulfil the requirements of Annex\u00a0IV to Directive 92/23/EEC.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The speed category symbol of the tyre shall be compatible with the maximum design speed of the vehicle.\n\n\nThis requirement shall apply notwithstanding the presence of a speed limiter.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The maximum speed of the vehicle shall be stated by the vehicle manufacturer. However, the technical service may assess the maximum design speed of the vehicle by using the engine maximum power output, the maximum number of revolutions per minute and the data concerning the kinematic chain.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n50\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a055 (Couplings)\n\n\n\n\nSeparate technical units\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0OEM couplings intended for towing a trailer whose maximum mass does not exceed 1\u00a0500 kg shall not be required to be type-approved under UNECE Regulation No\u00a055.\n\n\nA coupling is deemed OEM equipment where it is described in the owner\u2019s manual or an equivalent supporting document provided to the buyer by the vehicle manufacturer.\n\n\nWhere such coupling is approved with the vehicle, an appropriate text shall be included in the approval certificate stating that the owner is responsible for ensuring compatibility with the coupling device fitted to the trailer.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Couplings other than those referred to in point\u00a0(a), as well as couplings that are retrofitted, shall be type-approved in accordance with UNECE Regulation No\u00a055.\n\n\nInstallation on the vehicle\n\n\nThe technical service shall check that the installation of the coupling devices comply with paragraph\u00a06 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a055.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n53\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a094 (Frontal impact) (e)\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The applicant shall submit a statement from the manufacturer establishing that the particular vehicle, of which the VIN\u00a0has to be specified, complies with at least one of the following:\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0UNECE Regulation No\u00a094,\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0FMVSS No\u00a0208 (Occupant crash protection),\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Article\u00a018 of JSRRV.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A test in accordance with paragraph\u00a05 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a094 may be conducted on a production vehicle at the request of the applicant.\n\n\nThe test shall be conducted by a technical service that has been designated for carrying out this test. A detailed report shall be issued by that technical service to the applicant\n\n\n\n\n\n\n54\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a095 (Side impact)\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The applicant shall submit a statement from the manufacturer establishing that the particular vehicle, of which the VIN\u00a0has to be specified complies with at least one of the following:\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0UNECE Regulation No\u00a095,\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0FMVSS No\u00a0214 (Side impact protection),\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Article\u00a018 of JSRRV.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A test in accordance with section\u00a05 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a095 may be conducted on a production vehicle at the request of the applicant.\n\n\nThe test shall be conducted by a technical service that has been designated for carrying out this test. A detailed report shall be issued by that technical service to the applicant. \n\n\n\n\n\n\n58\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a078/2009\n\n\n(Pedestrian protection)\n\n\n\n\nBrake assist\n\n\nVehicles shall be fitted with an electronic antilock braking system acting on all wheels.\n\n\nPedestrian protection\n\n\nThe requirements of Regulation (EC) No\u00a078/2009 shall apply.\n\n\nFrontal protection systems\n\n\nFrontal protection systems installed on the vehicle shall be type-approved in accordance with Regulation (EC) No\u00a078/2009 and their installation shall comply with the requirements set out in section\u00a06 of Annex\u00a0I to that Regulation.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n59\n\n\n\n\nDirective 2005/64/EC\n\n\n(Recyclability)\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements of that Directive shall not apply.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n61\n\n\n\n\nDirective 2006/40/EC\n\n\n(Air-conditioning system)\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements of that Directive shall apply.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nPart\u00a0II:\u00a0Vehicles belonging to category N1\n\n\n\n\n\nItem\n\n\n\n\nRegulatory act reference\n\n\n\n\nAlternative requirements\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2a\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0715/2007\n\n\nEmissions (Euro 5 and 6) light duty vehicles/access to information\n\n\n\n\nTailpipe emissions\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A type I test shall be conducted in accordance with Annex\u00a0III to Regulation (EC) No\u00a0692/2008 using the deterioration factors set out in point\u00a01.4 of Annex\u00a0VII to Regulation (EC) No\u00a0692/2008. The limits to be applied shall be those specified in Table I and Table II in Annex\u00a0I to Regulation (EC) No\u00a0715/2007.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The vehicle shall not be required to exhibit 3\u00a0000 km as mentioned in paragraph\u00a03.1.1 of Annex\u00a04 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a083.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The fuel to be used for the test shall be the reference fuel as prescribed in Annex\u00a0IX to Regulation (EC) No\u00a0692/2008.\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The dynamometer shall be set up in accordance with the technical requirements of paragraph\u00a03.2 of Annex\u00a04 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a083.\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The test referred to in point\u00a0(a) shall not be conducted where it can be shown that the vehicle complies with the California Code Regulations referred to in point\u00a02 of Annex\u00a0I to Regulation (EC) No\u00a0692/2008.\n\n\nEvaporative emissions\n\n\nFor petrol-fuelled engines, the presence of an evaporate emissions control system (e.g. a charcoal canister) shall be required.\n\n\nCrankcase emissions\n\n\nThe presence of a device for recycling crankcase gases shall be required.\n\n\nOBD\n\n\nThe vehicle shall be fitted with an OBD system.\n\n\nOBD-interface must be able to communicate with common diagnostic tools used for periodic technical inspections.\n\n\nSmoke opacity\u00a0\n\n\n(a) Vehicles equipped with a diesel-fuelled engine shall be tested in accordance with the tests methods referred to in Appendix\u00a02 to Annex\u00a0IV to Regulation (EC) No\u00a0692/2008.\n\n\n(b) The corrected value of the absorption coefficient shall be affixed, conspicuously and in a readily accessible place.\n\n\nCO2 emissions and fuel consumption\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A test shall be conducted in accordance with Annex\u00a0XII to Regulation (EC) No\u00a0692/2008.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The vehicle shall not be required to exhibit 3\u00a0000 km as requested in paragraph\u00a03.1.1 of Annex\u00a04 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a083.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where the vehicle complies with the California Code Regulations referred to in point\u00a02 of Annex\u00a0I to Commission Regulation (EC) No\u00a0692/2008 and therefore no test of tailpipe emissions is required to be performed, Member States shall calculate CO2 emissions and fuel consumption with the formula laid down in the explanatory notes (b) and (c).\n\n\nAccess to information\n\n\nThe provisions regarding access to information shall not apply.\n\n\nPower measurement\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a034 (Fuel tanks \u2014 Rear protective devices)\n\n\n\n\nFuel tanks\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Fuel tanks shall comply with paragraph\u00a05 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a034 with the exception of paragraphs 5.1, 5.2 and 5.12. In particular, they shall comply with paragraph\u00a05.9 and 5.9.1 but no dripping test shall be conducted.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0LPG or CNG tanks shall be type-approved in accordance with, respectively UNECE Regulations No\u00a067, series of amendments 01, or Regulation No\u00a0110 (a).\n\n\nSpecific provisions for fuel tanks made of a plastic material\n\n\nThe applicant shall submit a statement from the manufacturer establishing that the fuel tank on the particular vehicle, of which the VIN has to be specified, complies either with at least one of the following:\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0FMVSS No\u00a0301 (Fuel system integrity),\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Annex\u00a05 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a034.\n\n\nRear protective device\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The rear part of the vehicle shall be constructed in accordance with paragraphs 8 and 9 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a034.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No\u00a01003/2010\n\n\n(Rear registration plate space)\n\n\n\n\nSpace, inclination, angles for visibility and position of the registration plate shall comply with Regulation (EU) No\u00a01003/2010.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a079 (Steering effort)\n\n\n\n\nMechanical systems\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The steering mechanism shall be built as to self-centre. In order to check compliance with this provision, a test shall be conducted in accordance with paragraphs 6.1.2 and 6.2.1 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a079.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The failure of the power steering equipment shall not lead to a complete loss of control of the vehicle.\n\n\nComplex electronic vehicle control system (\u2018Drive-by wire\u2019 devices)\n\n\nComplex electronic control system shall be permitted only if they comply with Annex\u00a06 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a079.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n6\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a011 (Door latches and hinges)\n\n\n\n\nCompliance with paragraph\u00a06.1.5.4 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a011\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a028 (Audible warning)\n\n\n\n\nComponents\n\n\nThe audible warning devices are not required to be type-approved in accordance with UNECE Regulation No\u00a028. However, they shall emit a continuous sound as required in paragraph\u00a06.1.1 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a028.\n\n\nInstallation on vehicle\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A test shall be conducted in accordance with paragraph\u00a06.2 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a028.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The maximum sound pressure level shall be in accordance with paragraph\u00a06.2.7.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n8\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a046 (Indirect vision devices)\n\n\n\n\nComponents\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The vehicle shall be fitted with the rear-view mirrors prescribed in paragraph\u00a015.2 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a046.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0They are not required to be type-approved in accordance with UNECE Regulation No\u00a046.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The radii of curvature of the mirrors shall not cause significant image distortions. At the discretion of the technical service, the radii of curvature shall be checked in accordance with the method described in Appendix\u00a01 to Annex\u00a07 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a046. The radii of curvature shall not be less than those required by paragraph\u00a06.1.2.2.4 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a046.\n\n\nInstallation on vehicle\n\n\nMeasurement shall be conducted in order to ensure that the fields of vision comply with paragraph\u00a015.2.4. of UNECE Regulation No\u00a046.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n9\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a013-H\n\n\n(Braking)\n\n\n\n\nGeneral provisions\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The braking system shall be built in accordance with paragraph\u00a05 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a013-H.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Vehicles shall be fitted with an electronic antilock braking system acting on all wheels.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The performances of the braking system shall comply with Annex\u00a0III to UNECE Regulation No\u00a013-H.\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For these purposes, road tests shall be conducted on a track the surface of which possesses high adhesion. The test on the parking brake shall be conducted on a 18 % gradient (up and down).\n\n\nOnly those tests mentioned under the headings \"Service brake\" and \"Parking brake\" below shall be conducted. In each case, the vehicle shall be in fully laden conditions.\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The road test referred to in point\u00a0(c) shall not be conducted where the applicant can submit a statement from the manufacturer establishing that the vehicle complies either with UNECE Regulation No\u00a013-H including supplement 5 or with FMVSS No\u00a0135.\n\n\nService brake\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A \u2018Type 0\u2019 test as prescribed in paragraphs 1.4.2 and 1.4.3 of Annex\u00a03 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a013-H shall be conducted.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0In addition, a \u2018Type I\u2019 test as prescribed in paragraph\u00a01.5 of Annex\u00a03 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a013-H shall be conducted.\n\n\nParking brake\n\n\nA test shall be conducted in accordance with paragraph\u00a02. 3 of Annex\u00a03 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a013-H.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n10\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a010 (Radio interference (electromagnetic compatibility))\n\n\n\n\nComponents\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Electrical/electronic sub-assemblies are not required to be type-approved in accordance with UNECE Regulation No\u00a010.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0However, electric/electronic devices retrofitted shall comply with UNECE Regulation No\u00a010.\n\n\nEmitted electromagnetic radiations\n\n\nThe applicant shall submit a statement from the manufacturer establishing that the vehicle complies with UNECE Regulation No\u00a010 or with the following alternative standards:\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Broadband electromagnetic radiation: CISPR 12 or SAE\u00a0J551-2,\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Narrowband electromagnetic radiation: CISPR 12 (off-board) or 25 (in-board) or SAE J551-4 and SAE J1113-41.\n\n\nImmunity tests\n\n\nImmunity test shall be waived.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n13\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a0116\n\n\n(Anti-theft and immobiliser) \n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0In order to prevent unauthorised use, the vehicle shall be fitted with a locking device as defined in paragraph\u00a05.1.2 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a0116.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0If an immobiliser is fitted, it shall comply with the technical requirements of paragraph\u00a08.1.1 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a0116.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n14\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a012 (Protective steering)\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The applicant shall submit a statement from the manufacturer establishing that the particular vehicle, the VIN\u00a0of which has to be specified, complies with at least one of the following:\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0UNECE Regulation No\u00a012,\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0FMVSS No\u00a0203 (Impact protection for the driver from the steering control system) including FMVSS No\u00a0204 (Steering control rearward displacement),\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Article\u00a011 of JSRRV.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A test in accordance with Annex\u00a03 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a012 may be conducted on a production vehicle at the request of the applicant. The test shall be conducted by a technical service that has been designated for carrying out this test. A detailed report shall be issued by that technical service to the applicant.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n15\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a017 (Seats strength \u2014 head restraints)\n\n\n\n\nSeats, seat anchorages and adjustment systems\n\n\nSeats and their adjustable systems shall comply with paragraph\u00a05.3 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a017.\n\n\nHead restraints\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Head restraints shall fulfil the requirements of section\u00a05 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a017 and Annex\u00a04 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a017.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Only the tests described in paragraphs\u00a05.12, 6.5, 6.6 and 6.7 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a017shall be conducted.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n17\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a039 (Speedometer \u2014 reverse gear)\n\n\n\n\nSpeedometer equipment\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The dial shall comply with paragraphs 5.1 to 5.14 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a039.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0When the technical service has reasonable grounds to believe that the speedometer is not calibrated with a sufficient accuracy, it may require that the tests prescribed in paragraph\u00a05.2 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a039 be conducted.\n\n\nReverse gear\n\n\nThe gear mechanism shall include a reverse gear.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n18\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No\u00a019/2011 (Statutory plates)\n\n\n\n\nVehicle identification number\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The vehicle shall be fitted with a vehicle identification number comprising a minimum of 8 and a maximum of 17 characters. Vehicle identification number comprising 17 characters shall fulfil the requirements set out in Standards ISO\u00a03779:1983 and 3780:1983.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The vehicle identification number shall be located in a clearly visible and accessible position in such a way as it cannot be obliterated or deteriorate.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where no vehicle identification number is stamped in the chassis or in the body, a Member State may require that it is retrofitted in application of its national law. In such a case, the competent authority of that Member State shall supervise the operation.\n\n\nStatutory plate\n\n\nThe vehicle shall be fitted with an identification plate affixed by the vehicle manufacturer.\n\n\nNo additional plate shall be requested after the approval has been granted.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n19\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a014 \n\n\n(Seat belt anchorages)\n\n\n\n\nThe applicant shall submit a statement from the manufacturer establishing that the particular vehicle, of which the VIN\u00a0has to be specified, complies with at least one of the following:\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0UNECE Regulation No\u00a014,\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0FMVSS No\u00a0210 (Seat belt assembly anchorages),\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Article\u00a022-3 of JSRRV.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n20\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a048 (Installation of lighting and light signalling devices)\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The lighting installation shall meet the essential requirements of UNECE Regulation No\u00a048 series of amendments 03 with the exception of those of Annexes 5 and 6 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a048.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0No exemption shall be permitted in respect of the number, the essential design characteristics, the electrical connections, and the colour of light emitted or retro-reflected of the lights and signalling devices referred to in items 21 to 26 and in items 28 to 30.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Lights and signalling devices that, for the purpose of fulfilling with the requirements of point\u00a0(a) must be retrofitted shall bear an \u2018EU\u2019 type-approval mark.\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Lamps fitted with gas-discharged light source are only permitted in conjunction with the installation of headlamp cleaning device and an automatic headlamp-levelling device where appropriate.\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Headlamp dipped-beams shall be adapted to the direction of traffic legally in force in the country where the vehicle is granted approval.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n21\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a03 (Retro reflectors)\n\n\n\n\nWhere necessary, two additional retro reflectors bearing an \u2018EC\u2019 approval mark shall be added at the rear, the position of which shall comply with UNECE Regulation No\u00a048.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n22\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulations No\u00a07, No\u00a087 and No\u00a091\n\n\n(End-outline, front position (side), rear-position (side), stop, side marker, daytime running lamps)\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements set out in UNECE Regulations No\u00a07, No\u00a087 and No\u00a091 shall not apply. However, the correct functioning of the lights shall be checked by the technical service.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n23\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a06 (Direction indicators)\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements set out in UNECE Regulation No\u00a06 shall not apply. However, the correct functioning of the lights shall be checked by the technical service.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n24\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a04 (Rear registration plate lamps)\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements set out in UNECE Regulation No\u00a04 shall not apply. However, the correct functioning of the lights shall be checked by the technical service.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n25\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulations No\u00a098, No\u00a0112 and No\u00a0123 (Headlamps (including bulbs))\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The illumination produced by the passing beam of the headlamps fitted to the vehicle shall be checked under the provisions of paragraph\u00a06 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a0112 concerning headlamps emitting an asymmetrical passing beam. The tolerances included in Annex\u00a05 to that Regulation may be referred to for that purpose.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The same requirement shall apply to the passing beam of headlamps covered by UNECE Regulation No\u00a098 or No\u00a0123.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n26\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a019 (Front fog lamps)\n\n\n\n\nThe provisions of UNECE Regulation No\u00a019 shall be waived. However, the correct functioning of the lights if fitted shall be checked by the technical service.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n27\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No\u00a01005/2010 (Towing hooks)\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements of Regulation (EU) No\u00a01005/2010 shall be waived.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n28\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a038 (Rear fog lamps)\n\n\n\n\nThe provisions of UNECE Regulation No\u00a038 shall be waived. However, the correct functioning of the lights shall be checked by the technical service.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n29\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a023 \n\n\n(Reversing lamps)\n\n\n\n\nThe provisions of UNECE Regulation No\u00a023 shall be waived. However, the correct functioning of the lights if fitted shall be checked by the technical service.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n30\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a077 (Parking lamps)\n\n\n\n\nThe provisions of UNECE Regulation No\u00a077 shall be waived. However, the correct functioning of the lights if fitted shall be checked by the technical service.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n31\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a016 (Seat belts and restraint systems)\n\n\n\n\nComponents\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Seat belts shall not be required to be type-approved in accordance with UNECE Regulation No\u00a016.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0However, each seat belt shall bear an identification label.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The indications on the label shall be consistent with the decision concerning seat belt anchorages (Re: entry 19).\n\n\nInstallation requirements\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The vehicle shall be fitted with seat belts in accordance with the requirements set out in Annex\u00a0XVI to UNECE Regulation No\u00a016.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where a number of seat belts have to be retrofitted in accordance with point\u00a0(a), they shall be of an approved type in accordance with UNECE Regulation No\u00a016.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n33\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a0121 (Identification of controls, tell-tales and indicators)\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The symbols including the colour of their corresponding tell-tales the presence of which is mandatory by virtue of UNECE Regulation No\u00a0121 shall comply with that UNECE Regulation.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where this is not the case, the technical service shall verify that the symbols, tell-tales and indicators fitted to the vehicle provide the driver with comprehensible information about the operation of the controls in question.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n34\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No\u00a0672/2010\n\n\n(Defrost/Demist)\n\n\n\n\nThe vehicle shall be equipped with adequate windscreen defrosting and windscreen demisting devices.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n35\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No\u00a01008/2010 \n\n\n(Wash/Wipe)\n\n\n\n\nThe vehicle shall be equipped with adequate windscreen washing and windscreen wiping devices.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n36\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a0122\n\n\n(Heating systems)\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The passenger compartment shall be fitted with a heating system.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Combustion heaters and their installation shall comply with Annex\u00a07 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a0122. In addition, LPG combustion heaters and LPG heating systems shall fulfil the requirements set out in Annex\u00a08 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a0122.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Additional heating systems that are retrofitted shall comply with the requirements set out in UNECE Regulation No\u00a0122.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n41a\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0595/2009\n\n\nEmissions (Euro VI) heavy-duty vehicles \u2013 OBD\n\n\n\n\nTailpipe emissions\u00a0\n\n\nCO2 emissions\u00a0\n\n\nThe CO2 emissions and fuel consumption shall be determined in accordance with Annex\u00a0VIII to Regulation (EU) No\u00a0582/2011.\n\n\nOBD\u00a0\n\n\nRequirements to ensure the correct operation of NOx control measures\u00a0\n\n\nThe vehicle shall be fitted with a system ensuring the correct operation of NOx control measures in accordance with Annex\u00a0XIII to Regulation (EU) No\u00a0582/2011. \n\n\nPower measurement\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n45\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a043\n\n\n\n\nComponents\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The glazing shall be made either of tempered or laminated safety glass.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Fitting of plastic glazing shall be permitted only on locations situated behind the \u2018B\u2019 pillar.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Glazing shall not be required to be approved under UNECE Regulation No\u00a043.\n\n\nInstallation\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The installation requirements set out in Annex\u00a021 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a043 shall apply.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0No tinted films that reduce the regular light transmission under the required minimum shall be permitted on the windscreen and on the glazing located in front of the \u2018B\u2019 pillar.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n46\n\n\n\n\nCommission Regulation (EU) 458/2011\n\n\n(Installation of tyres)\n\n\n\n\nInstallation\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The dimensions, load-capacity index and speed category of the tyres shall fulfil the requirements of Commission Regulation (EU) 458/2011.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The speed category symbol of the tyre shall be compatible with the maximum design speed of the vehicle.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0This requirement shall apply notwithstanding the presence of a speed limiter.\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The maximum speed of the vehicle shall be stated by the vehicle manufacturer. However, the technical service may assess the maximum design speed of the vehicle by using the engine maximum power output, the maximum number of revolutions per minute and the data concerning the kinematic chain.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n46B\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a030\n\n\n(C1 tyres)\n\n\n\n\nComponents\n\n\nTyres shall bear an \u2018E\u2019 type-approval mark.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n46D\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a0117\n\n\n(tyre rolling sound emissions, adhesion on wet surface and rolling resistance)\n\n\n\n\nComponents\n\n\nTyres shall bear an \u2018E\u2019 type-approval mark.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n46D\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009 \n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a064\n\n\n(temporary use spare unit, run-flat tyres, tyre rolling sound emissions, adhesion on wet surface and rolling resistance)\n\n\n\n\nComponents\n\n\nTyres shall bear an \u2018E\u2019 type-approval mark.\n\n\nThe fitting of TPMS shall not be required\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n48\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No\u00a01230/2012\n\n\n(Masses and dimensions)\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The requirements of Annex\u00a0I, Part\u00a0A to Regulation (EU) No\u00a01230/2012 shall be fulfilled.\n\n\nHowever, the requirements set out in point\u00a05 of Part\u00a0A of Annex\u00a0I do not need to be fulfilled.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For the purposes of point\u00a0(a) the masses to be considered are the following:\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the mass in running order as defined in Article\u00a02(4) of Regulation (EU) No\u00a01230/2012 as measured by the technical service, and\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the maximum laden masses either stated by the vehicle manufacturer or shown on the manufacturer\u2019s plate, including stickers or information available in the owner\u2019s manual. Those masses shall be regarded as the technically permissible maximum laden masses.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Technical changes made by the applicant in order to decrease the maximum technically permissible laden mass of the vehicle to 3,5\u00a0tonnes or less, so that the vehicle may be granted individual vehicle approval shall not be permitted.\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0No exemption shall be permitted in respect of the maximum permissible dimensions.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n49\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a061 (External projections of cabs)\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The general requirements set out in section\u00a05 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a017 shall be fulfilled.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0At the discretion of the technical service, the requirements set out in paragraphs 6.1, 6.5, 6.6, 6.7, 6.8 and 6.11 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a017 shall be fulfilled.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n50\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a055 (Couplings)\n\n\n\n\nSeparate technical units\u00a0\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0OEM couplings intended for towing a trailer of which the maximum mass does not exceed 1\u00a0500 kg shall not be required to be type-approved under UNECE Regulation No\u00a055.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A coupling is deemed OEM equipment where it is described in the owner\u2019s manual or in an equivalent supporting document provided to the buyer by the vehicle manufacturer.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where such coupling is approved with the vehicle, an appropriate text shall be included in the approval certificate stating that the owner is responsible for ensuring compatibility with the coupling device fitted to the trailer.\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Couplings other than those referred to in point\u00a0(a), as well as couplings that are retrofitted, shall be type-approved in accordance with UNECE Regulation No\u00a055.\n\n\nInstallation on the vehicle\n\n\nThe technical service shall check that the installation of the coupling devices comply with paragraph\u00a06 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a055.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n54\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a095 \n\n\n(Side impact)\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The applicant shall submit a statement from the manufacturer establishing that the particular vehicle, of which the VIN\u00a0has to be specified, complies with at least one of the following:\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0UNECE Regulation No\u00a095,\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0FMVSS No\u00a0214 (Side impact protection), \n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Article\u00a018 of JSRRV.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A test in accordance with section\u00a05 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a095 may be conducted on a production vehicle at the request of the applicant.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The test shall be conducted by a technical service that been designated for carrying out this test. A detailed report shall be issued by that technical service to the applicant.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n56\n\n\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a0105 \n\n\nVehicles intended for the transport of dangerous goods\n\n\n\n\nVehicles intended for the transport of dangerous goods shall comply with UNECE Regulation No\u00a0105.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n58\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a078/2009\n\n\n(Pedestrian protection)\n\n\n\n\nBrake assist\n\n\nVehicles shall be fitted with an electronic antilock braking system acting on all wheels.\n\n\nPedestrian protection\n\n\nUntil 24 February 2018, the requirements of Regulation (EC) No\u00a078/2009 shall not apply to vehicles of which the maximum mass does not exceed 2\u00a0500 kg and until 24\u00a0August 2019 to vehicles of which the maximum mass exceeds 2\u00a0500 kg.\n\n\nFrontal protection systems\n\n\nHowever, frontal protection systems installed on the vehicle shall be type-approved in accordance with Regulation (EC) No\u00a078/2009 and their installation shall comply with the requirements set out in section\u00a06 of Annex\u00a0I to that Regulation.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n59\n\n\n\n\nDirective 2005/64/EC\n\n\n(Recyclability)\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements of that Directive shall not apply.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n61\n\n\n\n\nDirective 2006/40/EC\n\n\n(Air-conditioning system)\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements of that Directive shall apply.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nExplanatory notes to Appendix\u00a02 \n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Abbreviations used in this Appendix:\n\n\n\u2018OEM\u2019: original equipment provided by the manufacturer\n\n\n\u2018FMVSS\u2019: Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard of the U.S Department of Transportation\n\n\n\u2018JSRRV\u2019: Japan Safety Regulations for Road Vehicles\n\n\n\u2018SAE\u2019: Society of Automotive Engineers\n\n\n\u2018CISPR\u2019: Comit\u00e9 international sp\u00e9cial des perturbations radio\u00e9lectriques. \n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Remarks:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the complete LPG or CNG installation shall be checked against the provisions of UNECE Regulations No\u00a067, No\u00a0110 or No\u00a0115, as appropriate; \n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the formula to be used for the assessment of CO2 emissions shall be as follows:\n\n\nPetrol engine and manual gearbox: \n\n\nCO 2 = 0,047 m + 0,561 p + 56,621 \n\n\nPetrol engine and automatic gearbox: \n\n\nCO 2 = 0,102 m + 0,328 p + 9,481 \n\n\nPetrol engine and hybrid electric: \n\n\nCO 2 = 0,116 m \u2013 57,147 \n\n\nDiesel engine and manual gearbox: \n\n\nCO 2 = 0,108 m \u2013 11,371 \n\n\nDiesel engine and automatic gearbox: \n\n\n\n\nCO 2 = 0,116 m \u2013 6,432 \n\n\nWhere: CO 2 is the combined mass of CO 2 emissions in g/km, \u2018m\u2019 is the mass of the vehicle in running order in kg and \u2018p\u2019 the maximum engine power output in kW. \n\n\nCombined mass of CO 2 shall be calculated with one decimal place, then rounded to the nearest whole number as follows:\n\n\n(i) if the figure following the decimal point is below 5, the total is rounded down; \n\n\n(ii) if the figure following the decimal point is equal to 5 or above 5, the total is rounded up; \n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the formul\u00e6 to be used for the assessment of fuel consumption shall be as follows: \n\n\nCFC = CO 2 x k -1\u00a0\n\n\nWhere: CFC is the combined fuel consumption in l/100 km, CO 2 is the combined mass of CO 2 emissions in g/km after it has been rounded in accordance with the rule referred to in Remark (2 b), \u2018k\u2019 a coefficient equal to: \n\n\n23,81 in the case of a petrol engine; \n\n\n26,49 in the case of a diesel engine. \n\n\nCombined fuel consumption shall be calculated with two decimal places, then rounded as follows: \n\n\n(i) if the figure following the first decimal is below 5, the total is rounded down; \n\n\n(ii) if the figure following the first decimal is equal to 5 or above 5, the total is rounded up. \n\n\n\n\nPART\u00a0II\n\n\nList of UNECE regulations recognised as an alternative to the Directives or Regulations referred to in Part\u00a0I\n\n\nWhere reference is made to a separate Directive or Regulation in the table of Part\u00a0I, an approval granted under the following UNECE regulations which the Community has accepted as a Contracting Party to the United Nations Economic Commission for Europe \u2018Revised 1958 Agreement\u2019 by virtue of Council Decision 97/836/EC\n29\n, or subsequent Council Decisions as referred to in Article\u00a03(3) of that Decision, shall be considered as equivalent to an EU type-approval granted under the relevant separate Directive or Regulation.\n\n\nAny further amendment to the UNECE regulations listed in the following table \n30\n shall also be deemed to be equivalent to an EU type-approval, subject to the Decision referred to in Article\u00a04(2) of Decision 97/836/EC.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSubject\n\n\n\n\nBasic UNECE Regulation number\n\n\n\n\nSeries of amendments\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1 (*)\n\n\n\n\nPermissible sound level\n\n\n\n\n51\n\n\n\n\n02\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nReplacement silencing systems\n\n\n\n\n59\n\n\n\n\n00\n\n\n\n\n\n\n58.\n\n\n\n\nPedestrian protection\n\n\n\n\n127\n\n\n\n\n00\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nBraking (brake assist)\n\n\n\n\n13-H\n\n\n\n\n00 (Supplement 9 and above)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n65\n\n\n\n\nAdvanced emergency braking system\n\n\n\n\n131\n\n\n\n\n01\n\n\n\n\n\n\n66\n\n\n\n\nLane departure warning system\n\n\n\n\n130\n\n\n\n\n00\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nWhere the separate Directive or Regulation contains installation requirements, these apply also to components and separate technical units approved in accordance with UNECE regulations. \n\n\n(*) The numbering of the entries in this table refers to the numbering used in the table of Part\u00a0I.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nPART\u00a0III\n\n\nList of regulatory acts setting out the requirements for the purpose of EU type-approval of special purpose mass.\n\n\nAdditional requirements for ambulances \n\n\nThe patient compartment of ambulances shall comply with the requirements of EN 1789:2007 +A1: 2010 +A2:2014 on Medical vehicles and their equipment \u2013 Road ambulances with the exception of section\u00a06.5, list of equipment. Proof of compliance shall be provided with a test report of a technical service. If a wheelchair space is foreseen, the requirements of Appendix\u00a03 relating to the wheelchair tie down and occupant restraint systems shall apply.\n\n\n\n\nAppendix\u00a02\n\n\nArmoured Regulation No\u00a097\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\n\n69\n\n\n\n\nElectric safety\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a0100\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\n\n70\n\n\n\n\nSpecific components for CNG and their installation on motor vehicles\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a0110\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\nAdditional requirements for testing the wheelchair tie down and occupant restraint system \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nThe following section\u00a01 and either section\u00a02 or 3 shall apply. \n\n\n\n\n\n1. Definitions\n\n\n\n\n\n1.1.\n\n\n\n\nSurrogate wheelchair (SWC) means a rigid, re-usable test wheelchair, as defined in section\u00a03 of ISO\u00a010542-1:2012.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.2.\n\n\n\n\nPoint P means a representation of the position of the wheelchair occupant's hip when seated in the SWC, as defined in section\u00a03 of ISO\u00a010542-1:2012.\n\n\n\n\n\n2. General requirements\n\n\n\n\n\n2.1.\n\n\n\n\nEach wheelchair location shall be provided with anchorages to which a wheelchair tie-down and occupant restraint system (WTORS) shall be fitted.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.2.\n\n\n\n\nThe wheelchair occupant\u2019s lower belt anchorages shall be located in accordance with UNECE Regulation No\u00a014-07, paragraph\u00a05.4.2.2, relative to Point P on the SWC, when placed in the travelling position designated by the manufacturer. The upper actual anchorage(s) shall be located at least 1\u00a0100 mm above the horizontal plane passing through the points of contact between the rear tyres of the SWC and the vehicle floor. This condition shall still be satisfied after the test carried out according to point\u00a03 of this Appendix.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.3.\n\n\n\n\nAn assessment shall be made of the WTORS occupant belt to ensure compliance with the provisions of UNECE Regulation No\u00a016-06, paragraphs 8.2.2 to 8.2.2.4 and 8.3.1 to 8.3.4.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.4.\n\n\n\n\nThe minimum number of ISOFIX child seat anchorages need not to be provided. In the case of a multi-stage typeapproval where an ISOFIX anchorage system has been affected by the conversion, either the system shall be re-tested or the anchorages shall be rendered unusable. In the latter case the ISOFIX labels shall be removed and appropriate information shall be given to the vehicle purchaser.\n\n\n\n\n\n3. Static in-vehicle testing\n\n\n3.1. Wheelchair occupant restraint anchorages\n\n\n\n\n\n3.1.1.\n\n\n\n\nThe wheelchair occupant restraint anchorages shall resist the static forces prescribed for occupant restraint anchorages in UNECE Regulation No\u00a014-07, simultaneously with the static forces applied to the wheelchair tie-down anchorages as specified in point\u00a03.2 of this Appendix.\n\n\n\n\n\n3.2. Wheelchair tie-down anchorages\n\n\nThe wheelchair tie-down anchorages shall resist the following forces, for at least 0.2 seconds, applied via the SWC (or a suitable surrogate wheelchair having a wheelbase, seat height and tie-down attachment points in accordance with the specification for the SWC), at a height of 300 +/\u2013 100 mm from the surface on which the SWC rests:\n\n\n\n\n\n3.2.1.\n\n\n\n\nIn the case of a forward-facing wheelchair, a simultaneous force, coincident with the force applied to the occupant restraint anchorages, of 24,5 kN, and\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.2.2.\n\n\n\n\na second test applying a static force of 8,2 kN directed towards the rear of the vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.2.3.\n\n\n\n\nIn the case of a rearward-facing wheelchair, a simultaneous force, coincident with the force applied to the occupant restraint anchorages, of 8,2 kN, and\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.2.4.\n\n\n\n\na second test applying a static force of 24,5 kN directed towards the front of the vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n\n3.3. Components of the system\n\n\n\n\n\n3.3.1.\n\n\n\n\nAll components of the WTORS shall meet the relevant requirements of ISO\u00a010542-1:2012. However, the dynamic test specified in Annex\u00a0A and paragraphs 5.2.2 and 5.2.3 of ISO\u00a010542-1:2012 shall be carried out on the complete WTORS using the vehicle anchorage geometry instead of the test geometry specified in Annex\u00a0A of ISO\u00a010542-1:2012. This may be carried out within the vehicle structure or on a surrogate structure representative of the vehicle\u2019s WTORS anchorage geometry. The location of each anchorage shall lie within the tolerance provided for in paragraph\u00a07.7.1 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a016-06.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.3.2.\n\n\n\n\nWhere the occupant restraint part of the WTORS is approved according to UNECE Regulation No\u00a016-06, it shall be subject to the dynamic test of the complete WTORS specified in paragraph\u00a03.3.1 of this appendix but the requirements of paragraphs 5.1, 5.3 and 5.4 of ISO10542-1:2012 shall be considered to have been met.\n\n\n\n\n\n4. Dynamic in-vehicle testing\n\n\n\n\n\n4.1.\n\n\n\n\nThe full assembly of the WTORS system shall be tested by an in-vehicle dynamic test in accordance with paragraphs 5.2.2 and 5.2.3 and Annex\u00a0A of ISO\u00a010542-1:2012, testing all components/anchorages simultaneously, using a vehicle body-in-white or representative structure.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.2.\n\n\n\n\nThe component parts of the WTORS shall meet the relevant requirements of ISO10542-1:2012, paragraphs 5.1, 5.3 and 5.4. These requirements shall be deemed to have been met in respect of the occupant restraint if it is approved according to UNECE Regulation No\u00a016-06.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAppendix\u00a04\n\n\nOther special purpose vehicles\n(including special group, multi-equipment carrier and trailer caravans)\n\n\nThe exemptions provided for in this appendix are only permitted if the manufacturer demonstrates to the satisfaction of the approval authority that the vehicle, due to the special function, cannot meet all the requirements set out in Part\u00a0I of Annex\u00a0IV.\n\n\n\n\n\nItem\n\n\n\n\nSubject\n\n\n\n\nReference to regulatory
