89\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n48A\n\n\n\n\nMasses and dimensions\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No 661/2009\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No 1230/2012\n\n\n\n\nA\n\n\n\n\nA\n\n\n\n\n\n\n49A\n\n\n\n\nCommercial vehicles with regard to their external projections forward of the cab\u2019s rear panel\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No 661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No 61\n\n\n\n\nA\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n50A\n\n\n\n\nMechanical coupling components of combinations of vehicles\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No 661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No 55\n\n\n\n\nX(10)\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\n\n50B\n\n\n\n\nClose-coupling device (CCD); fitting of an approved type of CCD\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No 661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No 102\n\n\n\n\nX(10)\n\n\n\n\nX(10)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n56A\n\n\n\n\nVehicles for the carriage of dangerous goods\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No 661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No 105\n\n\n\n\nX(13)\n\n\n\n\nX(13)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n57A\n\n\n\n\nFront underrun protective devices (FUPDs) and their installation; front underrun protection (FUP)\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No 661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No 93\n\n\n\n\nA\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n62\n\n\n\n\nHydrogen system\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No 79/2009\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n63\n\n\n\n\nGeneral Safety\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No 661/2009\n\n\n\n\nX (15)\n\n\n\n\nX(15)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n65\n\n\n\n\nAdvanced emergency braking system\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No 661/2009\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No 347/2012\n\n\n\n\nN/A (16)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n66\n\n\n\n\nLane departure warning system\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No 661/2009\n\n\nRegulation (EU) No 351/2012\n\n\n\n\nN/A (17)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n67\n\n\n\n\nSpecific components for liquefied petroleum gases (LPG) and their installation on motor vehicles\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No 661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No 67\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n69\n\n\n\n\nElectric safety\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No 661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No 100\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n70\n\n\n\n\nSpecific components for CNG and their installation on motor vehicles\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No 661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No 110\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\u00a0Explanatory Notes on the applicability of the requirements\n\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements set out in the relevant regulatory act are applicable. The series of amendments of the UNECE regulations that apply on a compulsory basis are listed in Annex\u00a0IV to Regulation (EC) No 661/2009. The series of amendments adopted subsequently are accepted as an alternative. Member States may grant extensions to existing type-approvals granted in accordance with the Directives repealed by Regulation (EC) 661/2009 under the conditions laid down in Article\u00a013(14) of that Regulation.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nN/A\n\n\n\n\nThis regulatory act is not applicable to this vehicle (no requirements).\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(1)\n\n\n\n\nFor vehicles with a reference mass not exceeding 2\u00a0610 kg. At the manufacturer\u2019s request, Regulation (EC) No\u00a0715/2007 may apply to vehicles with a reference mass not exceeding 2\u00a0840 kg. \n\n\nWith regard to access to information, for other parts (e.g. living compartment) than the base vehicle, it is sufficient that the manufacturer provides access to vehicle repair and maintenance information in a readily accessible and prompt manner.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(2)\n\n\n\n\nIn case of vehicles equipped with a LPG or CNG installation, a vehicle type-approval in accordance with UNECE Regulation No\u00a067 or UNECE Regulation No\u00a0110 is required.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(3)\n\n\n\n\nThe fitting of an electronic stability control (\u2018ESC\u2019) system is required by Article\u00a012 and Article\u00a013 of Regulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009. However, in accordance with UNECE Regulation No\u00a013, the fitting of an ESC system is not required for special purpose vehicles of categories M2, M3, N2 and N3 and for vehicles for exceptional load transport and trailers with areas for standing passengers. N1 vehicles may be approved in accordance with UNECE Regulations No\u00a013 or No\u00a013-H.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(4)\n\n\n\n\nThe fitting of an ESC system is required by Article\u00a012 and Article\u00a013 of Regulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009. Therefore, the requirements set out in Part\u00a0A of Annex\u00a09 to UNECE Regulation\u00a0No 13-H shall be fulfilled. N1 vehicles may be approved in accordance with UNECE Regulation No\u00a013 or UNECE Regulation No\u00a013-H.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(4A)\n\n\n\n\nIf fitted, the protective device shall fulfil the requirements set out in UNECE Regulation No\u00a018.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(4B)\n\n\n\n\nThis Regulation applies to seats not falling within the scope of UNECE Regulation No\u00a080. For other options, see Article\u00a02 of Regulation (EC) No 595/2009.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(5)\n\n\n\n\nVehicles of categories other than M1 do not need to fully comply with Regulation (EU) No\u00a0672/2010 but shall be fitted with a windscreen defrosting and demisting device.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(6)\n\n\n\n\nVehicles of categories other than M1 do not need to fully comply with Regulation (EU) No \u00a01008/2010 but shall be fitted with a windscreen washing and wiping devices.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(8)\n\n\n\n\nFor vehicles with a reference mass exceeding 2\u00a0610 kg and that did not benefit from the possibility offered in note (1).\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(9)\n\n\n\n\nFor vehicles with a reference mass exceeding 2\u00a0610 kg that are not type-approved (at the manufacturer\u2019s request and provided their reference mass does not exceed 2\u00a0840 kg) under Regulation (EC) No 715/2007. For other parts than the base vehicle, it is sufficient that the manufacturer provides access to vehicle repair and maintenance information in a readily accessible and prompt manner\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(9A)\n\n\n\n\nApplies only where such vehicles are fitted with equipment covered by UNECE Regulation No 64. Tyre pressure monitoring system for M1 vehicles applies on a compulsory basis in accordance with Article\u00a09(2) of Regulation (EC) No 661/2009.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(10)\n\n\n\n\nApplies only to vehicles equipped with coupling(s).\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(11)\n\n\n\n\nApplies to vehicles with a technically permissible maximum laden mass not exceeding 2,5 tonnes.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(12)\n\n\n\n\nOnly applicable to vehicles where the \u2018Seating Reference Point (\u201cR\u201d point)\u2019 of the lowest seat is not more than 700 mm above the ground level.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(13)\n\n\n\n\nApplies only where the manufacturer applies for type-approval of vehicles intended for the transport of dangerous goods.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(14)\n\n\n\n\nApplies only for vehicles of category N1, class I (reference mass \u2264 1 305 kg)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(15)\n\n\n\n\nAt the request of the manufacturer, a type-approval may be granted under this item, as an alternative to obtaining type-approvals under each individual item covered by Regulation (EC) No 661/2009.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(16)\n\n\n\n\nThe fitting of an advanced emergency braking system is not required for special purpose vehicles in accordance with Article\u00a01 of Regulation (EU) No 347/2012.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(17)\n\n\n\n\nThe fitting of a lane departure warning system is not required for special purpose vehicles in accordance with Article\u00a01 of Regulation (EU) No 351/2012.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA\n\n\n\n\nThe approval authority may only grant exemption(s) if the manufacturer demonstrates that the vehicle cannot meet the requirements due to its special purpose. The exemptions granted are to be described on the vehicle type-approval certificate and the certificate of conformity (remark \u2013item 52 of the CoC).\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA1\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nThe fitting of ESC is not mandatory. In the case of multi-stage typeapprovals, where the modifications made at a particular stage are likely to affect the function of the base vehicle\u2019s ESC system, the manufacturer may either disable the system or demonstrate that the vehicle has not been rendered unsafe or unstable. This may be demonstrated, e.g., by performing rapid double lane-change manoeuvres in each direction at 80 km/h with sufficient severity to cause intervention by the ESC system. These interventions are to be well-controlled and should improve the stability of the vehicle. The technical service has the right to request further testing if deemed necessary.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB\n\n\n\n\nApplication limited to doors giving access to the seats designated for normal use where the vehicle is used on a public road and where the distance between the R point of the seat and the average plane of the door surface, measured perpendicular to the longitudinal medium plane of the vehicle, does not exceed 500 mm.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC\n\n\n\n\nApplication limited to that part of the vehicle in front of the rearmost seat designated for normal use where the vehicle is used on a public road and also limited to the head impact zone as defined in the relevant regulatory act.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD\n\n\n\n\nApplication limited to seats designated for normal use where the vehicle is used on a public road. Seats that are not designated for use where the vehicle is used on the public road are to be clearly identified to users either by means of a pictogram or a sign with an appropriate text. The luggage retention requirements of UNECE Regulation No\u00a017 do not apply. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nE\n\n\n\n\nFront only.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nF\n\n\n\n\nModification to the routing and length of the refuelling duct and re-positioning of the tank inboard is permissible.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nG\n\n\n\n\nIn case of multi-stage type-approval, requirements according to the category of the base/incomplete vehicle (e.g. the chassis of which was used to build the special purpose vehicle) may also be used.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nH\n\n\n\n\nModification of exhaust system length after the last silencer not exceeding 2 m is permissible without any further test.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nI\n\n\n\n\nTyres are to be type-approved in accordance with the requirements set out in UNECE Regulation No\u00a054 even if the design speed of the vehicle is less than 80 km/h. The load capacity may be adjusted in relation to the maximum design speed of the trailer in agreement with the tyre manufacturer.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nJ\n\n\n\n\nFor all window glazing other than driver's cab glazing (windshield and side glasses), the material may be either of safety glass or rigid plastic glazing.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nK\n\n\n\n\nAdditional panic alarm devices are permitted.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nL\n\n\n\n\nApplication limited to seats designated for normal use where the vehicle is used on a public road. At least anchorages for lap belts are required in the rear seating positions. Seats that are not designated for use where the vehicle is used on a public road are to be clearly identified to users either by means of a pictogram or a sign with an appropriate text. ISOFIX is not required on ambulances and hearses.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nM\n\n\n\n\nApplication limited to seats designated for normal use where the vehicle is used on a public road. At least lap belts are required in all rear seating positions. Seats that are not designated for use when the vehicle is used on a public road are to be clearly identified to users either by means of a pictogram or a sign with an appropriate text. ISOFIX is not required on ambulances and hearses.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nN\n\n\n\n\nProvided that all mandatory lighting devices are installed and that the geometric visibility is not affected.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nQ\n\n\n\n\nModification of exhaust system length after the last silencer not exceeding 2 m is permissible without any further test. An EU type-approval issued to the most representative base vehicle remains valid irrespective of change in the reference weight.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nR\n\n\n\n\nProvided that the registration plates of all Member States can be mounted and remain visible.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nS\n\n\n\n\nThe light transmission factor is at least 60 % and the \u201cA\u201d pillar obstruction angle is not more than 10\u00a0degrees.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nT\n\n\n\n\nTest to be performed only with the complete/completed vehicle. The vehicle can be tested in accordance with Directive 70/157/EEC. Concerning point\u00a05.2.2.1 of Annex\u00a0I to Directive 70/157/EEC, the following limit values are applicable:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nU\n\n\n\n\nTest to be performed only with the complete/completed vehicle. Vehicles up to 4 axles are to comply with all the requirements laid down in the relevant regulatory acts Derogations are admitted for vehicles having more than 4 axles, provided that\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nU1\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nABS is not mandatory for vehicles with hydrostatic drive.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nV\n\n\n\n\nAlternatively, Directive 97/68/EC may also apply.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nV1\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nAlternatively, Directive 97/68/EC may also apply to vehicles with hydrostatic drive.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nW0\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nModification of exhaust system length is permitted without any further test, provided that the back pressure is similar. If a new test is required, an extra 2dB(A) above the applicable limit is allowed.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nW1\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nModification in the exhaust system is permitted without any further test of tailpipe emissions and CO2/fuel consumption provided that the emission control devices, including particulate filters (if any), are not affected. If the evaporative control devices are kept as fitted by the manufacturer of the base vehicle, no new evaporative test is required on the modified vehicle. \n\n\nAn EU type approval issued to the most representative base vehicle remains valid irrespective of change in the reference mass.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nW2\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nModification of the routing, length of the refuelling duct, fuel hoses and fuel vapour pipes is permitted without further test. Re-location of the original fuel tank is permitted provided all requirements are met. However, further testing in accordance with Annex\u00a05 to UNECE Regulation No\u00a034 are not required.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nW3\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nThe longitudinal plane of the intended wheelchair-travelling position should be parallel to the longitudinal plane of the vehicle.\n\n\nAppropriate information is to be made available to the vehicle owner that, in order to withstand the forces transmitted by the tie-down mechanism during the various driving conditions, a wheelchair with a structure meeting the relevant part of ISO\u00a07176-19:2008 is recommended.\n\n\nThe seats of the vehicle may be adapted without further testing, provided it can be demonstrated to the technical service that their anchorages, mechanisms and head restraints provide the same level of performance.\n\n\nThe luggage retention requirements set out in UNECE Regulation No\u00a017 do not apply.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nW4\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nCompliance with the relevant regulatory act(s) is required for the boarding aids when in the resting position.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nW5\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nEach wheelchair location is to be provided with anchorages to which a wheelchair tie-down and occupant restraint system (WTORS) is to be fitted, and that complies with the additional provisions for testing the wheelchair tie down and occupant restraint system set out in Appendix\u00a03.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nW6\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nEach wheelchair location is to be provided with an occupant restraint belt that complies with the additional provisions for testing the wheelchair tie down and occupant restraint system of set out in Appendix\u00a03.\n\n\nWhen, due to the conversion, anchorage points for the safety belts need to be moved outside the tolerance provided for in paragraph\u00a07.7.1 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a016-06, the technical service  is to check whether the alteration constitutes a worst case or not. If that is the case, the test provided for in paragraph\u00a07.7.1. of UNECE Regulation No\u00a016-06 is to be performed. Extension to the EU type-approval does not need to be issued. The test may be performed using components that have not undergone the conditioning test prescribed by UNECE Regulation No\u00a016-06.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nW8\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nFor the purposes of calculations, the mass of the wheel-chair including the user is assumed to be 160 kg. The mass is to be concentrated at the P point of the surrogate wheelchair in its travelling position declared by the manufacturer.\n\n\nAny limitation in the passenger capacity resulting from the use of wheelchair(s) is to be recorded in the owner\u2019s handbook, on side 2 of the EU type-approval certificate and in the certificate of conformity (remark section).\n\n\n\n\n\n\nW9\n\n\n\n\nModification of the exhaust system length is permitted without the need for retesting, provided that the exhaust back pressure remains similar.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nY\n\n\n\n\nProvided that all mandatory lighting devices are installed.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nZ\n\n\n\n\nThe requirements on the protrusion of open windows do not apply to the living compartment.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nZ1\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nMobile cranes with more than six axles are considered to be off-road vehicles (N3G) when at least three axles are driven and provided they meet the provisions of Annex\u00a0II, point\u00a04.3(b)(ii) and (iii), as well as point\u00a04.3(c).\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX\u00a0V\n\n\nPROCEDURES TO BE FOLLOWED WITH RESPECT TO EU TYPE-APPROVAL \n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Objectives and scope \n\n\n1.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0This Annex establishes the procedures for the proper operation of the vehicle type-approval in accordance with Articles 24, 25 and 26.\n\n\n\n\n1.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0It also includes:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the list of international standards which are of relevance for the designation of the technical services in accordance with Articles 72 and 74;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the description of the procedure to be followed for the assessment of the skills of technical services in accordance with Article\u00a077;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the general requirements for the drafting of test reports by technical services.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Type-approval procedure \n\n\nWhen receiving an application for vehicle type-approval, the approval authority shall:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0verify that all EU type-approval certificates issued pursuant to the regulatory acts which are applicable for vehicle type-approval cover the type of vehicle and correspond to the prescribed requirements;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0make sure that the vehicle specifications and data contained in Part\u00a0I of the vehicle information document are included in the data in the information packages and in the EU type-approval certificates issued in accordance with the relevant regulatory acts;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0when an item number in Part\u00a0I of the information document is not included in the information package as provided for in any of the regulatory acts, confirm that the relevant part or characteristic conforms to the particulars in the information folder;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0on a selected sample of vehicles from the type to be approved carry out or arrange to be carried out inspections of vehicle parts and systems to verify that the vehicle or vehicles are built in accordance with the relevant data contained in the authenticated information package in respect of the relevant EU type-approval certificates;\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0carry out or arrange to be carried out relevant installation checks in respect of separate technical units, where applicable;\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0carry out or arrange to be carried out necessary checks in respect of the presence of the devices provided for in notes 1 and 2 of Part\u00a0I of Annex\u00a0IV, where applicable;\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0carry out or arrange to be carried out necessary checks in order to ensure that the requirements set out in note 5 of Part\u00a0I of Annex\u00a0IV are fulfilled.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Combination of technical specifications \n\n\nThe number of vehicles to be submitted shall be sufficient to permit the proper check of the various combinations to be type-approved according to the following criteria:\n\n\n\n\n\nTechnical specifications\n\n\n\n\nVehicle category\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nM1\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nM2\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nM3\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nN1\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nN2\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nN3\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nO1\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nO2\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nO3\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nO4\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n\n\nEngine\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\n\nGear box\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\n\nNumber of axles\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\n\nPowered axles (number, position and interconnection)\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSteered axles (number and position)\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\n\nBody styles\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\n\nNumber of doors\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\n\nHand of drive\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\n\nNumber of seats\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLevel of equipment\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\nX\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\n\n\n\n\n4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Specific provisions \n\n\nWhere no approval certificates as provided for in the relevant regulatory acts are available, the approval authority shall:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0arrange for the necessary tests and checks as required by each of the relevant regulatory acts;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0verify that the vehicle conforms to the particulars in the vehicle information folder and that it meets the technical requirements of each of the relevant regulatory acts;\n\n\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0carry out or arrange to be carried out relevant installation checks in respect of separate technical units, where applicable;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0carry out or arrange to be carried out necessary checks in respect of the presence of the devices provided for in notes 1 and 2 of Part\u00a0I of Annex\u00a0IV where applicable;\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0carry out or arrange to be carried out necessary checks in order to ensure that the requirements set out in note 5 of Part\u00a0I of Annex\u00a0IV are fulfilled. \n\n\n\n\nAppendix\u00a01\n\n\nStandards with which the entities referred to in Article\u00a072 have to comply\n\n\n\n\n\n1.\n\n\n\n\nActivities related to testing for type-approval to be carried out in accordance with the regulatory acts listed in Annex\u00a0IV:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.1.\n\n\n\n\nCategory A (tests performed in own facilities):\n\n\nEN ISO/IEC 17025:2005 on the general requirements for the competence of testing and calibration laboratories.\n\n\nA technical service designated for category A activities may carry out or supervise the tests provided for in the regulatory acts for which it has been designated, in the facilities of a manufacturer or of its representative.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.2.\n\n\n\n\nCategory B (supervising of tests performed in the manufacturer\u2019s facilities or in the facilities of its representative):\n\n\nEN ISO/IEC 17020:2012 on the general criteria for the operation of various types of bodies performing inspection.\n\n\nBefore performing or supervising any test in the facilities of a manufacturer or of its representative, the technical service shall verify that the tests facilities and measurement devices comply with the appropriate requirements of the standard referred to in point\u00a01.1.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.\n\n\n\n\nActivities related to Conformity of Production \n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.1.\n\n\n\n\nCategory C (procedure for the initial assessment and surveillance audits of the manufacturer\u2019s quality management system):\n\n\nEN ISO/IEC 17021:2011 on the requirements for bodies providing audit and certification of management systems.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.2.\n\n\n\n\nCategory D (inspection or testing of production samples or supervision thereof):\n\n\nEN ISO/IEC 17020:2012 on the general criteria for the operation of various types of bodies performing inspection.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAppendix\u00a02\n\n\nProcedure for the assessment of the technical services\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Objective and scope\n\n\n1.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0This Appendix establishes the conditions according to which the assessment procedure of the technical services shall be conducted by the competent authority referred to in Article\u00a077.\n\n\n1.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Those requirements shall apply to all technical services, irrespective of their legal status (independent organisation, manufacturer or approval authority acting as technical service).\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Assessments \n\n\nThe carrying out of an assessment shall be governed by the following:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0principle of independence, which is the basis for the impartiality and objectivity of the conclusions,\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an evidence-based approach, which guarantees reliable and reproducible conclusions.\n\n\nAuditors shall show trust and integrity. They shall respect confidentiality and discretion.\n\n\nThey shall report truthfully and accurately findings and conclusions.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Skills required of the auditors \n\n\n\n\n3.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The assessments may only be conducted by auditors having the technical and administrative knowledge necessary for such purposes.\n\n\n3.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The auditors shall have been trained specifically for assessment activities. In addition, they shall have the specific knowledge of the technical area in which the technical service will exercise its activities.\n\n\n3.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Without prejudice to points 3.1 and 3.2, the assessment referred to in Article\u00a077 shall be conducted by auditors independent of the activities for which the assessment is conducted.\n\n\n4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Application for designation \n\n\n4.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A duly authorised representative of the applicant technical service shall make a formal application to the competent authority that includes the following information:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0general features of the technical service, including corporate entity, name, addresses, legal status and technical resources;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a detailed description, including curriculum vitae, of the personnel in charge of testing and of the managerial staff as evidenced by the skills both educational and professional;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0technical services which use virtual testing methods shall provide evidence of their ability to work in a Computer-Aided-x environment;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0general information concerning the technical service, including its activities, its relationship in a larger corporate entity, if any, and addresses of all its physical location(s) to be covered by the scope of designation;\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0an agreement to fulfil the requirements for designation and the other obligations of the technical service as provided for in the relevant regulatory acts for which it is designated;\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a description of the conformity assessment services that the technical service undertakes in the framework of the relevant regulatory acts and a list of the regulatory acts for which the technical service applies for designation, including limits of capability, where applicable;\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a copy of the quality assurance manual of the technical service.\n\n\n4.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The competent authority shall review the adequacy of the information provided by the technical service.\n\n\n4.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The technical service shall notify to the approval authority any modifications to the information provided in accordance with point\u00a04.1.\n\n\n5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Resource review \n\n\nThe competent authority shall review its ability to carry out the assessment of the technical service, in terms of its own policy, its competence and the availability of suitable auditors and experts.\n\n\n6.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Subcontracting the assessment \n\n\n6.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The competent authority may subcontract parts of the assessment to another designation authority or ask for support from technical experts provided by other competent authorities. The subcontractors and experts have to be accepted by the applicant technical service.\n\n\n6.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The competent authority shall take into account accreditation certificates with adequate scope in order to complete its global assessment of the technical service.\n\n\n7.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Preparation for assessment \n\n\n\n\n7.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The competent authority shall formally appoint an assessment team. The competent authority shall ensure that the expertise brought to each assignment is appropriate. In particular, the team as a whole shall have both:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0appropriate knowledge of the specific scope for which designation is sought; \n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0sufficient understanding to reliably assess the competence of the technical service to operate within its scope of designation.\n\n\n7.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The competent authority shall clearly define the assignment given to the assessment team. The task of the assessment team is to review the documents collected from the applicant technical service and to conduct the on-site assessment.\n\n\n7.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The competent authority shall agree, together with the technical service and the assigned assessment team, to the date and timetable for the assessment. However, it remains the responsibility of the competent authority to pursue a date that is in accordance with the surveillance and reassessment plan.\n\n\n7.4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The competent authority shall ensure that the assessment team is provided with the appropriate criteria documents, previous assessment records, and the relevant documents and records of the technical service.\n\n\n8.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0On-site assessment \n\n\nThe assessment team shall conduct the assessment of the technical service at the premises of the technical service from which one or more key activities are performed and, where relevant, shall perform eyewitness assessment at other selected locations where the technical service operates.\n\n\n9.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Analysis of findings and assessment report \n\n\n9.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The assessment team shall analyse all relevant information and evidence gathered during the document and record review and the on-site assessment. This analysis shall be sufficient to allow the team to determine the extent of competence and conformity of the technical service with the requirements for designation.\n\n\n9.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The competent authority\u2019s reporting procedures shall ensure that the following requirements are fulfilled.\n\n\n9.2.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A meeting shall take place between the assessment team and the technical service prior to leaving the site. At this meeting, the assessment team shall provide a written and/or oral report on its findings obtained from the analysis. An opportunity shall be provided for the technical service to ask questions about the findings, including non-conformities, if any, and their basis.\n\n\n9.2.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A written report on the outcome of the assessment shall be promptly brought to the attention of the technical service. This assessment report shall contain comments on competence and conformity, and shall identify non-conformities, if any, to be resolved in order to conform to all of the requirements for designation.\n\n\n9.2.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The technical service shall be invited to respond to the assessment report and to describe the specific actions taken or planned to be taken, within a specific period of time, to resolve any identified non-conformities.\n\n\n9.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The competent authority shall ensure that the responses of the technical service are sufficient and effective to resolve non-conformities. If the technical service responses are found to be insufficient, further information shall be requested. Additionally, evidence of effective implementation of actions taken may be requested, or a follow-up assessment may be carried out, to verify effective implementation of corrective actions.\n\n\n9.4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The assessment report shall include at least the following:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0unique identification of the technical service;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0date(s) of the on-site assessment;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0name(s) of the auditors(s) and/or experts involved in the assessment;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0unique identification of all premises assessed;\n\n\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0proposed scope of designation that was assessed;\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a statement on the adequacy of the internal organisation and procedures adopted by the technical service supporting its competence, as determined through its fulfilment of the requirements for designation;\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0information on resolving all non-conformities;\n\n\n(h)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a recommendation of whether the applicant should be designated or confirmed as technical service and, if so, the scope of designation.\n\n\n10.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Granting or confirming a designation \n\n\n10.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The approval authority shall, without undue delay, make the decision on whether to grant, confirm or extend a designation on the basis of the assessment report(s) and any other relevant information.\n\n\n10.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The approval authority shall provide a certificate to the technical service. This certificate shall identify the following:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the identity and logo of the approval authority;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the unique identity of the designated technical service;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the effective date of granting of designation and the expiry date;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a brief indication of or a reference to the scope of designation (relevant regulatory acts or part of them);\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a statement of conformity and a reference to this Regulation.\n\n\n11.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Reassessment and surveillance \n\n\n11.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Reassessment is similar to an initial assessment except that experience gained during previous assessments shall be taken into account. Surveillance on-site assessments are less comprehensive than reassessments.\n\n\n11.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The competent authority shall design its plan for reassessment and surveillance of each designated technical service so that representative samples of the scope of designation are assessed on a regular basis.\n\n\nThe interval between on-site assessments, whether reassessment or surveillance, depends on the proven stability that the technical service has reached.\n\n\n11.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where, during surveillance or reassessments, non-conformities are identified, the competent authority shall define strict time limits for corrective actions to be implemented.\n\n\n11.4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where the corrective or improvement actions have not been taken within the agreed timeframe or are not deemed to be sufficient, the competent authority shall adopt appropriate measures, such as conducting a further assessment, or suspending or withdrawing the designation for one or more of the activities for which the technical service has been designated.\n\n\n11.5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where the competent authority decides to suspend or withdraw the designation of a technical service, it shall inform the technical service of its decision by registered mail. In any case, the competent authority shall adopt all the necessary measures to ensure the continuity of the activities already undertaken by the technical service.\n\n\n12.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Records on designated technical services \n\n\n\n\n12.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The competent authority shall maintain records on technical services to demonstrate that the requirements for designation, including competence, have been effectively fulfilled.\n\n\n12.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The competent authority shall keep the records on technical services secure to ensure confidentiality.\n\n\n12.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Records on technical services shall include at least the following:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0relevant correspondence;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0assessment records and reports;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0copies of designation certificates.\n\n\n\n\nAppendix\u00a03\n\n\nGeneral requirements concerning the format of the test reports\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For each of the regulatory acts listed in Part\u00a0I of Annex\u00a0IV, the test report shall comply with Standard EN\u00a0ISO/IEC\u00a017025:2005. In particular, it shall include the information referred to in point\u00a05.10.2, including note 1 of that Standard.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The template of the test reports shall be laid down by the approval authority in accordance with its rules of good practice.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The test report shall be drafted in the official language of the Union determined by the approval authority.\n\n\n4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The test report shall include at least the following information:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the identification of the vehicle, component or separate technical unit tested;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a detailed description of the vehicle, component or separate technical unit characteristics in connection with the regulatory act;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the results of the measurements specified in the relevant regulatory acts and, where required, the limits or thresholds which are to be met;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0regarding each measurement referred to in point\u00a0(c), the relevant decision of passed or failed;\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a detailed statement of compliance with the various provisions which are to be met, i.e. those provisions that do not require measurements.\n\n\nAs an example, the test report should include a statement that reflects the fulfilment of the requirements set out in Part\u00a0B of Annex\u00a0II to Regulation (EU) No 19/2011 as follows: \u2018The place of stamping the vehicle identification number fulfils the requirements of Part\u00a0B of Annex\u00a0II\u2019;\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0where test methods other than those prescribed in the regulatory acts are permitted, the report shall include a description of the test method used for performing the test.\n\n\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0pictures taken during testing, the number of which shall be decided by the approval authority.\n\n\nIn the case of virtual testing, screen prints or other suitable evidence may replace pictures;\n\n\n(h)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0conclusions drawn up;\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0where opinions and interpretations have been made, they shall be documented properly and marked as such in the test report.\n\n\n5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where the tests are conducted on a vehicle, component or technical unit that combines a number of most unfavourable features with regard to the required level of performance to be achieved, i.e. the worst-case, the test report shall include a reference stating how the selection has been made by the manufacturer in agreement with the approval authority.\n\n\n\n\nANNEX\u00a0VI\n\n\nMODELS OF THE EU TYPE-APPROVAL CERTIFICATE\n\n\nMODEL A\n\n\n(to be used for EU type-approval of a mm\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7.\n\n\n\n\nHeight: \u2026 mm\n\n\n\n\n\nMasses\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n\n13.\n\n\n\n\nMass of the vehicle in running order: \u2026kg (b)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n16.\n\n\n\n\nTechnically permissible maximum masses\n\n\n\n\n\n\n16.1.\n\n\n\n\nTechnically permissible maximum laden mass: \u2026 kg\n\n\n\n\n\n\n16.2.\n\n\n\n\nTechnically permissible mass on each axle: 1. \u2026 kg 2. \u2026 kg 3. \u2026 kg etc.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n16.4.\n\n\n\n\nTechnically permissible maximum mass of the combination: \u2026 kg\n\n\n\n\n\n\n18.\n\n\n\n\nTechnically permissible maximum towable mass in case (h):\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0all power train, except pure electric vehicles\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0pure electric vehicles and OVC hybrid electric vehicles\n\n\nElectric energy consumption (weighted, combined (1)) \u2026Wh/km\n\n\n\n\n\n\n52.\n\n\n\n\nRemarks: \u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\n53.\n\n\n\n\nAdditional information: mileage (2), \u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n_______________\n\n\nExplanatory notes\u00a0to model D \n\n\n\n(1)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Delete where not applicable.\n\n\n(2)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Not compulsory.\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0This entry shall be completed only where the vehicle has two axles.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0This mass is the actual mass of the vehicle in the conditions referred to in point\u00a02.6 of Annex\u00a0I to Regulation (EU) No XXX/201X.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For hybrid electric vehicles, indicate both power outputs.\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The codes described in section\u00a0C of Annex\u00a0II shall be used.\n\n\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Indicate only the basic colour(s): white, yellow, orange, red, violet, blue, green, grey, brown or black.\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Excluding seats designated for use only when the vehicle is stationary and the number of wheelchair positions.\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Add the number of the Euro level and, if appropriate, the character corresponding to the provisions used for type-approval.\n\n\n(h)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Repeat for the various fuels which can be used.\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX\u00a0VII\n\n\nEU TYPE-APPROVAL CERTIFICATE NUMBERING SYSTEM (1)\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The EU type-approval number shall consist of four sections for whole-vehicle type-approvals and five sections for system, component, and separate technical unit type-approvals as follows. In all cases, the sections shall be separated by the \u2018*\u2019 character.\n\n\nSection\u00a01:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The lower case letter \u2018e\u2019 followed by the distinguishing number of the Member State granting the EU type-approval:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSection\u00a02:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The number of the base directive or regulation\n\n\nIn the case of EU type-approval for systems, components or separate technical units covered by the implementing measures referred to in Regulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009, the base regulation reference shall be the regulation number of the implementing act adopted pursuant to Article\u00a014(1)(a) to (e) of Regulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009.\n\n\nSection\u00a03:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The number of the latest amending directive or regulation, including implementing acts applicable to the type-approval in accordance with the following indents. However, in case such amending directive or regulation or relevant implementing act does not yet exist, the number referred to in section\u00a02 is repeated in section\u00a03:\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0in the case of whole-vehicle type-approvals, this means the latest directive or regulation amending an Article (or Articles) of Regulation (EU) No XXX/201X,\n\n\n_______________\n\n\n(1)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Components and separate technical units shall be marked in accordance with the provisions of the relevant regulatory acts. \n\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0in the case of whole-vehicle type-approvals granted in accordance with the procedure described in Article\u00a039, this means the latest directive or regulation amending an Article or Articles of Regulation (EU) No XXX/201X, except that the two first digits (e.g. 20) are replaced by the letters KS in block capitals,\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0this means the latest directive or regulation containing the actual provisions with which the system, component or technical unit conforms,\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0this means the latest regulation, containing amendments to implementing measures of Regulation (EC) No 661/2009, with which a system, component or technical unit complies,\n\n\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0should a directive or regulation, including their implementing acts, contain different technical requirements to be applied from specific dates, section\u00a03 shall be followed with an alphabetical character to clearly identify against which technical requirements the approval was granted. Where different vehicle categories are concerned, the character may also refer to a specific vehicle category. \n\n\nSection\u00a04:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A four-digit sequential number (with leading zeros where applicable) for EU whole-vehicle type-approvals, or four or five digits for type-approval pursuant to a separate directive or regulation to denote the base type-approval number. The sequence shall start from 0001 for each basic directive or regulation.\n\n\nSection\u00a05:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A two-digit sequential number (with leading zeros where applicable) to denote the extension. The sequence shall start from 00 for each base approval number. \n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0In the case of a whole-vehicle type-approval, section\u00a02 shall be omitted.\n\n\nHowever, in the case of a national type-approval granted for vehicles produced in small series pursuant to Article\u00a040, section\u00a02 shall be replaced by the letters NKS in block capitals\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0On the vehicle's statutory plate(s) only, section\u00a05 shall be omitted.\n\n\n4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Layouts of the type-approval numbers.\n\n\n4.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Example of a third type-approval (where no extension has yet been granted) granted by France\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0pursuant to Commission Regulation (EU) No 1008/2010(2) (windscreen wiper and washer systems):\n\n\ne2*1008/2010*1008/2010*00003*00\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0pursuant to Commission Regulation (EU) No 19/2011(3) as amended by Commission Regulation (EU) No 249/2012(4) (statutory markings):\n\n\ne2*19/2011*249/2012*0003*00\n\n\n4.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Example of the second extension to the fourth vehicle type-approval granted by the United Kingdom:\n\n\ne11*2007/2046*0004*02\n\n\n4.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Example of a EU whole-vehicle type-approval granted to a vehicle produced in small series by Luxembourg, pursuant to Article\u00a039:\n\n\ne13*KS07/46*0001*00.\n\n\n4.4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Example of a national type-approval granted to a vehicle produced in small series by the Netherlands, pursuant to Article\u00a040:\n\n\ne4*NKS*0001*00.\n\n\n4.5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Example of the type-approval number to be stamped on the vehicle's statutory plate(s):\n\n\ne11*2007/2046*0004.\n\n\n\n\n5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Annex\u00a0VII does not apply to type-approvals granted in accordance with UNECE regulations listed in Annex\u00a0IV, as the relevant numbering system is provided for in the respective UNECE regulations. However, Annex\u00a0VII applies to EU type-approvals granted under Regulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009 which are based on UNECE regulations (i.e. incorporating new technologies, EU type-approved components and STUs, virtual testing and self-testing). In this case, the following numbering system applies:\n\n\nSection\u00a01: as in point\u00a01 above\n\n\nSection\u00a02: \u2018661/2009\u2019 (Regulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009)\n\n\nSection\u00a03: First portion is the UNECE Regulation No, followed by \u2018R-\u2019, the second portion is the series of amendments or \u201800\u2019 if it is the original series, followed by \u2018-\u2019 and the third portion is the supplement level (with leading zeros where applicable) or \u201800\u2019 when there is no supplement to the relevant series.\n\n\nSection\u00a04: as in point\u00a01 above\n\n\nSection\u00a05: as in point\u00a01 above \n\n\nExamples:\n\n\ne1*661/2009*13-HR-10-05*00001*00\n(type-approval granted by Germany, according to UNECE Regulation No 13-H, 10 series of amendments, supplement level 5, first approval issued, no extensions)\n\n\ne25*661/2009*28R-00-03*0123*05\n(granted by Croatia, according to UNECE Regulation No 28, original series of amendments, supplement 3, 123rd approval issued, 5th extension)\n\n\n\n(2)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Commission Regulation (EU) No\u00a01008/2010 of 9 November 2010 concerning type-approval requirements for windscreen wiper and washer systems of certain motor vehicles and implementing Regulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council concerning type-approval requirements for the general safety of motor vehicles, their trailers and systems, components and separate technical units intended therefor (OJ L 292, 10.11.2010, p. 2).\n\n\n(3)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Commission Regulation (EU) No\u00a019/2011 of 11 January 2011 concerning type-approval requirements for the manufacturer's statutory plate and for the vehicle identification number of motor vehicles and their trailers and implementing Regulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council concerning type-approval requirements for the general safety of motor vehicles, their trailers and systems, components and separate technical units intended therefor (OJ L 8, 12.1.2011, p. 1).\n\n\n(4)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Commission Regulation (EU) No\u00a0249/2012 of 21 March 2012 amending Regulation (EU) No\u00a019/2011 as regards type-approval requirements for the manufacturer's statutory plate of motor vehicles and their trailers (OJ L 82, 22.3.2012, p. 1).\n\n\n\nAppendix\n\n\nEU type-approval mark of a component or a separate technical unit\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The EU type-approval mark of a component or a separate technical unit shall consist of the following:\n\n\n1.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A rectangle surrounding the lower-case letter \u2018e\u2019 followed by the distinguishing letter(s) or number of the Member State which has granted the EU type-approval to a component or a separate technical unit:\n\n\n\n\n\n1\n\n\n\n\nfor Germany;\n\n\n\n\n19\n\n\n\n\nfor Romania;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2\n\n\n\n\nfor France;\n\n\n\n\n20\n\n\n\n\nfor Poland;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3\n\n\n\n\nfor Italy;\n\n\n\n\n21\n\n\n\n\nfor Portugal;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4\n\n\n\n\nfor the Netherlands;\n\n\n\n\n23\n\n\n\n\nfor Greece;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5\n\n\n\n\nfor Sweden;\n\n\n\n\n24\n\n\n\n\nfor Ireland;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n6\n\n\n\n\nfor Belgium;\n\n\n\n\n25\n\n\n\n\nfor Croatia;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7\n\n\n\n\nfor Hungary;\n\n\n\n\n26\n\n\n\n\nfor Slovenia;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n8\n\n\n\n\nfor the Czech Republic;\n\n\n\n\n27\n\n\n\n\nfor Slovakia;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n9\n\n\n\n\nfor Spain;\n\n\n\n\n29\n\n\n\n\nfor Estonia;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n11\n\n\n\n\nfor the United Kingdom;\n\n\n\n\n32\n\n\n\n\nfor Latvia;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n12\n\n\n\n\nfor Austria;\n\n\n\n\n34\n\n\n\n\nfor Bulgaria;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n13\n\n\n\n\nfor Luxembourg;\n\n\n\n\n36\n\n\n\n\nfor Lithuania;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n17\n\n\n\n\nfor Finland;\n\n\n\n\n49\n\n\n\n\nfor Cyprus;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n18\n\n\n\n\nfor Denmark;\n\n\n\n\n50\n\n\n\n\nfor Malta.\n\n\n\n\n\n1.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0In the vicinity of the rectangle the \u2018base approval number\u2019 contained in section\u00a04 of the type-approval number preceded by the two figures indicating the sequence number assigned to the latest amendment to the relevant separate directive or regulation.\n\n\n1.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0An additional symbol or symbols located above the rectangle, enabling certain characteristics to be identified, where specified in the relevant separate directives or regulations.\n\n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The component or separate technical unit type-approval mark is affixed to the separate technical unit or component in such a way as to be indelible and clearly legible.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0An example of a component or separate technical unit type-approval mark is contained in the Addendum.\n\n\n\n\n\n4.\n\n\n\n\nThis Appendix does not apply to type-approvals granted in accordance with the UNECE regulations listed in Annex\u00a0IV, as the relevant arrangements of approval marks are provided for in the respective UNECE regulations. However, this Appendix applies to EU type-approvals for components and separate technical units granted under Regulation (EC)\u00a0No\u00a0661/2009 that are based on UNECE regulations (i.e. components or separate technical units incorporating new technologies). In this case, the following arrangement of markings applies:\n\n\nThe distinguishing type-approval marking shall be as prescribed in the relevant UNECE regulation taking the following into account:\n\n\nWhen a circle surrounding the letter \u2018E\u2019 is prescribed, this shall be not a circle, but a rectangle. Its height (a) shall at least correspond to the prescribed diameter size and its width shall exceed that value (i.e. > a). Instead of the upper-case letter \u2018E\u2019, the lower-case letter \u2018e\u2019 shall be used, followed by the distinguishing number of the Member State that has granted the EU type-approval of the component or separate technical unit. \n\n\nExample:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(granted by Germany, based on UNECE Regulation No 28, original series, first approval granted, for a Class II audible warning device incorporating new technologies)\u201d\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAddendum to the Appendix\n\n\nExample of an EU type-approval mark of a component or separate technical unit \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLegend: the above EU type-approval mark of a component is for a EU type-approval granted by Belgium under number 0004. 01 is a sequential number denoting the level of technical requirements to which this component fulfils. The sequential number is attributed in accordance with the relevant separate directive or regulation.\n\n\nNB: The additional symbols are not shown on this example.\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX\u00a0VIII\n\n\nTEST RESULTS\n\n\n(To be completed by the approval authority and appended to the vehicle EU type-approval certificate)\n\n\nIn each case, the information must make clear to which variant and version it is applicable. One version may not have more than one result. However, a combination of several results per version indicating the worst case is permissible. In that case, a note shall state that for items marked (*) only worst case results are given.\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Results of the sound level tests \n\n\nNumber of the base regulatory act and latest amending regulatory act applicable to the approval. In case of a regulatory act with two or more implementation stages, indicate also the implementation stage:\n\n\n\n\n\nVariant/Version:\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMoving (dB(A)/E):\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\nStationary (dB(A)/E):\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\nat (min\u2013 1):\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Results of the exhaust emission tests \n\n\n2.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Emissions from motor vehicles tested under the test procedure for light-duty vehicles \n\n\n\n\nIndicate the latest amending regulatory act applicable to the approval. In case the regulatory act has two or more implementation stages, indicate also the implementation stage:\n\n\nFuel(s) (a) \u2026 (diesel, petrol, LPG, NG, Bi-fuel: petrol/NG, LPG, Flex-fuel: petrol/ethanol, NG/H2NG\u2026)\n\n\n2.1.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Type 1 test (b) (c) (vehicle emissions in the test cycle after a cold start) \n\n\n\n\n\nVariant/Version:\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\nCO (mg/km)\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\nTHC (mg/km)\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\nNMHC (mg/km)\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\nNOx (mg/km)\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\nTHC + NOx (mg/km)\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMass of particulate matter (PM) (mg/km)\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\nNumber of particles (P) (#/km) (1)\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n2.1.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Type 2 test (b) (c) (emissions data required at type-approval for roadworthiness purposes) \n\n\nType 2, low idle test:\n\n\n\n\n\nVariant/Version:\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\nCO (% vol.)\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\nEngine speed (min\u2013 1)\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\nEngine oil temperature (\u00b0C)\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\nType 2, high idle test:\n\n\n\n\n\nVariant/Version:\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\nCO (% \u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDecision approving the eco-innovation (h4)  \n\n\n\n\nCode of the eco-innovation (h5)  \n\n\n\n\n1. Usage factor (UF) i.e. temporal share of technology usage in normal operation conditions\n\n\n\n\nCO2 emissions savings\n\n\n((1 \u2013 2) \u2013 (3 \u2013 4))*5\n\n\n\n\n\n\nxxxx/201x\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n\nTotal CO2 emissions savings (g/km) (h7)  \n\n\n\n\n\u2026\n\n\n\n\n\n4.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0General code of the eco-innovation(s) (h8)\n\n\nExplanatory notes \n\n\n(1)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where applicable. \n\n\n(2)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Delete where not applicable.\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where restrictions for the fuel are applicable, indicate these restrictions (e.g. for natural gas the L range or the H range).\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For bi-fuel vehicles, the table shall be repeated for both fuels.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For flex fuel vehicles, where the test is to be performed on both fuels, according to Figure I.2.4 of Annex\u00a0I to Regulation (EC)\u00a0No\u00a0692/2008, and for vehicles running on LPG or NG/Bio methane, either bi-fuel or mono-fuel, the table shall be repeated for the different reference gases used in the test, and an additional table shall display the worst results obtained. Where applicable, in accordance with points 1.1.2.4 and 1.1.2.5 of Annex\u00a0I to Regulation (EC)\u00a0No\u00a0692/2008, it shall be shown if the results are measured or calculated.\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Repeat the table for each reference fuel tested.\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For Euro VI, ESC shall be understood as WHSC and ETC as WHTC.\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For Euro VI, if CNG and LPG fuelled engines are tested on different reference fuels, the table shall be reproduced for each reference fuel tested.\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The unit \u201cl/100 km\u201d is replaced by \u201cm 3 /100 km\u201d for vehicles fuelled with NG and H2NG, and by \u201ckg/100 km\u201d for vehicles fuelled with hydrogen.\n\n\n(h)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Eco-innovations.\n\n\n(h1)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Repeat the table for each variant/version.\n\n\n(h2)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Repeat the table for each reference fuel tested.\n\n\n\n\n(h3)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Expand the table if necessary, using one extra row per eco-innovation.\n\n\n(h4)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Number of the Commission decision approving the eco-innovation.\n\n\n(h5)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Assigned in the Commission decision approving the eco-innovation.\n\n\n(h6)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0If a modelling methodology is applied instead of the type 1 test cycle, this value shall be the one provided by the modelling methodology.\n\n\n(h7)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Sum of the CO2 emissions savings of each individual eco-innovation.\n\n\n(h8)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The general code of the eco-innovation(s) shall consist of the following elements, each separated by a blank space: \n\n\n\u2014 Code of the approval authority as set out in Annex\u00a0VII; \n\n\n\u2014 Individual code of each eco-innovation fitted in the vehicle, indicated in chronological order of the Commission approval decisions. \n\n\nE.g. the general code of three eco-innovations approved chronologically as 10, 15 and 16 and fitted to a vehicle certified by the German approval authority should be: \u201ce1 10 15 16\u201d.\n\n\nANNEX\u00a0IX\n\n\nCERTIFICATE OF CONFORMITY\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0OBJECTIVES\n\n\nThe certificate of conformity is a statement delivered by the vehicle manufacturer to the buyer in order to assure him that the vehicle acquired complies with the legislation in force in the Union at the time it was produced. \n\n\nThe certificate of conformity also serves the purpose of enabling the competent authorities of the Member States to register vehicles without having to require the applicant to supply additional technical documentation. \n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0GENERAL DESCRIPTION\n\n\n2.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The certificate of conformity shall include the following information:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the Vehicle Identification Number;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the date of manufacture of the vehicle;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the exact technical characteristics of the vehicle (i.e. it is not permitted to mention any range of values in the various entries).\n\n\n2.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The certificate of conformity shall consist of two parts:\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0SIDE 1, which consists of a statement of compliance by the manufacturer. The template for this statement shall be identical for all vehicle categories.\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0SIDE 2, which is a technical description of the exact technical characteristics of the vehicle. Side 2 shall be adapted to each specific vehicle category.\n\n\n2.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The certificate of conformity shall be established in a maximum format A4 (210 \u00d7 297 mm) or a folder of maximum format A4.\n\n\n2.4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Without prejudice to point\u00a02.2.(b), the values and units provided in side\u00a02 of the certificate of conformity shall be identical to those given in the type-approval documentation that the relevant regulatory acts require. In case of conformity of production checks, the values shall be verified according to the methods laid down in the relevant regulatory acts. The tolerances allowed in those regulatory acts shall be taken into account.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0SPECIAL PROVISIONS\n\n\n3.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Model A of the certificate of conformity (complete vehicle) shall cover vehicles that can be used on the road without requiring any further stage of completion for their type-approval.\n\n\n3.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Model B of the certificate of conformity (completed vehicles) shall cover vehicles that have undergone a further stage of completion for their type-approval.\n\n\nThis is the normal result of the multi-stage type-approval (e.g. a bus built by a second stage manufacturer on a chassis built by a vehicle manufacturer).\n\n\nThe additional features that have been added during the multi-stage procedure shall be described briefly.\n\n\n3.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Model C of the certificate of conformity (incomplete vehicles) shall cover vehicles that need a further stage of completion for their approval (e.g. truck chassis).\n\n\nExcept for tractors for semi-trailers, certificates of conformity covering chassis-cab vehicles belonging to category N shall be of Model C.\n\n\n\nPART\u00a0I \n\n\nCOMPLETE AND Remarks (n): \u2026\n\n\n\n\nSIDE 2\n\n\nVEHICLE CATEGORIES O1 AND O2\n\n\n(incomplete vehicles)\n\n\nSide 2\n\n\nGeneral construction characteristics\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Number of axles: mm\n\n\n4.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Axle spacing:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a01-2: \u2026 mm\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a02-3: \u2026 mm\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a03-4: \u2026 mm\n\n\n5.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Maximum permissible the centre of the coupling device and the rear end of the vehicle: \u2026 mm\n\n\n12.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Maximum permissible rear overhang: \u2026 mm\n\n\nMasses\n\n\n14.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Mass in
