\u2026\n\n\n45.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Characteristics values (1): D: \u2026/ V: \u2026/ S: \u2026/ U: \u2026\n\n\nMiscellaneous\n\n\n52.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Remarks (n): \u2026\n\n\n\n\nExplanatory notes\n\n\n\n\n\n(1)\n\n\n\n\nDelete where not applicable.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\n\n\n\nIndicate the identification code.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(b)\n\n\n\n\nIndicate whether the vehicle is suitable for use in either right or left-hand traffic or both right and left-hand traffic.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(c)\n\n\n\n\nIndicate whether the speedometer fitted has metric or both metric and imperial units.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(d)\n\n\n\n\nThis statement shall not restrict the right of a Member State to require technical adaptations for the registration of a vehicle in a Member State other than the one for which it was intended when the direction of the traffic is on the opposite side of the road.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(e)\n\n\n\n\nEntries\u00a04. and 4.1 shall be completed in accordance with the definitions of wheelbase and axle spacing in Article\u00a02 (25) and (26) of Regulation (EU)\u00a0No\u00a01230/2012, respectively.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(g)\n\n\n\n\nFor hybrid electric vehicles, indicate both power outputs.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(h)\n\n\n\n\nOptional equipment can be added under point\u00a052, \u2018Remarks\u2019.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(i)\n\n\n\n\nThe codes described in Annex\u00a0II, section\u00a0C, shall be used.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(j)\n\n\n\n\nIndicate only the basic colour(s) as follows: white, yellow, orange, red, violet, blue, green, grey, brown or black.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(k)\n\n\n\n\nExcluding seats that are designated to be used only when the vehicle is stationary and excluding the number of wheelchair positions.\n\n\nFor coaches belonging to the vehicle category M3, the number of crew members shall be included in the passenger number.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(l)\n\n\n\n\nAdd the number of the Euro level and the character corresponding to the provisions used for type-approval.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(m)\n\n\n\n\nRepeat for the various fuels that can be used. Vehicles that can run on both petrol and gaseous fuel, but in which the petrol system is fitted for emergency or starting purposes only, and vehicles of which the petrol tank cannot contain more than 15 litres of petrol, will be regarded as vehicles that only can run on a gaseous fuel.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(m1)\n\n\n\n\nIn case of EURO VI dual-fuel engines and vehicles, repeat as appropriate.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(m2)\n\n\n\n\nOnly emissions that have been assessed in accordance with the relevant regulatory act or acts shall be stated.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(n)\n\n\n\n\nWhere the vehicle is equipped with 24 GHz short-range radar equipment in accordance with Commission Decision 2005/50/EC\n31\n, the manufacturer shall indicate the following: \u2018Vehicle equipped with 24 GHz short-range radar equipment\u2019.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(o)\n\n\n\n\nThe manufacturer may complete these entries for international traffic, for national traffic or for both.\n\n\nFor national traffic, the entry shall mention the code of the country where the vehicle is intended to be registered. The code shall be in accordance with standard ISO\u00a03166-1:2006.\n\n\nFor international traffic, the entry shall mention the directive number (e.g. \u201896/53/EC\u2019 for Council Directive 96/53/EC).\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(p)\n\n\n\n\nEco-innovations.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(p1)\n\n\n\n\nThe general code of the eco-innovation(s) shall consist of the following elements, each separated by a blank space:\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Code of the approval authority as set out in Annex\u00a0VII;\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Individual code of each eco-innovation fitted in the vehicle, indicated in chronological order of the Commission approval decisions.\n\n\n\u2014\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0(E.g. the general code of three eco-innovations approved chronologically as 10, 15 and 16 and fitted to a vehicle certified by the German approval authority should be: \u2018e1 10 15 16\u2019.)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(p2)\n\n\n\n\nSum of the CO2 emissions savings of each individual eco-innovation.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(q)\n\n\n\n\nIn the case of completed vehicles of category N1 within the scope of Regulation (EC)\u00a0No\u00a0715/2007.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX\u00a0X\n\n\nCONFORMITY OF PRODUCTION PROCEDURES\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Objectives\n\n\n1.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The conformity of production procedure aims to ensure that each vehicle, system, component and technical separate unit,\u00a0part or equipment produced is in conformity with the approved type.\n\n\n1.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The conformity of production procedure shall always include the assessment of quality-assurance management systems, referred to in point\u00a02 as the \u2018initial assessment\u2019, and the verification of the type-approval subject and product-related controls, referred to in point\u00a03 as \u2018product conformity arrangements\u2019.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Initial assessment\n\n\n2.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Before granting type-approval, the approval authority shall verify that the manufacturer has established satisfactory arrangements and procedures for ensuring that vehicles, systems, components, separate technical units or parts and equipment are produced in conformity with the approved type.\n\n\n2.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Guidance for conducting those assessments may be found in Standard EN ISO\u00a019011:2011 \u2014 Guidelines for quality and/or environmental management systems auditing.\n\n\n2.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Compliance with the requirements of point\u00a02.1 shall be verified to the satisfaction of the approval authority, as follows: \n\n\nThe approval authority shall be satisfied with the initial assessment and the product conformity arrangements referred to in point\u00a03, taking into account one of the arrangements referred to in points\u00a02.3.1 to 2.3.3, or a combination of those arrangements in full or in part as appropriate. \n\n\n2.3.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The initial assessment and verification of product conformity arrangements shall be carried out by the approval authority or a body appointed for this purpose by the approval authority.\n\n\n\n\n2.3.1.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0When considering the extent of the initial assessment to be carried out, the approval authority may take into account the following information:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0whether the manufacturer has a certification similar to the one referred to in point\u00a02.3.3, but which has not been qualified or recognised under that point;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0in the case of a type-approval of a system, component or separate technical unit, quality system assessments that have been performed by vehicle manufacturer(s) in the premises of the manufacturer of the system, component or separate technical unit, in accordance with one or more of the industry sector specifications satisfying the requirements in the EN ISO\u00a09001:2008 or ISO/TS16949:2009 standards.\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0whether in one of the Member States one or more of the manufacturer\u2019s type approvals recently have been withdrawn, due to unsatisfactory control of conformity of production. In that case, the initial assessment by the approval authority shall not be limited to accepting the manufacturer\u2019s quality system certification, but shall include a verification whether all necessary improvements for ensuring effective control have been implemented, so that vehicles, components, systems or separate technical units are produced in conformity with the approved type.\n\n\n2.3.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The initial assessment and verification of product conformity arrangements may be carried out by the approval authority of another Member State or by the body appointed for this purpose by the approval authority.\n\n\n2.3.2.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The approval authority of that other Member State shall in that case prepare a statement of compliance, which outlines the areas and production facilities that that approval authority has covered as relevant to the product(s) to be type-approved and to the regulatory acts in accordance with which these products are to be type-approved.\n\n\n2.3.2.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0On receiving a request for a statement of compliance from the approval authority of a Member State granting type-approval, the approval authority of another Member State shall immediately send that statement of compliance or inform that approval authority that is unable to provide such a statement.\n\n\n2.3.2.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The statement of compliance shall include at least the following:\n\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Group or company\n\n\n\n\n(e.g. XYZ Automotive)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Particular organisation\n\n\n\n\n(e.g. regional Division)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Plants/Sites\n\n\n\n\n(e.g. Engine Plant 1 (in country A) \u2014 Vehicle Plant 2 (in country B))\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Vehicle/Component range\n\n\n\n\n(e.g. All Category M1 models)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Areas assessed\n\n\n\n\n(e.g. Engine assembly, body pressing and assembly, vehicle assembly)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Documents examined\n\n\n\n\n(e.g. Company and site quality manual and procedures)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Date of the assessment\n\n\n\n\n(e.g. Audit conducted from dd/mm/yyyy to dd/mm/yyyy)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(h)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Planned monitoring visit\n\n\n\n\n(e.g. mm/yyyy)\n\n\n\n\n\n2.3.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0An approval authority may also accept the manufacturer\u2019s certification to standards EN ISO\u00a09001:2008 or ISO/TS16949:2009 (the scope of this certification shall in that case cover the product(s) to be approved), or an equivalent certification standard as satisfying the initial assessment requirements of point\u00a02.3., provided that conformity of production is indeed covered by the quality management system and that the manufacturer's type-approval has not been withdrawn as referred to in point\u00a02.3.1.1.(c). The manufacturer shall provide details of the certification and inform the approval authority of any revisions to its validity or scope.\n\n\n2.4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For the purpose of vehicle type-approval, the initial assessments carried out for the granting of type-approvals for systems, components and separate technical units of the vehicle need not be repeated, but shall be completed by an assessment of the locations and activities relating to the assembly of the whole vehicle that have not been covered by the former assessments.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Product conformity arrangements\n\n\n3.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Every vehicle, system, component or separate technical unit, part or item of equipment approved pursuant to a UNECE Regulation annexed to the Revised 1958 Agreement and to this Regulation shall be so manufactured as to conform to the type approved by meeting the requirements of this Annex, the said UNECE Regulation and this Regulation.\n\n\n3.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Before granting a type-approval pursuant to this Regulation and to a UNECE Regulation annexed to the Revised 1958 Agreement, the approval authority shall verify the existence of adequate arrangements and documented control plans, to be agreed with the manufacturer for each approval, to carry out at specified intervals the tests or associated checks that are necessary to verify continued conformity with the approved type, including, where applicable, tests specified in this Regulation and the said UNECE Regulation.\n\n\n3.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The holder of the type-approval shall, in particular:\n\n\n3.3.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0ensure the existence and application of procedures for effective control of the conformity of products (vehicles, systems, components, separate technical units, parts or equipment to the approved type;\n\n\n3.3.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0have access to the testing or other appropriate equipment necessary for checking the conformity to each approved type;\n\n\n3.3.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0ensure that the data resulting from tests or checks are recorded and that annexed documents remain available for a period of up to 10 years to be determined in agreement with the approval authority;\n\n\n3.3.4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0analyse the results of each type of test or check, in order to verify and ensure the stability of the product characteristics, making allowance for variation of an industrial production;\n\n\n3.3.5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0ensure that for each type of product, at least the checks prescribed in this Regulation and the tests prescribed in the relevant regulatory acts listed in Annex\u00a0IV are carried out;\n\n\n\n\n3.3.6.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0ensure that any set of samples or test pieces that gives evidence of non-conformity in the type of test in question, gives rise to a further sampling and testing. All the necessary steps shall be taken to restore the production process to ensure conformity with the approved type;\n\n\n3.4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0In the case of step-by-step, mixed or multi-stage type-approvals, the approval authority that is granting a whole-vehicle type-approval may request from any approval authority that has granted type-approval of any relevant system, component or separate technical unit specific details regarding compliance with the conformity of production requirements set out in this Annex.\n\n\n3.5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The approval authority that is granting a whole-vehicle type-approval and is not satisfied with the reported information referred to in point\u00a03.4., and that has communicated this in writing to the relevant manufacturer and to the approval authority granting the type-approval for the system, component or separate technical unit, shall demand the performance of additional conformity of production audits or checks, which shall be performed at the site of the manufacturer(s) of those systems, components or separate technical units. The results of this additional conformity of production audits or checks shall immediately be made available to that approval authority.\n\n\n3.6.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where points\u00a03.4. and 3.5. apply and the approval authority granting the whole-vehicle type-approval has not been satisfied with the additional audit or check results, the manufacturer shall ensure that conformity of production is restored as soon as possible to the satisfaction of that approval authority and of the approval authority granting type-approval of the system, component or separate technical unit.\n\n\n4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Continued verification arrangements\n\n\n4.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The authority that has granted type-approval may at any time verify the conformity control methods applied in each production facility by means of periodic audits. The manufacturer shall for that purpose allow access to that authority to the manufacturing, inspection, testing, storage and distribution sites and shall provide all necessary information with regard to the quality management system documentation and records.\n\n\n4.1.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The normal arrangements for such periodic audits shall be to monitor the continued effectiveness of the procedures laid down in sections 1 and 2 (initial assessment and product conformity arrangements).\n\n\n4.1.1.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Surveillance activities carried out by the technical services (qualified or recognised as required in point\u00a02.3.3) shall be accepted as satisfying the requirement of point\u00a04.1.1 with regard to the procedures established at initial assessment.\n\n\n4.1.1.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The normal frequency of verifications by the approval authority (other than those referred to in point\u00a04.1.1.1) shall be such as to ensure that the relevant controls applied in accordance with sections 1 and 2 are reviewed at intervals based on a risk assessment methodology that complies with the international standard ISO\u00a031000:2009 \u2013 Risk Management \u2013 Principles and Guidelines and such verification shall in any case be conducted at least once every three years. This methodology shall in particular take into account any non-conformity raised by other Member States in the context of Article\u00a054(1).\n\n\n4.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0At every review, records of tests or checks and records of production, in particular records of those tests or checks documented as required in point\u00a02.2., shall be made available to the inspector.\n\n\n4.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The inspector may select samples at random to be tested in the manufacturer\u2019s laboratory or in the facilities of the technical service. In such a case only physical test shall be carried out. The minimum number of samples may be determined on the basis of the results of the manufacturer\u2019s own verification.\n\n\n4.4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The inspector who is of the opinion that the level of control is unsatisfactory, or who deems it necessary to verify the validity of the tests carried out in accordance with point\u00a04.2, shall select samples to be sent to a technical service to perform physical tests in accordance with the requirements on conformity of production, set out in the regulatory acts referred to in Annex\u00a0IV.\n\n\n4.5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Where unsatisfactory results are found during an inspection or a monitoring review, the approval authority shall take all necessary steps to ensure that the manufacturer restores the conformity of production as rapidly as possible.\n\n\n4.6.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0In cases where compliance with UNECE regulations is required by this Regulation, the manufacturer may choose to apply the provisions of this Annex as an equivalent alternative to the conformity of production requirements in the respective UNECE regulations. However, if points\u00a04.4. or 4.5. apply, all separate conformity of production requirements in the UNECE regulations have to be complied with to the satisfaction of the approval authority until it decides that conformity of production has been restored.\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX\u00a0XI\n\n\nTEMPLATE AND NUMBERING SYSTEM FOR THE CERTIFICATE AUTHORISING THE PLACING ON THE MARKET AND ENTRY INTO SERVICE OF PARTS AND EQUIPMENT THAT MAY POSE A SERIOUS RISK TO THE CORRECT FUNCTIONING OF ESSENTIAL SYSTEMS\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0General requirements\n\n\n1.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The placing on the market of parts or equipment that may pose a serious risk to the correct functioning of systems that are essential for the safety of the vehicle or for its environmental performance shall be subject to authorisation in accordance with Article\u00a055(1) of Regulation (EU)\u00a0No\u00a0xxx/201X.\n\n\n1.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Such authorisation shall take the form of a certificate, a model of which is contained in the Appendix to this Annex, and shall be numbered in accordance with the provisions of point\u00a02.\n\n\n\n\n1.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The certificate referred to in point\u00a01.2. shall include requirements for constructional and functional safety, as well as for environmental protection and, where needed, for testing standards. Those requirements may be based on the regulatory acts listed in Annex\u00a0IV to Regulation (EU) XXX/201X, may be developed according to the relevant state of safety, environmental and testing technology, or, if this is an appropriate way of achieving the required safety or environmental objectives, may consist of a comparison of the part or equipment with the environmental or safety performance of the original vehicle, or of any of its parts, as appropriate.\n\n\n1.4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0This Annex shall not apply to a part or piece of equipment that is not listed in Annex\u00a0XIII. For any entry or group of entries in Annex\u00a0XIII, a reasonable transitional period shall be fixed to allow the manufacturer of the part or equipment to apply for and obtain an authorisation. At the same time, a date may be fixed, where appropriate, to exclude from the application of this Annex parts and equipment designed for vehicles that have been type-approved before that date.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Numbering system\n\n\n2.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The number of the certificate for the placing on the market and entry into service of parts or equipment that may pose a serious risk to the correct functioning of essential systems shall consist of a total of five sections as specified in points\u00a02.1.1. to 2.1.5. The sections shall be separated by an asterisk (\u2018*\u2019).\n\n\n2.1.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Section\u00a01: The lower-case letter \u2018e\u2019 followed by the distinguishing number of the Member State (provided in the Appendix of Annex\u00a0VII) issuing the certificate.\n\n\n2.1.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Section\u00a02: The number of Regulation (EU) XXX/201X: \u2018XXX/201X\u2019 shall be indicated.\n\n\n2.1.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Section\u00a03: The identification of the part or equipment, according to the list in Annex\u00a0XIII.\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0for parts or equipment having a significant impact on the vehicle\u2019s constructional safety and/or functional safety, this means the symbol \u2018I\u2019 followed by the \u2018/\u2019character and the correspondent \u2018Item No\u2019 from the list in point\u00a0I of Annex\u00a0XIII. The \u2018Item No\u2019 shall have three digits and start from \u2018001\u2019.\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0for parts or equipment having a significant impact on the environmental performance of the vehicle, this means the symbol \u2018II\u2019 followed by the \u2018/\u2019character and the correspondent \u2018Item No\u2019 from the list in point\u00a0II of Annex\u00a0XIII. The \u2018Item No\u2019 shall have three digits and start from \u2018001\u2019.\n\n\n2.1.4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Section\u00a04: Sequential number for the certificate.\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a sequential number with leading zeros (as applicable), to denote the certificate number. The sequential number shall have three digits and start from \u2018001\u2019.\n\n\n2.1.5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Section\u00a05: Sequential number to denote the extension level of the certificate.\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a two-digit sequential number, with leading zero as applicable, starting from \u201800\u2019 for each certificate number issued.\n\n\n2.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Format of the numbering of a certificate (with fictive sequential numbers for explanation purposes).\n\n\nExample of the number of a certificate issued by Bulgaria for parts or equipment integrated in a vehicle type-approved according to Regulation (EU)\u00a0No\u00a0XXX/201X:\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0e34*XXX/201X*II/002*148*00\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0e34 = Bulgaria (section\u00a01)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0XXX/201X = Regulation (EU) XXX/201X (section\u00a02)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0II/002 = Item 002 on the list of parts or equipment having a significant impact on the environmental performance of the vehicle (section\u00a03)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0148 = certificate sequential number (section\u00a04)\n\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a000 = extension level number (section\u00a05)\n\n\nExample of the number of a certificate issued by Austria for parts or equipment integrated in a vehicle type-approved according to Regulation (EU)\u00a0No\u00a0XXX/201X, which has been extended once:\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0e12*168/2013*I/034*225*01\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0e12 = Austria (section\u00a01)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0XXX/201X = Regulation (EU) XXX/201X (section\u00a02)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0I/034 = Item 034 on the list of parts or equipment having a significant impact on the vehicle\u2019s construction safety and/or functional safety (section\u00a03)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0225 = certificate sequential number (section\u00a04)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a001 = extension level number (section\u00a05)\n\n\n\n\nAppendix\n\n\nMODEL OF THE EU AUTHORISATION CERTIFICATE\n\n\nMODEL\n\n\nMaximum format: A4 (210 \u00d7 297 mm)\n\n\nEU AUTHORISATION CERTIFICATE\n\n\n\nStamp of approval authority\n\n\n\n\n\n\nCommunication concerning:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nfor the placing on the market of parts or equipment that may pose a serious risk to the correct functioning of systems that are \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026.\n\n\nVersion(s)(2): \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026.\n\n\nSECTION III\n\n\nRequirements for:\n\n\n(a) vehicle construction safety(1): \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026.\n\n\n(b) vehicle functional safety(1): on:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Annex(es)(3) \u2026 to Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) No \u2026/\u2026, (and Annex(es)(3) \u2026(a) to Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) No \u2026/\u2026)(1), as last amended by (Commission Delegated)(1) Regulation (EU) No \u2026/\u2026(1)(4)\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a comparison of the part/equipment(1) with the safety/environmental(1) performance of the original vehicle/parts of the original vehicle(1) (explain)(1)\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026.\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026.\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\n\n\nSECTION \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026.\n\n\nNumber of test report: systems that are essential for the safety of the vehicle or its environmental performance.\n\n\nThe authorisation certificate is granted/extended/refused/withdrawn(1)\n\n\nPlace: signature\u2019 according to Directive 1999/93/EC, including data for verification): \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026.\u2026\n\n\nAttachments:\n\n\nTest applicable.\n\n\n(2)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Indicate type, variant and version in accordance with the categorisation criteria set out in Annex\u00a0II.\n\n\n(3)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The Roman numeral of the relevant Annex to the Commission Delegated Regulation or multiple Roman numerals of the relevant Annexes to the same Commission Delegated Regulation.\n\n\n(4)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Indicate the latest amendment of the Commission Delegated Regulation according to the amendment applied for the EU type-approval.\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX\u00a0XII\n\n\n\n\nSMALL SERIES LIMITS\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The number of units of one type of vehicle to be registered, sold or put into service annually in the Union shall not exceed, pursuant to Article\u00a039, the figures shown in the following table for the vehicle category in question:\n\n\n\n\n\nCategory\n\n\n\n\nUnits\n\n\n\n\n\n\nM1\n\n\n\n\n1 000\n\n\n\n\n\n\nM2, M3\n\n\n\n\n0\n\n\n\n\n\n\nN1\n\n\n\n\n1000\n\n\n\n\n\n\nN2, N3\n\n\n\n\n0\n\n\n\n\n\n\nO1, O2\n\n\n\n\n0\n\n\n\n\n\n\nO3, O4\n\n\n\n\n0\n\n\n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The number of units of one type of vehicle to be registered, sold or put into service annually in a Member State, shall be determined by that Member State but shall not exceed, pursuant to Article\u00a040, the figures shown in the following table for the vehicle category in question:\n\n\n\n\n\nCategory\n\n\n\n\nUnits\n\n\n\n\n\n\nM1\n\n\n\n\n100\n\n\n\n\n\n\nM2, M3\n\n\n\n\n250\n\n\n\n\n\n\nN1\n\n\n\n\n500 until 31October 2016\n\n\n250 from 1 November 2016\n\n\n\n\n\n\nN2, N3\n\n\n\n\n250\n\n\n\n\n\n\nO1, O2\n\n\n\n\n500\n\n\n\n\n\n\nO3, O4\n\n\n\n\n250\n\n\n\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The number of units of one type of vehicle to be registered, sold or put into service annually in a Member State shall be determined by that Member State but shall not exceed, pursuant to Article\u00a06(2) of Regulation (EU)\u00a0No\u00a01230/2012, the figures shown in the following table for the vehicle category in question:\n\n\n\n\n\nCategory\n\n\n\n\nUnits\n\n\n\n\n\n\nM2, M3\n\n\n\n\n1 000\n\n\n\n\n\n\nN2, N3\n\n\n\n\n1 200\n\n\n\n\n\n\nO3, O4\n\n\n\n\n2 000\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX\u00a0XIII\n\n\nLIST OF PARTS OR EQUIPMENT THAT ARE CAPABLE OF POSING A SIGNIFICANT RISK TO THE CORRECT FUNCTIONING OF SYSTEMS THAT ARE ESSENTIAL FOR THE SAFETY OF THE VEHICLE OR ITS ENVIRONMENTAL PERFORMANCE, THE PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS OF SUCH PARTS AND EQUIPMENT, THE APPROPRIATE TEST PROCEDURES, AND MARKING AND PACKAGING PROVISIONS\n\n\nI.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Parts or equipment having a significant impact on vehicle safety\n\n\n\n\n\nItem No\n\n\n\n\nItem description\n\n\n\n\nPerformance requirement\n\n\n\n\nTest OF EU TYPE-APPROVALS GRANTED, REFUSED OR WITHDRAWN IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE RELEVANT REGULATORY ACTS\n\n\n\nStamp of approval authority \n\n\n\nList number:\n\n\nCovering the period: \u2026 to \u2026\n\n\n\n\nThe following information shall be provided regarding each EU type-approval that has been granted, extended, refused or withdrawn in the above mentioned period:\n\n\nManufacturer:\n\n\nEU type-approval number:\n\n\nReason for extension (where applicable):\n\n\nMake:\n\n\nType:\n\n\nDate of issue:\n\n\nFirst date of issue (in the case of extensions):\n\n\nReason for refusal (where applicable):\n\n\nReason for withdrawal (where applicable):\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX\u00a0XV\n\n\nREGULATORY ACTS FOR WHICH A MANUFACTURER MAY BE DESIGNATED AS A TECHNICAL SERVICE\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Objectives and scope\n\n\n1.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0This Annex lays down the list of the regulatory acts for which a manufacturer may be designated as a technical service in accordance with Article\u00a076(1).\n\n\n1.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0It also includes appropriate provisions concerning the designation of a manufacturer as technical service, to be applied in the framework of the type-approval of vehicles, components and separate technical units concerned by Part\u00a0I of Annex\u00a0IV.\n\n\n1.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0This Annex however does not apply to manufacturers who apply for the EU type-approval of vehicles produced in small series, as referred to in Article\u00a039.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Designation of a manufacturer as a technical service\n\n\n2.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0A manufacturer designated as a technical service is a manufacturer who has been designated by the approval authority as a testing laboratory to carry out on its behalf the approval tests. \n\n\nThe expression \u2018to carry out tests\u2019 is not restricted to the measurement of performances, but also covers the registration of test results and the submission to the approval authority of a report, including the relevant conclusions.\n\n\n\n\nIt also covers the checking of compliance with those provisions that do not necessarily require measurement. This is the case for the assessment whether the design complies with the legislative requirements.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0List of regulatory acts and restrictions \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSubject\n\n\n\n\nRegulatory act reference\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4A\n\n\n\n\nSpace for mounting and fixing rear registration plates\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a01230/2012\n\n\n\n\n\n\n49A\n\n\n\n\nCommercial vehicles with regard to their external projections forward of the cab\u2019s rear panel\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a061\n\n\n\n\n\n\n50A\n\n\n\n\nMechanical coupling components of combinations of vehicles\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a055\n\n\nRestricted to the provisions included in Annex\u00a05 (up to and including paragraph\u00a08) and Annex\u00a07\n\n\n\n\n\n\n61\n\n\n\n\nAir-conditioning system\n\n\n\n\nDirective\u00a02006/40/EC\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAppendix\n\n\nDesignation of a manufacturer as technical service and subcontracting\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0General\n\n\n1.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The designation and notification of a manufacturer as a technical service shall be made in accordance with Articles\u00a072 to 86 and any subcontracting shall be done in accordance with the provisions of this Appendix.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Subcontracting\n\n\n2.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0In accordance with Article\u00a075(1), a technical service may nominate a subcontractor for performing tests on his behalf.\n\n\n2.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0For the purposes of this Appendix, the following definition shall apply:\n\n\n\u2013 'Subcontractor' means either a subsidiary of the technical service that has been entrusted by that technical service with testing activities inside its own organisation or a third party under contract with that technical service to perform test activities.\n\n\n2.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The use of the services of a subcontractor does not liberate the technical service from its obligation to comply with Articles\u00a073, 74, 84 and 85, and in particular with those concerning the skills of the technical services and compliance with Standard EN ISO/IEC 17025:2005.\n\n\n2.4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Section\u00a02 of Annex\u00a0XV shall apply to the subcontractor.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Test report\n\n\nTest reports shall be drafted in accordance with the general requirements set out in Appendix\u00a03 of Annex\u00a0V to Regulation (EU)\u00a0No\u00a0XXX/201X.\n\n\n\n\nANNEX\u00a0XVI\n\n\nCONDITIONS FOR THE USE OF VIRTUAL TESTING METHODS BY A MANUFACTURER OR A TECHNICAL SERVICE\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Objectives and scope\n\n\n\n\nThis Annex lays down provisions concerning virtual testing in accordance with Article\u00a028(4).\n\n\n.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0List of regulatory acts \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSubject\n\n\n\n\nRegulatory act reference\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3B\n\n\n\n\nRear underrun protective devices No\u00a01009/2010\n\n\n\n\n\n\n42A\n\n\n\n\nLateral protection of goods vehicles\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a073\n\n\n\n\n\n\n48A\n\n\n\n\nMasses and No\u00a0107\n\n\n\n\n\n\n52B\n\n\n\n\nStrength of the superstructure of large passenger vehicles\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a066\n\n\n\n\n\n\n57A\n\n\n\n\nFront underrun protective devices (FUPDs) and their installation; front underrun protection (FUP)\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a093\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAppendix\u00a01\n\n\nGeneral conditions for the use of virtual testing methods\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Virtual test pattern\n\n\nThe following scheme shall be used as basis structure for describing and conducting virtual testing:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0purpose;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0structure model;\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0boundary conditions;\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0load assumptions;\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0calculation;\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0assessment;\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0documentation.\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Fundamentals of computer simulation and calculation\n\n\n2.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Mathematical model\u00a0\n\n\nThe mathematical model shall be supplied by the manufacturer. It shall reflect the complexity of the structure of the vehicle, system, component or separate technical unit to be tested in relation to the requirements of the relevant regulatory act and its boundary conditions.\n\n\nThe same provisions shall apply for testing components or separate technical units independently from the vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n2.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Validation process of the mathematical model\u00a0\n\n\nThe mathematical model shall be validated against the actual test conditions.\n\n\nTo that effect a physical test shall be conducted to compare the results obtained when using the mathematical model with the results of a physical test. Comparability of the test results shall be proven. The manufacturer or the technical service shall draft a validation report and submit it to the approval authority.\n\n\nAny change to the mathematical model or to the software that is likely to invalidate the validation report shall be brought to the attention of the approval authority, which may require that a new validation process is conducted.\n\n\nThe flow chart of the validation process is shown in Appendix\u00a03.\n\n\n2.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Documentation\u00a0\n\n\nThe manufacturer shall make available to\u00a0the technical service and document the data and auxiliary tools used for simulation and calculation.\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Tools and support\n\n\nThe manufacturer shall supply the technical service at its request with the necessary tools to conduct the virtual testing, including appropriate software, or provide that technical service access to these tools.\n\n\nThe manufacturer shall also provide appropriate support to the technical service.\n\n\nThe access and support provided by the manufacturer to a technical service does not exempt the technical service from its obligations regarding the skills of its personnel, the payment of licence rights and confidentiality.\n\n\n\n\nAppendix\u00a02\n\n\nSpecific conditions for the use of virtual testing methods\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0List of regulatory acts\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nRegulatory act reference\n\n\n\n\nAnnex and paragraphs\n\n\n\n\nSpecific conditions\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3B\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation (calculation method).\n\n\n\n\n\n\n52B\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a066\n\n\n\n\nAnnex\u00a09 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a066.\n\n\n\n\nComputer simulation of rollover test on complete vehicle as an equivalent approval method.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n57A\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009\n\n\nUNECE Regulation No\u00a093\n\n\n\n\nAnnex\u00a05, paragraph\u00a03 of UNECE Regulation No\u00a093.\n\n\n\n\nResistance under a horizontal force and deflection measurement.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAppendix\u00a03\n\n\nValidation process\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX\u00a0XVII\n\n\nPROCEDURES TO BE FOLLOWED \nDURING EU MULTI-STAGE TYPE-APPROVAL\n\n\n\n\n\n1.\n\n\n\n\nObligations of manufacturers\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.1.\n\n\n\n\nThe satisfactory operation of the EU multi-stage type-approval requires joint action by all the manufacturers concerned. To this end approval authorities must ensure, before granting first and subsequent stage approvals, that suitable arrangements exist between the relevant manufacturers for the supply and interchange of documents and information, so that the completed type of vehicle meets the technical requirements of all the relevant regulatory acts referred to in Annex\u00a0IV. Such information must include details of relevant system, component and separate technical unit type-approvals and of vehicle parts that form part of the incomplete vehicle but have not yet been approved.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.2.\n\n\n\n\nEach manufacturer involved in a EU multi-stage type-approval shall be responsible for the approval and conformity of production of all systems, components or separate technical units manufactured by him or added by him to the previously built stage. The manufacturer of the subsequent stage shall not be responsible for objects that have been approved in an earlier stage, except where he modifies relevant parts to such an extent that the previously granted approval becomes invalid.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.\n\n\n\n\nObligations of approval authorities\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.1.\n\n\n\n\nThe approval authority shall:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(a)\n\n\n\n\nverify that all EU type-approval certificates issued pursuant to the regulatory acts that are applicable for vehicle type-approval cover the type of vehicle at its state of completion and correspond to the prescribed requirements;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(b)\n\n\n\n\nensure that all the relevant data, taking account of the state of completion of the vehicle, is included in the information folder;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(c)\n\n\n\n\nby reference to the documentation ensure that the vehicle specification(s) and data contained in Part\u00a0I of the vehicle information folder are included in the data in the information packages and in the EU type-approval certificates issued in accordance with the relevant regulatory acts; and in the case of a completed vehicle, where an item number in Part\u00a0I of the information folder is not included in the information package of any of the regulatory acts, confirm that the relevant part or characteristic conforms to the particulars in the information folder;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(d)\n\n\n\n\non a selected sample of vehicles from the type to be approved carry out or arrange to be carried out inspections of vehicle parts and systems to verify that the vehicle(s) is/are built in accordance with the relevant data contained in the authenticated information package in accordance with all relevant regulatory acts;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(e)\n\n\n\n\nwhere required carry out, or arrange to be carried out, relevant installation checks for separate technical units.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.2.\n\n\n\n\nThe number of vehicles to be inspected for the purposes of paragraph\u00a02.1\u00a0(d) shall be sufficient to permit the proper control of the various combinations to be EU type-approved according to the state of completion of the vehicle and the following criteria:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\u2013 engine,\n\n\n\u2013 gearbox,\n\n\n\u2013 powered axles (number, position, interconnection),\n\n\n\u2013 steered axles (number and position),\n\n\n\u2013 body styles,\n\n\n\u2013 number of doors,\n\n\n\u2013 hand of drive,\n\n\n\u2013 number of seats,\n\n\n\u2013 level of equipment\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.\n\n\n\n\nApplicable requirements\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.1.\n\n\n\n\nEU multi-stage type-approvals shall be granted on the basis of the state of completion of the type of vehicle and shall incorporate all approvals granted at earlier stages.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.2.\n\n\n\n\nFor the whole-vehicle type-approval, this Regulation (in particular the requirements of Annex\u00a0II and the particular acts listed in Annex\u00a0IV) shall apply in the same manner as if the approval would have been granted (or extended) to the manufacturer of the base vehicle. \n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.2.1\n\n\n\n\nWhere a type of system, component or separate technical unit has not been modified, the system, component or separate technical unit type-approval granted in the previous stage shall remain valid until the expiration date for the first registration, as specified in the particular regulatory act. \n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.2.2.\n\n\n\n\nWhere a type of system has been modified at the subsequent stage of completion of the vehicle, to the extent that the system has to be retested for type-approval purposes, that retesting shall be limited to only those parts of the system that have been modified or affected by the changes.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.2.3\n\n\n\n\nWhere a type of vehicle or a type of system has been modified by another manufacturer at the subsequent stage of completion of the vehicle, to the extent that, apart from the manufacturers name, the vehicle or system may still be considered as the same type, the requirement applying to existing types may still be applied as long as the date for first registration in the relevant regulatory act has not been reached.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.2.4.\n\n\n\n\nThe change of category of a vehicle shall lead to the application of the relevant requirements to the new category of vehicle. The type-approval certificates from the previous category shall be accepted provided that the vehicle complies with the same requirements as, or more stringent than, those applying to the new category.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.3.\n\n\n\n\nSubject to the agreement of the approval authority, a whole-vehicle type-approval granted to the manufacturer of the subsequent stage of completion of the vehicle does not need to be extended or revised where an extension given at the previous stage vehicle does not affect the subsequent stage or the technical data of the vehicle. However, the type-approval number including the extension of the previous stage(s) vehicle shall be copied in point\u00a01.2.2 of the certificate of conformity of the subsequent stage vehicle.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.4.\n\n\n\n\nWhere the cargo area of a complete or completed vehicle of category N or O is modified by another manufacturer for the addition of removable fittings to store and secure the cargo (for example, load space lining, storage racks and roof racks), such items can be treated as part of the pay-mass and an approval is not needed, provided both of the following conditions are met:\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the modifications do not affect the vehicle\u2019s type-approval in any way, other than an increase of the actual mass of the vehicle;\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the added fittings can be removed without using special tools.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4. \n\n\n\n\nIdentification of the vehicle\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.1.\n\n\n\n\nThe VIN, prescribed by Regulation (EU) No\u00a019/2011, shall be retained during all the subsequent stages of the type-approval to ensure the \u201ctraceability\u201d of the process.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.2.\n\n\n\n\nAt the second and subsequent stages, in addition to the statutory plate prescribed by Regulation (EU) No\u00a019/2011, each manufacturer shall affix to the vehicle an additional plate the model of which is shown in the appendix to this Annex. This plate shall be firmly attached, in a conspicuous and readily accessible position on a part not subject to replacement in use. It shall clearly and indelibly show the following information in the order listed:\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the name of the manufacturer,\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0sections 1, 3 and 4 of the EU type-approval number,\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the stage of approval,\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the VIN of the base vehicle,\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the technically permissible maximum laden mass of the vehicle where the value has changed during the current stage of approval,\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the technically permissible maximum laden mass of the combination (where the value has changed during the current stage of approval and where the vehicle is permitted to tow a trailer). \u201c0\u201d shall be used if the vehicle is not permitted to tow a trailer.\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the technically permissible maximum mass on each axle, listed in order from front to rear where the value has changed during the current stage of approval,\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0in the case of a semi-trailer or centre axle trailer, the technically permissible maximum mass at the coupling point where the value has changed during the current stage of approval.\n\n\nUnless otherwise provided for in points\u00a04.1 and 4.2 the plate shall comply with the requirements set out in Annex\u00a0I and Annex\u00a0II to Regulation (EU) No\u00a019/2011.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAppendix\n\n\nMODEL OF THE MANUFACTURER\u2019S ADDITIONAL PLATE\n\n\nThe example below is given as a guide only.\n\n\n\n\n\nMANUFACTURER'S NAME (stage\u00a03)\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne2*201X/XX*2609\n\n\n\n\n\n\nStage\u00a03\n\n\n\n\n\n\nWD9VD58D98D234560\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1\u00a0500\u00a0kg\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2\u00a0500\u00a0kg\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1 \u2013 700\u00a0kg\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2 \u2013 810\u00a0kg\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX\u00a0XVIII\nACCESS TO VEHICLE OBD AND VEHICLE REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE INFORMATION\n\n\n1.Introduction \n\n\nThis Annex lays down technical requirements for the accessibility of vehicle OBD and vehicle repair and maintenance information.\n\n\n2.Access to vehicle OBD and vehicle repair and maintenance \n\n\n2.1.A manufacturer shall put in place the necessary arrangements and procedures, in accordance with Article\u00a065, to ensure that vehicle OBD and vehicle repair and maintenance information is accessible through websites using a standardised format in a readily accessible and prompt manner, and in a manner which is non-discriminatory compared to the provisions given or access granted to authorised dealers and repairers.\n\n\n2.2.An approval authority shall only grant type-approval after receiving from the manufacturer a Certificate on Access to Vehicle OBD and Vehicle Repair and Maintenance Information.\n\n\n2.3.The Certificate on Access to Vehicle OBD and Vehicle Repair and Maintenance Information shall serve as the proof of compliance with Article\u00a068.\n\n\n2.4.The Certificate on Access to Vehicle OBD and Vehicle Repair and Maintenance Information shall be drawn up in accordance with the model set out in Appendix\u00a01 to this Annex.\n\n\n2.5.The vehicle OBD and vehicle repair and maintenance information shall include the following:\n\n\n\n\n2.5.1.an unequivocal identification of the vehicle, system, component or separate technical unit for which the manufacturer is responsible;\n\n\n2.5.2.service handbooks, including service and maintenance records;\n\n\n2.5.3.technical manuals;\n\n\n2.5.4.component and diagnosis information (such as minimum and maximum theoretical values for measurements);\n\n\n2.5.5.wiring diagrams;\n\n\n2.5.6.diagnostic trouble codes, including manufacturer specific codes;\n\n\n2.5.7.the software calibration identification number applicable to a type of vehicle;\n\n\n2.5.8.information provided concerning, and delivered by means of, proprietary tools and equipment;\n\n\n2.5.9.data record information and two-directional monitoring and test data;\n\n\n2.5.10.standard work units or time periods for repair and maintenance tasks if they are made available to authorised dealers and repairers of the manufacturer either directly or through a third party;\n\n\n2.5.11.in case of multi-stage type-approval, the information required under section\u00a03, and all other information necessary to comply with the requirements set out in Article\u00a065.\n\n\n2.6.The manufacturer shall make available to interested parties the following information:\n\n\n2.6.1.relevant information to enable the development of replacement components that are critical to the correct functioning of the OBD system;\n\n\n2.6.2.information to enable the development of generic diagnostic tools.\n\n\n2.7.For the purposes of point\u00a02.6.1., the development of replacement components shall not be restricted by any of the following:\n\n\n2.7.1.the unavailability of pertinent information;\n\n\n2.7.2.the technical requirements relating to malfunction indication strategies if the OBD thresholds are exceeded or if the OBD system is unable to fulfil the basic OBD monitoring requirements of this Regulation;\n\n\n2.7.3.specific modifications to the handling of OBD information to deal independently with vehicle operation on petrol or on gas;\n\n\n2.7.4.the type-approval of gas-fuelled vehicles that contain a limited number of minor deficiencies.\n\n\n2.8.With regard to vehicles of categories falling within the scope of Regulation No\u00a0595/2009/EC, for the purposes of point\u00a02.6.2., where manufacturers use diagnostic and test tools in accordance with ISO\u00a022900 \u2013 Modular vehicle communication interface (MVCI) \u2013 and ISO\u00a022901 \u2013 Open diagnostic data exchange (ODX) in their franchised networks \u2013, the ODX files shall be accessible to independent operators via the website of the manufacturer.\n\n\n\n\n3.Multi-stage type-approval\n\n\n3.1.In the case of a multi-stage type-approval, the final manufacturer shall be responsible for providing access to vehicle OBD and vehicle repair and maintenance information regarding its own manufacturing stage(s) and the link to the previous stage(s).\n\n\n3.2.In addition, the final manufacturer shall on its website provide independent operators with the following information:\n\n\n3.2.1.the website address of the manufacturer(s) responsible for the previous stage(s);\n\n\n3.2.2.the name and address of all the manufacturers responsible for the previous stage(s);\n\n\n3.2.3.the type-approval number(s) of the previous stage(s);\n\n\n3.2.4.the engine number.\n\n\n3.3.Each manufacturer responsible for a particular stage or stages of type-approval shall be responsible for providing through his website access to vehicle OBD and vehicle repair and maintenance information regarding the stage(s) of type-approval for which he is responsible and the link to the previous stage(s).\n\n\n3.4.The manufacturer responsible for a particular stage or stages of type-approval shall provide the following information to the manufacturer responsible for the next stage:\n\n\n3.4.1.the certificate of conformity relating to the stage(s) for which he is responsible;\n\n\n3.4.2.the Certificate on Access to Vehicle OBD and Vehicle Repair and Maintenance Information, including its appendices;\n\n\n3.4.3.the type-approval number corresponding to the stage(s) for which he is responsible;\n\n\n3.4.4.the documents referred to in points\u00a03.4.1., 3.4.2. and 3.4.3. as provided by the manufacturer(s) involved in the previous stage(s).\n\n\n3.5Each manufacturer shall authorise the manufacturer responsible for the next stage to pass the documents to the manufacturers responsible for any subsequent stages and the final stage.\n\n\n3.6.In addition, on a contractual basis, the manufacturer responsible for a particular stage or stages of type-approval shall:\n\n\n3.6.1.provide the manufacturer responsible for the next stage with access to vehicle OBD and vehicle repair and maintenance information and interface information corresponding to the particular stage(s) for which he is responsible;\n\n\n3.6.2.provide, at the request of a manufacturer responsible for a subsequent stage of type-approval, with access to vehicle OBD and vehicle repair and maintenance information and interface information corresponding to the particular stage(s) for which he is responsible.\n\n\n3.7.A manufacturer, including a final manufacturer, may only charge fees in accordance with Article\u00a067 concerning the particular stage(s) for which he is responsible.\n\n\nA manufacturer, including a final manufacturer, shall not charge fees for providing information relating to the website address or contact details of any other manufacturer.\n\n\n4.Customer adaptations\n\n\n\n\n4.1.By derogation from section\u00a02, if the number of systems, components or separate technical units subject to a specific customer adaptation is lower than 250 units produced worldwide, repair and maintenance information for the customer adaptation shall be provided in a readily accessible and prompt manner, and in a manner which is non-discriminatory compared to the provisions given or access granted to authorised dealers and repairers.\n\n\nFor the servicing and reprogramming of the electronic control units relating to the customer adaptation, the manufacturer shall make the respective proprietary specialist diagnostic tool or test equipment available to independent operators as provided to authorised repairers.\n\n\nThe customer adaptations shall be listed on the manufacturer\u2019s repair and maintenance information website and mentioned in the Certificate on Access to Vehicle OBD and Vehicle Repair and Maintenance Information at the time of type-approval.\n\n\n4.2.Manufacturers shall make the proprietary specialist diagnostic tool or test equipment to service the customer-adapted systems, components or technical units available to independent operators via sale and rent.\n\n\n4.3.The manufacturer shall mention in the Certificate on Access to Vehicle OBD and Vehicle Repair and Maintenance Information, at the time of type-approval, the customer adaptations for which the obligation under section\u00a02 to provide access to vehicle OBD and vehicle repair and maintenance information in a standardised format is derogated from and any electronic control unit related to them.\n\n\nThose customer adaptations and any electronic control unit related to them shall also be listed on the manufacturer\u2019s repair and maintenance information website.\n\n\n5.Small volume manufacturers\n\n\n5.1.By derogation from section\u00a02, manufacturers whose worldwide annual production of a type of vehicle, system, component or separate technical unit subject to this Regulation is for vehicles of category M1 and N1 less than 1000 vehicles or for vehicles of category M2, M3, N2, N3 and O less than 250 units, shall provide access to repair and maintenance information in a readily accessible and prompt manner, and in a manner that is non-discriminatory compared to the provisions given or access granted to authorised dealers and repairers.\n\n\n5.2.The vehicle, system, component and separate technical unit subject to point\u00a05.1. shall be listed on the manufacturer\u2019s repair and maintenance information website.\n\n\n5.3.The approval authority shall inform the Commission of each type-approval granted to small volume manufacturers.\n\n\n6.Requirements\n\n\n6.1.Vehicle OBD and vehicle repair and maintenance information available through websites shall follow the common standard referred to in Article\u00a065.\n\n\nThose requiring the right to duplicate or republish the information shall negotiate directly with the manufacturer concerned. Information for training material shall also be available, but may be presented through other media than websites.\n\n\nInformation on all parts of the vehicle, with which the vehicle, as identified by the VIN and any additional criteria such as wheelbase, engine output, trim level or options, is equipped by the vehicle manufacturer and that can be replaced by spare parts offered by the vehicle manufacturer to its authorised repairers or dealers or third parties by means of reference to original equipment (OE) parts number, shall be made available in a database that is easily accessible to independent operators.\n\n\nThis database shall comprise the VIN, OE parts numbers, OE naming of the parts, validity attributes (valid-from and valid-to dates), fitting attributes and, where applicable, structuring characteristics.\n\n\nThe information on the database shall be updated regularly. If this information is available to authorised dealers, the updates shall include in particular all modifications to individual vehicles after their production.\n\n\n6.2.Access to vehicle security features used by authorised dealers and repair shops shall be made available to independent operators under protection of security technology in accordance with the following requirements:\n\n\n6.2.1.data shall be exchanged ensuring confidentiality, integrity and protection against replay;\n\n\n6.2.2.the standard https//ssl-tls (RFC4346) shall be used;\n\n\n6.2.3.security certificates in accordance with ISO\u00a020828 shall be used for mutual authentication of independent operators and manufacturers;\n\n\n\n\n6.2.4.the independent operator\u2019s private key shall be protected by secure hardware.\n\n\n6.3.The Forum on Access to Vehicle Information referred to in Article\u00a070 shall specify the parameters for fulfilling these requirements in accordance with the state of the art. The independent operator shall be approved and authorised for this purpose on the basis of documents demonstrating that he pursues a legitimate business activity and has not been convicted of any criminal activity.\n\n\n6.4.With regard to vehicles falling in the scope of Regulation (EC) No\u00a0595/2009, reprogramming of control units shall be conducted in accordance with either ISO\u00a022900-2 or SAE J2534 or TMC RP1210B using non-proprietary hardware. Ethernet, serial cable or local area network (LAN) interface and alternative media like compact disc (CD), digital versatile disc (DVD) or solid state memory device for infotainment systems (e.g. navigation systems, telephone) may also be used, but on the condition that no proprietary communication software (e.g. drivers or plug-ins) or hardware is required. For the validation of the compatibility of the manufacturer-specific application and the vehicle communication interfaces (VCI) complying to ISO\u00a022900-2 or SAE J2534 or TMC RP1210B, the manufacturer shall offer either a validation of independently developed VCIs or the information, and loan of any special hardware, required for a VCI manufacturer to conduct such validation himself. The conditions of Article\u00a067(1) shall apply to fees for such validation or information and hardware.\n\n\n6.5.The requirements of point\u00a06.4. shall not apply in the case of reprogramming of speed limitation devices and recording equipment.\n\n\n6.6.All emission-related DTCs shall be consistent with Annex\u00a0XI to Commission Regulation (EC) No\u00a0692/2008\n33\n and Annex\u00a0X to Commission Regulation (EU) No\u00a0582/2011/EC\n34\n.\n\n\n6.7.For access to any vehicle OBD and vehicle repair and maintenance information other than that relating to secure areas of the vehicle, registration requirements for use of the manufacturer\u2019s website by an independent operator shall require only such information as is necessary to confirm how payment for the information is to be made. For information concerning access to secure areas of the vehicle, the independent operator shall present a certificate in accordance with ISO\u00a020828 to identify himself and the organisation to which he belongs and the manufacturer shall respond with his own certificate in accordance with ISO\u00a020828 to confirm to the independent operator that he is accessing a legitimate site of the intended manufacturer. Both parties shall keep a log of any such transactions indicating the vehicles and changes made to them under this provision.\n\n\n6.8.Manufacturers shall indicate in their repair information websites the type-approval number by model.\n\n\n7.Requirements for type-approval\n\n\n7.1.In order to receive a type-approval, the manufacturer shall submit the filled in certificate, the template of which is provided in Appendix\u00a0I.\n\n\n7.2.Where the vehicle OBD and vehicle repair and maintenance information is not available, or does not conform to the requirements of this Annex, the manufacturer shall provide that information within six months of the date of the type-approval.\n\n\n7.3.The obligation to provide information within the dates referred to in point\u00a07.2. shall apply only if, following the type-approval, the vehicle is placed on the market.\n\n\nWhere the vehicle is placed on the market more than six months after the type-approval has been granted the information shall be provided on the date on which the vehicle is placed on the market.\n\n\n7.4.On the basis of a completed Certificate on Access to Vehicle OBD and Vehicle Repair and Maintenance Information, the approval authority may presume that the manufacturer has put in place satisfactory arrangements and procedures with regard to access to vehicle OBD and vehicle repair and maintenance information, provided that no complaint has been made and that the manufacturer provides that certificate within the periods referred to in point\u00a07.2. \n\n\nIf that certificate of compliance is not provided within that period, the approval authority shall take appropriate measures to ensure compliance.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAppendix\u00a01\n\n\nManufacturer\u2019s certificate on access to vehicle OBD and \nvehicle repair and maintenance information\n\n\n(Manufacturer): \u2026\n\n\n(Address of the manufacturer): \u2026\n\n\n\n\nCertifies that \n\n\nit provides access to vehicle OBD and vehicle repair and maintenance information in compliance with the provisions of:\n\n\nArticle\u00a065 of Regulation (EU) No [\u2026\u2026] and Annex\u00a0XVIII to that Regulation\n\n\nwith respect to the types of vehicle, system, component or separate technical unit listed in attachment to this Certificate.\n\n\nThe following derogations are applied: Customer adaptations (13) \u2014 Small volume (13) \u2014.\n\n\nThe principal website address through which the relevant information may be accessed and which is hereby certified to be in compliance with those provisions are listed in an attachment to this Certificate along with the contact details of the responsible manufacturer\u2019s representative who has signed this Certificate.\n\n\nWhere applicable: The manufacturer hereby also certifies that he has complied with the obligation of Article\u00a066 of Regulation (EU) No \u2026/201.. to provide the relevant information concerning previous approvals of these types of vehicle no later than six months after the date of type-approval.\n\n\nDone at \u2026[Place]\n\n\nOn \u2026[Date]\n\n\n[Signature] [Position]\n\n\n\nAnnexes:\n\n\n\u2014 Annex\u00a0A: Website addresses,\n\n\n\u2014 Annex\u00a0B: Contact details.\n\n\n\nANNEX\u00a0A \n\n\nWebsite addresses referred to in this Certificate:\n\n\n\nANNEX\u00a0B\n\n\nContact details of the manufacturer\u2019s representative referred to in this Certificate:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAppendix\u00a02\n\n\nVehicle OBD information\n\n\n\n\n\n1.\n\n\n\n\nThe vehicle manufacturer shall provide the information required in this appendix for the purposes of enabling the manufacture of OBD-compatible replacement or service parts and diagnostic tools and test equipment.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2.\n\n\n\n\nUpon request, the following information shall be made available, on a non-discriminatory basis, to any interested manufacturer of components, diagnostic tools or test equipment:\n\n\n2.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a description of the type and number of the preconditioning cycles used for the original type-approval of the vehicle;\n\n\n2.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a description of the type of the OBD demonstration cycle used for the original type-approval of the vehicle for the component monitored by the OBD system;\n\n\n2.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a comprehensive document describing all sensed components with the strategy for fault detection and MI activation (fixed number of driving cycles or statistical method), including a list of relevant secondary sensed parameters for each component monitored by the OBD system and a list of all OBD output codes and format used (with an explanation of each code and format) associated with individual emission-related power-train components and individual non-emission related components, where monitoring of the component is used to determine MI activation. In particular, in the case of types of vehicles that use a communication link in accordance with ISO\u00a015765-4 \u2018Road vehicles \u2014 Diagnostics on controller area network (CAN) \u2014 Part\u00a04: Requirements for emissions-related systems\u2019, a comprehensive explanation for the data given in service $ 05 Test ID $ 21 to FF and the data given in service $ 06, and a comprehensive explanation for the data given in service $ 06 Test ID $ 00 to FF, for each OBD monitor ID supported, shall be provided.\n\n\nIn case other communication protocols standards are used, equivalent comprehensive explanation shall be provided.\n\n\nThis information may be provided in the form of a table, with the following column and row headings:\n\n\nComponent Fault code; Monitoring strategy; Fault detection criteria; MI activation criteria; Secondary parameters; Preconditioning Demonstration test.\n\n\nCatalyst P0420 Oxygen sensor; 1 and 2 signals; Difference between sensor 1 and sensor 2 signals; 3rd cycle Engine speed; engine load; A/F mode; catalyst temperature; Two Type 1 cycles Type 1.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3.\n\n\n\n\nInformation required for the manufacturing of diagnostic tools \n\n\nIn order to facilitate the provision of generic diagnostic tools for multi-make repairers, vehicle manufacturers shall make available the information referred to in points\u00a03.1, 3.2 and 3.3 through their repair information websites. That information shall include all diagnostic tool functions and all the links to repair information and troubleshooting instructions. The access to the information may be subject to the payment of a reasonable fee.\n\n\n3.1. Communication protocol information\n\n\nThe following information shall be required indexed against vehicle make, model and variant, or another workable definition such as the VIN or the vehicle and systems identification:\n\n\n3.1.1.any additional protocol information system necessary to enable complete diagnostics in addition to the standards prescribed in paragraph\u00a04.7.3 of Annex\u00a09B to UNECE Regulation No\u00a049, including any additional hardware or software protocol information, parameter identification, transfer functions, \u2018keep alive\u2019 requirements, or error conditions;\n\n\n3.1.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0details of how to obtain and interpret all the fault codes that do not comply with the standards prescribed in paragraph\u00a04.7.3 of Annex\u00a09B to UNECE Regulation No\u00a049;\n\n\n3.1.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a list of all available live data parameters, including scaling and access information;\n\n\n3.1.4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a list of all available functional tests, including device activation or control and the means to implement them;\n\n\n3.1.5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0details of how to obtain all component and status information, time stamps, pending DTC and freeze frames;\n\n\n3.1.6.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0resetting adaptive learning parameters, variant coding and replacement component setup, and customer preferences;\n\n\n3.1.7.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Electronic control unit (ECU) identification and variant coding;\n\n\n3.1.8.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0details of how to reset service lights;\n\n\n3.1.9.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0location of diagnostic connector and connector details;\n\n\n3.1.10.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0engine code identification.\n\n\n3.2. Test and diagnosis of OBD monitored components\n\n\nThe following information shall be required:\n\n\n3.2.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0a description of tests to confirm the functionality, at the component or in the harness;\n\n\n3.2.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0information concerning the test procedure, including test parameters and component information;\n\n\n3.2.3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0connection details, including minimum and maximum input and output and driving and loading values;\n\n\n3.2.4.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0values to be expected under certain driving conditions, including idling;\n\n\n3.2.5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0electrical values for the component in its static and dynamic states;\n\n\n3.2.6.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0failure mode values for each of the scenarios;\n\n\n3.2.7.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0failure mode diagnostic sequences, including fault trees and guided diagnostics elimination.\n\n\n3.3. Data required to perform the repair\n\n\nThe following information shall be required:\n\n\n3.3.1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0ECU and component initialisation (in the event of replacements being fitted);\n\n\n3.3.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0initialisation of new or replacement ECU\u2019s where relevant using pass-through (re-) programming techniques.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX\u00a0XIX\n\n\nCORRELATION TABLE\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Regulation (EC) No\u00a0715/2007\n\n\n\n\n\nRegulation (EC) No\u00a0715/2007\n\n\n\n\nThis \n\n\n\n\nArticle\u00a025(1)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nArticle\u00a016(2)\n\n\n\n\nArticle\u00a025(1)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nArticle\u00a016(3)\n\n\n\n\nArticle\u00a025(2)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n-\n\n\n\n\nArticle\u00a031(1)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nArticle\u00a017(1) Parliament and of the Council concerning type-approval requirements for the general safety of motor vehicles, their trailers and systems, components and separate technical units intended therefor (OJ L\u00a0196, 28.7.2010, p.\u00a05).\n\n\n\n(19)\nCommission Regulation (EU) No 1008/2010 of 9 November 2010 concerning type-approval requirements for windscreen wiper and washer systems of certain motor vehicles and implementing Regulation (EC) No 661/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council concerning type-approval requirements for the general safety of motor vehicles, their trailers and systems, components and separate technical units intended therefor (OJ L\u00a0292, 10.11.2010, p.\u00a02).\n\n\n\n(20)\nCouncil directive 92/23/EEC of 31\u00a0March 1992 relating to tyres for motor vehicles and their trailers and to their fitting (OJ L\u00a0129, 14.5.1992, p.\u00a095).\n\n\n\n(21)\nCommission Regulation (EU) No\u00a0458/2011 of 12\u00a0May 2011 concerning type-approval requirements for motor vehicles and their trailers with regard to the installation of their tyres and implementing Regulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council concerning type-approval requirements for the general safety of motor vehicles, their trailers and systems, components and separate technical units intended therefor (OJ L\u00a0124, 13.5.2011, p.\u00a011).\n\n\n\n(22)\nRegulation (EC) No 78/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 14 January 2009 on the type-approval of motor vehicles with regard to the protection of pedestrians and other vulnerable road users, amending Directive 2007/46/EC and repealing Directives 2003/102/EC and 2005/66/EC (OJ L 035, 4.2.2009, p.1).\n\n\n\n(23)\nDirective 2005/64/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 October 2005 on the type-approval of motor vehicles with regard to their reusability, recyclability and recoverability and amending Council Directive 70/156/EEC (OJ L 310, 25.11.2005, p.\u00a010).\n\n\n\n(24)\nDirective 2006/40/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 17\u00a0May 2006 relating to emissions from air conditioning systems in motor vehicles and amending Council Directive 70/156/EEC (OJ L\u00a0161, 14.6.2006, p.\u00a012).\n\n\n\n(25)\nCommission Regulation (EU) No 347/2012 of 16 April 2012 implementing Regulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council with respect to type-approval requirements for certain categories of motor vehicles with regard to advanced emergency braking systems (OJ L 109, 21.4.2012, p.\u00a01).\n\n\n\n(26)\nCommission Regulation (EU) No 351/2012 of 23 April 2012 implementing Regulation (EC) No\u00a0661/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council as regards type-approval requirements for the installation of lane departure warning systems in motor vehicles (OJ L 110, 24.4.2012, p.\u00a018).\n\n\n\n(27)\nThe explanatory notes relating to Part I of Annex IV also apply to Table 2. The letters in table 2 have the same meaning as in Table\u00a01.\n\n\n\n(28)\nCouncil Directive of 6 February 1970 on the approximation of the laws of the Member States relating to the permissible sound level and the exhaust system of motor vehicles (OJ L 42, 23.2.1970, p. 16).\n\n\n\n(29)\nCouncil Decision 97/836/EC of 27 November 1997 with a view to accession by the European Community to the Agreement of the United Nations Economic Commission for Europe concerning the adoption of uniform technical prescriptions for wheeled vehicles, equipment and parts which can be fitted to and/or be used on wheeled vehicles and the conditions for reciprocal recognition of approvals granted on the basis of these prescriptions ('Revised 1958 Agreement') (OJ L 346, 17.12.1997, p. 78).\n\n\n\n(30)\nFor subsequent amendments, see UNECE TRANS/WP.29/343.\n\n\n\n(31)\nCommission Decision 2005/50/EC on the harmonisation of the 24\u00a0GHz range radio spectrum band for the p.\u00a036).\n\n\n\n(33)\nCommission Regulation (EC) No 692/2008 of 18 July 2008 implementing and amending Regulation (EC) No 715/2007 of the European Parliament and of the Council on type-approval of p.\u00a01).\n\n\n\n(34)\nCommission Regulation (EU) No 582/2011 of 25 May 2011 implementing and amending Regulation (EC) No 595/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council with respect to
